results.description:
CityKinder is happy to support the First Annual Family Oktoberfest, an entertaining, fun-filled afternoon for all ages. Quench your thirst with authentic Oktoberfest beer and enjoy goodies from our Brooklyn-based food sponsors including Starwurst Bratwurst and Pelzer’s Pretzels. We’re putting together a lineup of great music featuring Niko and Moona Luna, an unbelievable raffle, games and activities for all. Don’t miss it!

This annual fundraising event is brought to you by the Parents Association of the German School Brooklyn to ensure that our burgeoning school can continue to grow and prosper. All proceeds will be used to build a scholarship fund and to support social and enrichment activities for our students so we can continue to build a socially responsible and economically diverse community.

Tickets are $25 for a family of 4 or $10 per person. We hope you can join us at this family-friendly event!

Register here.
results.name: Family Oktoberfest in Brooklyn | GSB Fundraiser

results.description:
We are pleased to announce Raymond Zhou will be giving a talk on React.js at 2:30 on Saturday 9/26:

Title: A better developer experience with React

Abstract:
Learn how the principles and concepts behind React can help you shorten your development feedback loop, minimize iteration times, and create fast, performant web applications. This talk will cover recent tools and patterns from Facebook and the React community that are geared towards making your projects easier.

This talk will be available at https://github.com/razh/react-intro-fall-2015.
Location: 11th floor, Deerbrook conference room


~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

The purpose of the event is to provide a common space to work on, help, and be helped by fellow coders on any topic or technology that is Javascript related. It will take place concurrently with the Saturday NYC Python Study Group in an adjacent area, and there will be ample opportunity for cross pollination between the two groups. **Note that ID is required at the door when checking in for the event with security**

More info about the Python study group: 
http://www.meetup.com/learn-python-nyc/events/mksjflytfblc
results.how_to_find_us: Sign in with security with a photo ID and take the elevator to the 11th floor. Walk through the large bronze door to the Deerbrook conference room.
results.name: Study Group: Work on individual projects and help each other code

results.description:
Our typical agenda: - We orient new visitors and then chat a bit, as by sharing what's new or good in our lives. - Then we chant and meditate together, together with the beautiful sounds of a gong - And finally we share thoughts and questions, learning something new sometimes, generally supporting each other best we can at all times.

Note that we meet every Wednesday, 7:30 to 9 pm, and every Saturday, 2 to 3:30 pm on Midchester Ave. -- except for the first Saturday of the month, when we meet elsewhere and begin our meeting at 5 pm, followed by an informal potluck social starting about 7 pm.

(When you plan on staying for the potluck, see the log-in information posted at our monthly potluck page. That helps us get healthy, balanced meals.)

By the way, the meetup page may show only a few members planning to attend a particular meeting. That's because many people attend regularly and don't bother to RSVP for each meeting.  We never have only a few members at a meeting. Twenty members more usually attend each meeting.

Call Merrill or Mataji anytime you have questions:[masked]-5334.

results.description:
Visit chashama's largest subsidized studio program.  Spread across two adjacent buildings and situated along Brooklyn's waterfront in the Sunset Park neighborhood, the studios will feature painters, sculptors, photographers, and experimental mixed media artists.

Guests can visit over 85 studios, meet the artists, explore finished art and works-in-progress, and experience the rich history of the Brooklyn Army Terminal buildings.

Subway: N, R (to 59th St. in Brooklyn) | Bus: B9, B11, B37 lines
Driving: Connect to the Gowanus Expressway (I-278). Free on-site parking.


Please meet me first so we can explore together Creative Instigator style!  Call[masked] (Leon)

results.description:
** This class is for those of you who have taken Improv Level 1 at least once. **

** If you want a longer warm-up, you can drop in for FREE on the Level 1 workshop taking place an hour before this. **

In this class, Dewey will help you take the basic elements of improv fundamentals learned in Level 1 and apply them toward building great scenes that engage an audience. 

You will learn the basic structure of comedic scenes and work on using “yes, and…” to discover and heighten the funny, understand how to make strong offers, establish who/what/where, heighten the funniest choices, and edit scenes.

If we get a consistent group, we might even consider putting on a show that you will perform in front of your friends and family as the culmination of your hard work in class.

More details here: www.PlayWithDewey.com

(We prefer that you sign up online, so we can get an accurate head count. If you can only pay in-person, please bring exact change.)
results.name: Improv: Scenework [LEVEL 2]

results.description:
My name is Arthur and I am the co-founder of the "Largest Drum Circle in the World" for Peace and Global Unity Starting in your Own Community.
I hope you will join us, on this Global initiative, to use drum circles from all over the world to plant the seeds of peace in the minds of many. This is about getting all the Drum Circles locally and globally to participant in this 24 hour Global event on Sat. Sept. 26th 2015.
So, I hope you will join us in creating your own Drum Circle event on that day .

http://largest-drum-circle-in-the-world.com/ 

Please mark your calendar

September 26, 2015 is a Saturday  We will be drumming that day. Anytime in a 24hr time span, so all the countries can join in.

This is the date for all of us to have a drum Circle all over the World to Drum for Peace and Global Unity starting in your own Community.

Where ever you are in this world plan a Drum Circle in your Country to promote Peace and Global Unity and make sure you post it here for all of us to know.

It is never too soon to start thinking and planning for your 
Largest Drum Circle in the World Drumming for World Peace and Global Unity event for Saturday, September 26, 2015

Please start letting your friends know and work towards 
creating an event that will bring people to together for us to plant the seeds 
of peace in their hearts. And when you do, please schedule a Meetup here so everyone can know when and where yours will be.Please add yourself to the Invite List and include your Facebook Friends and Family to this Invite List. This way we will have a count of all who intend to participate at our Global Peace event: 
https://www.facebook.com/events/833474153361316/

As important as the event is, so is generating public awareness 
by promoting this in any of the media that you have access to, Facebook, twitter, 
newspapers, radio, YouTube and your local TV stations.

If you shoot a video and post it in YouTube please title it with the name of the Country/city "Largest Drum Circle in the World" 2015  so it is easy for everyone to find.

If you have ideas on how to make this the best event 
possible, please post it on the discussion board or email me at:

[masked] 

Thank You,

Arthur Lopez

Co-Founder of the Largest Drum Circle in the World 

Make sure you post it on our Facebook Site:

https://www.facebook.com/groups/drumwithus/
results.name: Join in on the Global event for Peace "Largest Drum Circle in the World"

results.description:
This Event: 

The aim of this weekly event is to offer a place where Python developers and learners can come and ask questions or give help. 

Individuals of all programming skill levels are welcome. 

It is suggested that you bring your own laptop. If you don't have access to a laptop and want to attend, please let Paul Logston know and he will see about getting you a laptop for the day.

This event is free. 

This event is not a tutorial. Tutorials hosted by Learn Python NYC are labeled as tutorials.

Resources:

Here are some learning resources and free text editor / IDE suggestions.

https://github.com/logston/NYCPythonSOH/blob/master/resources.rst 

Detailed Directions to us:

As you enter the building located at 568 Broadway, New York, NY 10012 you will need to provide ID and your destination (Fueled Collective, 11th Floor) to the front desk. They will provide you with a sticker badge. Take one of the elevators (located to the right of the front desk) to the 11th floor. We will be in the Deerbrook conference room.
results.how_to_find_us: Show ID at front desk, come up to 11th floor, we are in the Deerbrook conference room!

results.description:
Lecture and Meditation: More details coming soon!

"All religions are precious pearls strung on the golden thread of divinity" - Samael Aun Weor

In this tradition, which we call “Gnosis,” we study all the religions of the world, because every religion, every mystical tradition, comes from the same root, which was the experience of its founder. 

Any genuine religion, mystical tradition, or type of spirituality is an attempt to communicate something of value and importance, which is that there is a purpose to life that one can experience for oneself. 

This is a free workshop.

All our courses and workshops are free. We hope to provide the opportunity for anyone interested in delving deeper to uncover for themselves the mystical and esoteric side of life.

Donations are welcome and go to help on-going efforts of holding free spiritual events in Brooklyn.

Please RSVP - See you there!

results.description:
THE HATTIE CARTHAN COMMUNITY MARKET

INVITES YOU TO ATTEND OUR FOOD JUSTICE REVIVAL

JOIN FARMER YON AND HER YOUTH CREW AS WE EXPLORE THE FOOD SYSTEM AND LEARN HOW FOOD IS CONNECTED TO HEALTH,  JUSTICE AND THE ENVIRONMENT

Admission is FREE – All ages welcome

TIME: September 29th[masked]pm – 4pm

Communal Dinner and Talking Circle 430 pm – 6pm

Place: Hattie Carthan community market[masked] Clifton Place (Behind market)

Directions: G – Bedford /Nostrand B38 to Marcy & Lafayette Aves

Have you made the connection of health as wealth?

Would you like to understand the journey of food from seed to seed and learn more about how you can address inequities in the food system? 

Are you someone who thinks deeply about the ingredients on your plate and where it comes from?

Do you yearn to see fresh food in every community regardless of who lives there?

Have you wondered what the word food system really means? Have you ever felt like food advocates and policy makers speak a different language?

Come join us as we demystify and decode the food system/food justice so that we all can engage in the work of creating a Just Food system.

Supporters: DOHMH, Hattie Carthan community market

www.hattiecarthancommunitymarket.com –click on our food justice resource Page Email: [masked]
results.name: Hattie Carthan "FOOD JUSTICE REVIVAL"

results.description:
Will there be a yoga mat for me ? 

No, you should bring your own yoga mat or a towel or a blanket. Whatever is available.

Can I text or call the Organizer ?

Yes, if you have a question which is not answered in here, you can text or call him.

[masked] 

Oh, OK. Let me RSVP then but i'm not sure if i'm going to make it there.

Well, RSVP only if you are really going to make it to the class. 
Besides emergency situations, members who RSVP and don't show up will be removed from the group.

I'm not sure if i can make it on time. Can I come later ?

Short answer is NO.We encourage everyone to attend the classes which are free. All you need to do is show up on time.  

What kind of yoga class this will be ?

It's based on Patanjali's 8-limbs-system which is gentle yet very effective-take a look at  group reviews-. We will start with breathing & Bioenergy techniques, and continue with standing poses and other pose groups. Before meditation and deep relaxation, we will also have 5 min free time that you can practice any asana you would like. The Instructor will be helping with the postures. 

I am a beginner and i have never tried yoga before. Can i join you guys ?

Beginners are welcome !!! 

Great, how am i going to get there ? where do you guys meet ? 

LOCATION PICTURES ARE HERE(where we meet and practice): 


http://www.meetup.com/The-Original-Yoga-System-Classes-are-finally-in-NYC/photos/26108446/
results.how_to_find_us: Enter the park from the 72nd street. Look at your left-hand side. Did you see the benches ? OK, we are there !

Calling all Chocoholics!, Chocolate Lovers, and the Chocolate Gift Givers!

Join us for another successful Chocolate tour of Manhattan!. Last time we focused on the Chocolate shops in downtown Manhattan, this time we will stop into a few of the shops around Midtown to discover, and hopefully sample many fabulous, delicious Chocolates.

The idea is to sample Chocolates from Belgium, Switzerland, France, and Italy.  We will visit, La Maison du Chocolat,  Neuhaus, Leonidas, Teuchers, Lindt, and Li-Lac to Name a few.

As the weather is cooling off and Autumn is approaching, it is nice to be outdoors doing active meetups.  There may be one more outdoor  meetup until the weather gets too cold..

Please RSVP early so I can give the shops a head count. If they prepare samples, I to give them an idea so they can prepare ahead for us.

Plus ones are counted as confirmed. Please try to keep your commitment.

I know things come up but let's try to confirm ahead if possible.

Some of us may want to go for cocktails and dinner afterwards,

stay tuned for a follow up email..Location , Time, TBA.

I look forward to seeing you all for a fun, active, and delicious event on a Saturday afternoon, what could be better? :)
results.name: A Chocolate Tour and Sampling Through Midtown Chocolatiers

September shows open the art season and are always the most enticing. Let's stroll through Chelsea and check out what the new season has in store for us.


GALLERY LIST

Tanya Bonakdar Gallery 521 W  21 Street

Sean Kelly Gallery 537 & 535 W  22nd Street

Asya Geisberg Gallery 537b W 23rd Street

Pace 534 W 25th Street

The FLAG Art Foundation 545 W 25th Street, 9th Floor

...if anybody at any point during the walk sees something they want to see, stop us and we will go see what caught your attention—the group size for this event has been limited for this very reason.  It does not matter if we see all the galleries I WANT to see.  What matters is for everybody to see at least one thing they will take with them and remember.


PLEASE NOTE:
Videos are art just like everything else shown in a gallery.  This group will always allow time to watch videos, and if you have a problem with waiting for somebody who is watching a video, please DO NOT RSVP for our gallery walks.

Galleries are free of charge.

results.description:
Bossam is a pork dish in Korean cuisine. The centerpiece is pork belly, boiled in spices and thinly sliced.

The meat is served with side dishes including garlic, onion, ssamjang (wrap sauce), saeujeot (pickled, fermented shrimp) and newly made kimchi. Upon eating, the meat and sides are often wrapped in vegetable leaves such as red lettuce, sesame or napa cabbage, hence the literal meaning of Bossam: "wrapped" or "packaged." Bossam is a popular dish in Korea, often served as anju (dishes that accompany alcohol consumption).

***Please note***

- Please give me your email address and phone number right after RSVP then we will send you an invoice from Paypal when we can pay through that.

-Class will start at 3pm so please don't be late. please be in the class at least 10minutes early.
results.name: Let's Cook 보쌈(Bossam: Braised Pork Belly with Fresh Bossam Kimchi)

results.description:
Central Park is a three dimensional work of art with the intended effect of “refining and elevating people’s spirit.” Come explore the souther section of the most visited public space in all of the United States and connect your understanding of it with the monuments that define the spaces we cover on this tour.

Itinerary:
• Grand Army Plaza
• Doris Friedman Plaza
• Central Park Zoo
• The Mall
• Bethesda Terrace and Fountain
• Strawberry Fields
• And Much More

Reservations:
Please RSVP. If you later realize you will not be able to attend please change your reservation.

Where:
Participants meet with the guide ten minutes before tour begins by the Pulitzer Fountain in front of the Plaza Hotel (between 58th & 59th Sts. and 5th Av.) map here. Tour concludes on Central Park West and 72nd St). map here.

Cost:
This tour has a market value of $20 per person. You are not charged. At the end of the tour you can put a value to the information presented in the form of a gratuity.

Some of the Sights we will experience:

Central Park is a landmark to remember. Connect your memory of it to works of art that will be there for time immemorial.

results.name: The Art and Culture of Central Park

results.description:

The Rugby World Cup is underway and it's been a wild one so far. A lot of games are available live at McHale's Bar on 51st St and 8th Ave but we're highlighting this one as it's a HUGE clash in the group and it's at a very nice time at 3pm.

results.description:
I keep an eye on the weather and the field.  In the case of inclement weather - I try to make a determination as early as possible - preferably 24+ hours in advance, or by noon the day of if it's still questionable.  If we are not meeting, I will actually cancel the event page and send out an email.  If you are not signed up to receive emails, check the site, or text me[masked]


Basic Ground Rules for Participation


• no need to respond at all if you can't/don't want to play

• if you do respond IN, please come unless something really urgent comes up (hangovers or better offers from your cooler friends not accepted for absences!)


• If you suck at Ultimate... you are more than welcome. This is open to ALL skill levels, ages etc.   If you're really good, please pretend you suck every once in a while for the benefit of the rest of us! We're just here to run around and have fun. We all want to score and win but if you want to win at all costs, this is not the game for you.

• The trick with this group is making sure we have enough to play, so those who do show up don't waste a trip, so please make the effort this year to be honest with yourself and us about if you can/want to come down so we can make the right call for GAME ON or GAME OFF.  If you are a "maybe" please indicate that via the comment section with a brief explanation (ie 80% chance I'll be there...).  If you RSVP and are then unable to attend, please update your RSVP as soon as possible.



What is Ultimate Frisbee?  In a nutshell <borrowed from Wiki> :

Ultimate is a limited-contact team field sport played with a disc (frisbee). Points are scored by passing the disc to a teammate in the opposing end zone. Other basic rules are that players must not take steps while holding the disc (maintain a pivot), and interceptions and incomplete passes are turnovers.

Closest analogy I could come up with = a mix of basketball and football, but played with a frisbee.  You do not need to be an expert frisbee player/thrower etc. - it's all about having fun.

Come on down to the Colorado Cafe, New Jersey's premiere country dance club and sports bar.  This event usually sells out and is a night you won't want to miss!

When 8minuteDating gets started, you'll have four 8-minute one-on-one conversations with singles in your age group followed by a 20-minute intermission where you can mix and mingle with other singles (from this and its sister events - ages 35 - 49 & 45 - 59) that might have caught your eye. After the intermission, you'll have four more 8-minute dates. That's 8 great dates in one fun night!

You'll enjoy delicious complimentary appetizers, ice breaker games, a cash bar and lots of raffle prizes.  Plus after you've met all of your dates, you can be our guest (a $10 value) in the dance hall for a great night of country dancing.  There will be free dance lessons, a country dj, a live rock band in the sports bar and an amazing night for everyone!

results.description:
Show Us What You Got! Saturday, September 26th 

With Special Mentoring Guest Artist Mary Wilshire!

Mary Wilshire Magnusson is well-known for her early work in the comic book industry, with numerous projects for Marvel and DC Comics, Heavy Metal and National Lampoon. Mary has also provided illustrations for many more mainstream publications, such as Good Housekeeping, National Geographic, Readers Digest, Parents Magazine, The New York Daily News, Time Life Books and numerous others.

Mary worked in the underground women's comics movement, in the early 1980's. She works in many mediums and has produced wonderful and imaginative stand-alone illustrations in line art, pastels, watercolor and marker - some exhibited in museums and galleries, and many in the hands of fortunate collectors. Mary even designed the Blues Brothers logo and many character drawings for the WWF!

http://www.guzzo.com/wilshire/

Ticket Information: http://goo.gl/WWskft

results.description:
“The greatest deception [people] suffer is from their own opinions.”

                                                        --Leonardo da Vinci

People often talk about how others are self-deluded, not “correctly” seeing “reality,” misinterpreting information and facts.  But what if we’re all self-deluded and we just don’t know it?  (Or maybe we’re self-deluded about how well we can assess our self-delusions!)


Well, for one night, we will deliberate, discuss, debate, and challenge each other to consider these and other related considerations about self-delusion. 

In particular, we will explore the ways in we (unknowingly) deceive ourselves, some cognitive and emotional reasons why we do this, and possible ways we can counteract these tendencies. 

Some of the questions we will consider include, but are not limited to:

·  Why do people believe weird things?

·  How can our prior knowledge both help and hinder our perceptions and interpretations of new experiences? 

·  How is it possible that the same cognitive processes—such as drawing inferences and making conclusions, synthesizing information from various sources, and analyzing and evaluating information—lead us to both “accurate” and “reliable” knowledge and also misunderstandings and misconceptions? 

·  Is it possible to know when and how we are deceiving ourselves? Is it even possible for us to see ourselves more clearly?

 ·  What counteractive strategies might help us to see ourselves, others, and the world around us more accurately and reliably?

Structure of the Discussion:

We will start by defining and establishing what self-delusion means and what examples of it could be.  (It would be great if you could bring some real-life examples of people who you think have deluded themselves, or, even better, personal examples!)

We will then discuss why and how people delude themselves.

We will consider whether and how we can counteract these cognitive tendencies.

We will reflect on the implications and applications of our discussion for our lives and the lives of those around us. 

We will make conscientious efforts and an official commitment to delude ourselves less and less everyday! 

VENUE:  Bread and Butter, (Corner of E. 29 St and Park South)
results.how_to_find_us: Corner of E. 29 St and Park South.  Meet us at the 2nd floor Mezzanine.  Stairwell, back right of the deli.
results.name: How Do We Deceive Ourselves?  Is It Possible to See Ourselves More Clearly?

results.description:
A recreational tap class for adults in a bar! 21+

4:00 pm Lesson I (perfect for beginners)

5: pm Lesson II (more advanced, tap shoes required)

$10 for one session, $17 for both!

$1 off all drinks at the bar. 
Please arrive 5-10 min before session to sign-in and get a drink.

If you have never tapped before or if it's been a while since you have, please come to Session I. This session introduces you to tap basics such as shuffles and flaps and then puts these skills into a fun, easy combination. (This can also be used as a warm-up for Session II). If you don't have tap shoes, please wear or bring closed-toe shoes such as sneakers.

If you own tap shoes and have at least a basic knowledge of tap fundamentals, you are welcome to attend Session II. This session moves faster than Session I and uses more advanced steps such as drawbacks and pullbacks in a fun, more advanced combination.

If you have any questions, please do not hesitate to ask!

results.description:
Join other writers for an hour of focused writing!

4:00 - Show up early, stake out a spot and either socialize or get a jump on writing.
4:15 - Start. Introductions, and we'll share what we're working on.
4:30 - Get down to business. An hour of silence and solid writing!
5:30- Brief follow up. People are encouraged to share experiences & ideas, network or take off as they like.

If you're spending too much time THINKING about writing, come and join us for a session of focused writing. No one will see what you've written or give you unsolicited advice.

WHERE: Milk and Honey Cafe located at 1119 Newkirk Ave. The closest train station is Newkirk Plaza on the Q line. Walk 3 block down Newkirk Avenue until you reach Westminster Road. We are sitting at the table in the back.

SOME TIPS:

Laptops are welcome. Remember to charge your laptop ahead of time.

Please buy something to support this organic cafe. It would make the owner smile.

Come on time! If you come late, we will have already started.
Bring headphones if you don't want outside noise distraction.

RSVP only if you can make it, and update as soon as possible if your plans change.

You will see progress in your writing project by spending the minimum of a single hour per week on it. This is your practice/focus time, so I hope to see you there.

Don't know where to begin, read this.

http://gaiateabrew.com/leonbell/wp-content/uploads/2014/03/Mini-Guide-to-Writing.pdf

results.description:
Hi everyone!

Please be there 15 minutes earlier so you can get set up. Also, please bring a white t-shirt, a red t-shirt, lots of water and be ready to have fun!

We also created a map of the field location since it can be tricky to find: Field Location Map.


If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!


Thank you,

Paul

Details Below:

------------------------------------------------------

Game style and Rules:

HAVE FUN!!! It's SOCCER

We'll play (2) 30-minute games.

We will divide into teams based on everyone's experience and skills.

No ball hogging

The games are very laid back; rough play, tackles or sliding are not allowed and will not be tolerated.

If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Field Location:Field F in Central Park  can be accessed from west 97th street or east 97th street on either side Central Park. We also created a map of the field location since it can be tricky to find: Field Location Map

Directions: By train: From the West side take the B or C to 96th street stop. From the east side take the 6 train to 96th street stop St.

Time: The game will start at the scheduled time. Please be there 15 minutes earlier so we can get set up.

Late arrivals: If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Fee: Please pay the fee through paypal. Part of the proceeds go to NYC SOCCER KIDS (we already donated new soccer balls). It also goes to pay for the site admistration, meet-up fees, cones, soccer balls, and the new goals.

Please bring: A white t-shirt and a red t-shirt to differentiate players of each team. Please bring turf shoes, sneakers or all terrain shoes; cleats are not allowed!

Cancellations/Refunds: If you won't be able to make it to the game, please change your RSVP to "NO" 48 hours before kickoff time to receive a credit for a future game. This is done to give other members a chance to take your spot. Thank you!

Waiting List: If all the spots are taken, please get on the waiting list. If a spot opens up and you are on the waiting list, you will receive an automated e-mail letting you know that a spot has openned up:). Please RSVP as soon as you get that e-mail since everyone on the waiting list will get the same e-mail. The first person who RSVP's takes the spot! Also check our Calendar for other games

Weather Policy: Games will be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe such as snow, sleet or thunderstorms. If the game is cancelled I will send out an e-mail the morning of the game. Please check your e-mail. If you are unsure, or can't get to your e-mail, you can also text me or call me at[masked]-5725.

See you on the pitch!

Paul

results.description:
Calling all women ballers for our way past due installment of women's games!

We rent out the gym from 5:00-8:00pm. 

Please arrive at least 5-10 minutes early as the sooner everyone arrives, the sooner we can begin playing. Note that all games stop at 7:45pm as we have to be out of the gym by 8:00pm. (If you get there late, please only ring the bell once. It is very loud! And it takes us a few minutes to get downstairs.) The gym is on the 10th fl. & has adjoining bathrooms, lockers, and water fountains.

We'll hit up McSwiggans (393 2nd Avenue @ 23rd St) later! 

Don't forget:

* You must be no more than 5'8" to play!

* You must RSVP on the site in order to attend!

* You will be asked to sign a waiver for 2014 as we're not a litigious group. 

If you have any problems with the prepay, just shoot one of the organizers an email.

Here are the basic rules we follow for games:

1. Play by ones and twos to 11 - win by one point.

2. Make it - take it.

3. Backcourt if the ball hits the rim or backboard. Air balls are fair game to put right back up.

4. Jump balls/disputed calls will be determined by a three pointer since the laws of basketball physics are very clear that "the ball never lies."

5. Walls, half-court line, and ceiling are out of bounds.  

6. Subs will enter the game no later than 6 points in (once one of the teams reaches 6 points). The sub will start the following game. Teams will regulate themselves but let's make sure everyone plays.

See you on the court! B-)

results.description:
PICK-UP CO-ED SOCCER GAMES @ CHELSEA PARK  

                                     Check our Facebook page:

          facebook.com/ManhattanInternationalCoedSoccer


                                NO CLEATS OR STUDS ALLOWED

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cR_TuiCA8RM

GAME DESCRIPTION:

Our games are for all levels and people that prefer to play a non-competitive game of soccer, break a sweat while exercising running up and down the field with the ball and all this happening in a very laid-back and non-judgmental environment. Please, arrive 10 minutes before the game so we can get the teams set up.

Game Format:

We'll play three simultaneous games of 8 on 8, with small goals. There will be 6 teams on the field and we will play THREE games, 30 minutes/game. Every 30 minutes we will have a short break and teams will switch to play against different team. Please check our meetup message board on Friday night or before 12.00 pm on Saturday to see what team you are on. This will save us a lot of time on the field.

RULES OF THE GAME:

First and most important rule of the game is to have fun and enjoy the time on the field! Rough play and offensive language will absolutely not be tolerated!!! In plain words, no slide tackling, no pushing and no telling off.

No power shots allowed. No power shots means; you can shoot the ball but not as hard as you can. This doesn't mean that you can not take the shot at all. Kicking the ball or taking the shot on the goal, is of course allowed.

***If you don't sign up for the game, do not show up.***

If you are late for the game, you must wait until the game in progress is over to join your team.

Those that don't comply with these rules, will kindly be asked to leave the field so others can enjoy the game and maybe a two game ban.

Any other questions regarding the rules of the game or anything else, should be directed to the organizer directly or to the assistant organizer/s!!!

Location:

CHELSEA PARK.

Between 27th and 28th street and 10th Avenue.

Take A, C or E to 23rd St and 8th Ave and walk to 10th Ave and 27th St or any subway line to 34th St and Penn Station and walk for about 8 minutes to 28th St and 10th Ave.

What to bring with you:

A pair of sneakers, indoor or turf shoes, shin guards (recommended) and lots of water. There is a water fountain next to the park if you need extra water.

Fee:

You will be asked to pay $9.25 when you RSVP. This $9.25 is used to pay for, facilities permits, meetup fees, Amazon fees, goals, cones, soccer balls etc.

Refunds & Weather Policy:

Refunds will be issued if the RSVP is changed by Wednesday before 12.00PM or if the game is cancelled. The game can be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe like heavy rain, snow or thunder.

After the game we'll go to Molly Wee for a pint or two:

                             Molly Wee Restaurant

                                       402 8th Ave, 

                                 New York, NY 10001

                                    (212)[masked]

                            PLEASE CHECK THEIR MENU!

                                      themollywee.com

results.description:
You know me...I go head over heels for fast paced night hikes with nice views, food and great company at the summit:)

PLEASE NOTE:  The hike location and time may change as we get closer depending on weather and interest. 

September 27th is the first day of Korean Thanksgiving (Chuseok). Other Asian cultures have Harvest festivities on this day as well. Let's catch the sunset, eat, drink, chat and end the night gazing at the moon and the stars.

PLEASE PLAN ON BRINGING FOOD AND BEVERAGES TO SHARE!

I think it would be fun to have an Asian food and drinks theme, but you're welcome to bring whatever you like.

++


NOTE: You are responsible for bringing appropriate gear, supplies, clothing, first aid, and lights. You should review topographic maps and trail features carefully; understanding topography of any hike is key to your knowing where you are, where you're going, and how to get back. See suggestions for GEAR on the "About" page for additional gear ideas.

You agree when you sign up for this group or any of the events that you have read and understand the below.

If you join us for a hike (or any other event), please understand that you are responsible for your own preparedness and well-being and will hold no one else liable in case of injury or mishap. You agree not to hold the Organizer, Assistant Organizers, or any other members responsible for any injuries, mishaps, or any other situation that may happen at a planned event. You are responsible to research the event, know the area, and bring the proper gear.

Your attendance on a hike signifies that you have read and accept the terms of this liability waiver. Full waiver can be found on the ABOUT page.

The samba for beginners’ class starts with a 30-minute warm up that exercises basic isolation of the body, following by stretching and strengthening exercises. After the warm up, Danielle introduces the students samba no pé (basic samba step) and passo marcado (simple choreographies) typical of the Rio Carnival. The whole class happens in the sound of the upbeat and irresistible Brazilian music.

The class will be held on Saturday from 5-6:30pm and costs $18.

Come with comfortable clothes and be prepared to be barefoot.

About the instructor:

Danielle Lima was born in Rio de Janeiro and grew up performing with Beija-Flor de Nilópolis, one of Brazil’s most famous samba schools. Danielle Lima is also a Certified Teachers Artist of the program Dancing Classrooms from American Ballroom Theater, Certified YOGA Instructor at YOGA Effects in NYC and Karma Kids Yoga certified teacher.

For more information, contact Danielle Lima daniellelima13@ hotmail.com.

results.description:
Pipeline Theatre Company presents:

The Gray Man, by Andrew Farmer
directed by Andrew Neisler

"The Gray Man isn’t real. He’s a ghost story, a boogeyman mothers make up tales about to keep their children safe.

A grieving young man named Simon listens to these bedtime stories outside his apartment window and yearns to leave the city he’s so afraid of. But when he meets a little girl with an old soul who speaks of missing children, Simon can’t help but feel trapped in his tenement house, where a familiar shadow waits in the darkness."

Buy your tickets now for this early evening show at: http://www.brownpapertickets.com/event/2183017

(Be sure to select the correct date & time: Saturday, September 26, 5pm)

Afterwards we can have dinner nearby and discuss the play.

results.description:
This meetup is meant to empower people to take more responsibility over their own health, not to use these concepts to replace common sense or avoid professional allopathic medical opinion. However, you will learn that it is still just an opinion, as you will be presented with other potentially valid perspectives.

          Please do not go out and simply buy the products I refer to so you could experiment on yourself blindly. The information that I will be presenting is not mine. I do not recommend using any of it. I am just letting you know what is out there and what others do, talk and write about. I will reference the sources for this information.

          I have used and continue to use almost all, if not all the products I will be talking about. This does not mean you should do what I do. I will only be sharing my own personal experiences. Please see a qualified healthcare practitioner such as a naturopathic physician, or holistic chiropractor/medical doctor to get their opinions. Everyone's body is different and you may have to take into consideration medications, known/unknown allergies, body sensitivities and your overall state of health.

Topics to be discussed:

1)  Natural Antibiotics:  Preventing and eliminating colds so your co-workers won't feel the need to keep their distance. Avoiding and reducing fevers within minutes. Dealing with acute or chronic ear infections. Eliminating pink eye quickly so you don't look like a zombie. Preventing and reducing the intensity of infections that might lead to bronchitis, strep throat and/or pneumonia.

2)  Natural Antivirals: Preventing viral induced fevers and influenza so you won't be afraid to leave the house to a congested subway station. Mitigating symptoms of influenza once you have it. Avoiding stomach viruses when everyone around you is dropping like flies. What if you are already laid up in bed and can't stray far from the bathroom?

3)  Natural anti-parasitic agents: Intestinal parasites/worms.

4)  Foreign Travel Emergencies: Enjoying your overseas vacation without living in the bathroom or the hospital by preventing diarrhea and controlling it's duration. Never be afraid of eating at a local foreign restaurant. Portable water purification before you drink the water is ideal, but what if you just realized you drank the local sewage. Learn how so many people cured themselves of Malaria even with a severe fever within days.

5)  Respiratory Issues: Acute asthma triggered by a virus (flu) vs. acute asthma triggered by external allergens.

6)  Musculoskeletal Issues: Options for significant bumps and bruises. Acute sprains. What if you got rear ended a week ago and can barely move today?

results.description:
The finale event for New York City's 2015 Bisexual Awareness Week (Sept 20-26). A staged reading of the play "My Brother's a Keeper," a period play about Blackness and bisexuality in New York City.

“My Brother’s a Keeper” is a new play, written by Dr. Herukhuti, that puts bisexuality in Black communities front and center. Set in Fort Greene and Bedford-Stuyvesant, Brooklyn NY in the 1990s, “My Brother’s A Keeper” depicts a weekend in the lives of Kevin, Basil, Cecil, Mona and Charlene a group of friends who are living their dreams. 


Admission is free but due to limited seating, we are able to make fifty (50) general admission seats available to the public. Tickets are now available for the reading. Please get your tickets ASAP to secure a seat

https://www.eventbrite.com/e/my-brothers-a-keeper-staged-reading-tickets-18436173090

This event is cosponsored by:

BiNet USA, FluidBiDesign, S.I.S.T.A.H., Bi Writers Association, BiRequest, LivingBi, In The Life Archive at the Schomburg Center for Research in Black Culture, BiUsTV, NYU LGBTQ Student Center, and Lambda Literary Foundation.
results.name: Bi Awareness Week Event - My Brother's A Keeper

results.description:
After we work up an appetite at the Chile Pepper festival we will move our way over to BERGN. We will leave Washington Street Exit of the Garden. We will walk down Classon until we reach BERG'N

If you don't want to join us for the walk. You can just meet us at BERG'N @ 899 Bergen. I suspect it will take us 30 to 45 minutes to complete the walk.

At BERG'N there are several food options including Mighty Quinn, Asia Dog, Samesa, and BUNK*R. There is also wine and beer available. Afterwards if there is enough interest we will hit another bar.

As always you can reach me on my cell[masked]
results.name: Explore Crown Heights + BERGN + Maybe Drinks

results.description:
The Cooper Hewitt is PAY WHAT YOU WISH on Saturdays from 6pm to 9pm. We'll meet at a nearby cafe before heading over to the museum. I'll send an email to attendees a couple days before the event with details.

If people are up for it, we may head out for a drink/bite afterwards...

DAVID ADJAYE SELECTS

Architect David Adjaye presents West and Central African textiles from the museum’s permanent collection. Hailed as an architect with an artist’s sensibility and with projects underway on four continents, Adjaye is known for combining the aesthetics of his African heritage with classic, modernist design. In exploring Cooper Hewitt’s collection, he has created a dialogue between the museum’s textiles and his own “library of patterns” that he draws on as a source of inspiration in his work. Having lived in Africa as a child and visited each of the continent’s 54 nations as an adult, Adjaye is deeply affected by the importance of textiles in the visual culture of Africa, whose forms and patterns are often reflected in his buildings.

PROVOCATIONS: THE ARCHITECTURE & DESIGN OF HEATHERWICK STUDIO

Provocations is the first museum exhibition to introduce the imaginative work of British designer Thomas Heatherwick and his London-based studio to an American audience. Heatherwick is known for his unique design concepts ranging from products, infrastructure and temporary structures, to large-scale architecture projects around the world.

HOW POSTERS WORK

How Posters Work shows how dozens of different designers—from prominent pioneers to lesser-known makers—have mobilized principles of composition, perception and storytelling to convey ideas and construct experiences.

Featuring more than 125 posters from Cooper Hewitt’s permanent collection, the exhibition demonstrates how some of the world’s most creative designers have employed design principles to produce powerful acts of visual communication.

The exhibition is organized into 14 subsections: focus the eye, overwhelm the eye, use text as image, overlap, cut and paste, assault the surface, simplify, tell a story, amplify, double the meaning, manipulate scale, activate the diagonal, make eye contact and make a system.
results.how_to_find_us: We'll meet at a nearby cafe before heading over to the museum. I'll send an email to attendees a couple days before the event with details.
results.name: Cooper Hewitt Design Museum: 3 Exhibits!!!

results.description:
These are very similar to our  Lets Draw! meetups but the difference of this style of meetup is that it'll be alot more focused and immersive on a very specific theme we will work on together as a group.

In today's challenge we will focus on drawing Dragons in various different styles and environments. 

The meetup will be split into three parts: First sketches and warm-up exercises/conceptual discussion, then an hour and a half drawing your chosen idea and design, lastly we'll discuss each others drawings and ideas as a group.

So don't forget to bring your supplies and sketchbook as this meetup is going to be drawing focused! Also if you'd like to share any art or reference books with the group relating to the theme I urge you to bring them.

You can find me at the tables on the second floor of the Cranberry Cafe.

I hope to see you there and having fun participating in this new style of meetup and exercising or developing your drawing and conceptual skills with other imaginative artists throughout NYC.
results.name: Conceptual Challenge! Theme: Dragons

results.description:
Join other single professionals for an early evening happy hour, topped off with about* 7-10 rounds of "mini-dates." You'll meet each member of the opposite sex for 5-7 minutes each (depending on the size of the event - EXPECT TO MEET 7 TO 12 MEMBERS OF THE OPPOSITE SEX*), turn in your dating card and then we'll send you the contact info of your mutual matches 48 hours later. On average, 80% of those who attend end up with at least one or two mutual matches.

Get the full details below.

* We run 3-5 Meetup Groups, plus maintain our own outside Dating Advice & Events Website. We advertise on Facebook, Twitter, Blogs, etc. Most registrations come through our outside events website, not Meetup. Therefore the number of RSVPs reflected here are NOT the total number of men or women registered.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

PAYMENT POLICY:
$27- PAY IN ADVANCE ONLY - WE DO NOT ACCEPT PAYMENT AT DOOR

REGISTER AND PAY HERE: https://2015atwysspeeddatingnyc.eventbrite.com

(SEE MORE FAQ's BELOW)

ABSOLUTELY NO REFUNDS FOR LAST MINUTE/DAY OF CANCELLATIONS

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

FAST FACTS - PLEASE READ:

*We can not accept payment at the door for these events. All registrations must be done online via the Eventbrite link below before the event. No exceptions.

*RSVPing through meetup does not guarantee admission. You must pre-pay to secure your spot in the event.

*Business casual attire requested. No sneakers, t-shirts or active wear, no ripped jeans.

*We limit our events to 12 couples/24 people. (See reason below)

*You will have approximately 8-12 dates.*

*Matches are tabulated and emailed to attendees 48 hours after the event.

*Event lasts about 90 minutes give or take 10 minutes between check-in and all speeddating rounds. Speed rounds last 5 minutes each.

*You must register with a valid, correct email address.

*There are no refunds for cancellations, late arrivals or no-shows.

*You must arrive and check in within 20 minutes of the advertised start time.

OUR METHOD:

Online dating is great. But how many times have you chatted with someone just to have them fade or never make plans to meet? How many dates have you had that you thought went well and then ended up confused because you never heard from that person again?

The upside of online dating is that it provides us with so many options. The downside is that people start to believe that their options are endless, which leads them to move on quickly seeking that "perfect" match.

This is where speeddating comes in. To try and combat the "shopping cart" mentality of online dating, we limit the number of attendees to 10-12 per gender.  Fewer choices to distract us means that people are more likely to make a connection. Face to face conversations result in fewer flakes. That means fewer people get put on the back burner.


FAQ'S

The Organizer RSVPD with X amount of people. What does that mean?

That number represents the RSVPS (not registrations) that have come in through our other pages listed below. It is NOT the total number of people pre-paid. The typical number of people per event is 16-20.

What should I wear?

Business casual attire is perfect. No sneakers or athletic wear, please.

What if I want to give someone my contact info at the event?

Go for it! That's the whole point. Do whatever you are comfortable doing.

Can I see photos of other attendees?

Most people do not RSVP on meetup for privacy reasons. They only pre-pay and therefore do not share their photo.

Where are all the RSVPs?

About 50% of the registrations come through Eventbrite and our main events website. They are not Meetup members. Many people prefer not to post their Meetup profile or photo for privacy reasons. We often remove the event from the calendar once it has started so that people can't contact attendees without the attendee's expressed permission.

What's The Refund Policy?

Since we need to try and ensure a gender ratio as close to even as possible, our policy is that all registrations are final. We can not offer refunds or transfers to last minute cancellations. However, if you notify us at least 3 days in advance, we can give you a credit to another event.

Can I bring a friend for moral support?

You'd be surprised how many people arrive alone. We actually prefer that guests do not bring friends or "spectators." It makes the other attendees uncomfortable. Fun fact: The people who sign up and arrive alone tend to get more matches than those who attend with friends.

Will there be equal numbers of men or women?

That's the goal. We constantly monitor registrations and amp up promotion to try and ensure and equal gender ration. Sometimes there's 1 or 2 more men or women. Sometimes it's even numbers. This is heavily dependent on the age range and weather. We will NOT host an event if there isn't AT LEAST 7 of each gender registered, and we will NOT let there be an excessive (more than 3) amount of one gender versus the other.

*This is not a guaranteed number of dates.

See other RSVPS posted on our other groups. Please note that many people opt NOT to RSVP through Meetup for privacy reasons.
results.name: Speeddating Ages 38-50 1F/3M spots left

results.description:
LEZ Factor presents..."SEX MIX(er)"

(...we're heating things up a bit!)


___ 

PURCHASE LIMITED REDUCED TICKETS HERE:

www.lezfactorsexmixer2015.eventbrite.com 

___


-->  IMPORTANT:  Please arrive by 7PM for the activities! <-- 

On Saturday, September 26th, we will once again gather for a night of casually talking about the ladies - but this time - we're bringing  your sexiest girl-on-girl desires to the forefront!

Let's face it.  We talk about sex behind closed doors.  We fantasize about it.

When we get it, we want more.

So, join us as we mix, mingle, and celebrate the beauty that is lesbian sex.

+ Great dialogue - beautiful women - tons of laughs - and prizes! + 

This time, we'll again be at the ultra-sexy 49 Grove (in the West Village) - and it'll be all ours!

It's the perfect setting for a laid-back evening of fun, casual, and stimulating conversation with eligible women - and certainly a refreshing alternative to a typical Saturday evening in the lesbian scene!

We’ve structured brand new sex-themed activities/discussions to help facilitate the night.  We'll practically hand-hold you through the process of meeting new women.  In other words, no need to be shy.  We’ll be there to help.

___

PURCHASE LIMITED REDUCED TICKETS HERE:

www.lezfactorsexmixer2015.eventbrite.com 

___


--->  IMPORTANT:  Please arrive by 7PM for the activities!!! <---


So, come party with a beautiful, mature, fun-loving crowd.  Have a drink, meet someone new, and embrace new experiences.

Better yet, take a chance and celebrate LEZ SEX...LEZ Factor style!

FAQs: 

Age policy? 21+

Dress code? Wear what feels good.

What's the cost at the door? $15

Do I have to bring my printed ticket to the event? No need. We will have your name on our "advanced purchase" list at the door.

What is the refund policy? No refunds for this event.  Sorry!
results.name: (9/26) LEZ Factor's "SEX MIX(er)" ...the hottest way to end the summer!

results.description:
The people have spoken quite clearly on this one- Black Mass wins the vote by a hefty margin. The breakdown of votes is as follows:

Black Mass- 11

Everest- 3

Maze Runner: The Scorch- 1 (only one vote, but a heartfelt one)

The Visit- 3

We'll be catching the 8:30pm showing of Black Mass at the AMC Loews 34th Street 14 theater. 

Since we'll be catching a slightly later showing, we'll be eating before the movie. We'll be meeting at 6pm for the dinner portion of the evening at the Skylight Diner, about a block away from the theater. The food is decent and the service can be charmingly rude, but they seat huge groups easily, so we continue our humble patronage with them. We'll finish up there at about 8pm, then head over to the theater in time to get decent seats and get settled in before the movie starts.

After the movie, for those who simply don't wish the evening to end, we'll head to a nearby bar to offer our individual critiques and discuss the nuances of the film - or just talk and stuff.

*I still have discounted ticket vouchers available. The normal ticket price is $14.79. The cost of the voucher is $11. Not a huge discount, but every little bit counts, right? If you're interested in reserving a voucher before the event, let me know and I'll send you the info you need. Any vouchers that haven't been reserved before the event will be available for cash purchase when we meet.
results.name: Dinner and a Movie: Black Mass

Book Bogglers - a brand new independent publisher exclusively devoted to literature of the rattie kind, is excited to announce the publication of the first in a series of tales chronicling the fantasy escapades of Archer and Fletch, the real-life rodent family of Meetup member Cindy Stuart . Join us for a reading of our first book, discussion about our pet rats, and to help us brainstorm content for our upcoming book, Rat Kibble for the Soul. All are welcome!

When a rat-mom is rescued from the tank of a Royal Python in a NYC pet shop, the improbable adventures of her offspring, Archer and Fletch, have just begun. With humor & a sharp eye for rat behavior (both domestic and wild) the authors create a tale that is equal parts fun-fantasy and rat-reality! You’re invited to Archer and Fletch’s Book Launch with co-creators Cynthia Stuart and E. Merwin!

results.description:
7v7, 60min+ game. New turf at the majestic Grand St Field.


Arrive early and be ready to start on time. All players should bring a white and black t-shirt.

***********************************************************

Details:

1) Teams divide into equal ability - players are welcome to signup with friends.

2) No metal cleats. Turf shoes or molded cleats. Proper Soccer attire only.

3) Played in a fun and chill environment. Rough play, tackles, or sliding are not tolerated. Pass the ball have fun.

4) If no dedicated goalkeepers, players rotate in goal.


5) If you arrive late wait until a break in the game. Inserting players in the middle of the game disrupts the flow- it's not fair to those that arrive on time.

All players must RSVP, payment goes toward light rentals, field permits, equipment and fees.

CANCELLATIONS/REFUNDS:

You'll need to update your RSVP 24 hours before the match, to receive a credit for the next game. This is so other members have a chance to take your place.

See you at the pitch!


Grand (St) FC

By joining this group and attending events you agree to the Waiver Of Liability.

results.description:
This class will open your taste buds to the many types of beer out there, peeling back the myth that it is only for frat boys and sports fans! From fruity, juice-like lambics to citrus flavored sours to golden lagers, beer isn't just a fizzy, somewhat bitter adult beverage. With more variety than wine and a broader range of flavors, you'll be surprised to learn that YOU may be a beer lover after all! 

 Each class is 1 hour and we personally tailor your flight (4 tastings) to what you like to eat/drink. We will also buy you a pint of your choice! This interactive class is perfect for date nights, beer lovers and novices alike, bartenders, and anyone (over 21)! By the time you leave, you'll have discovered a new type of beer unlike anything you've ever tasted!

More info and tickets here - https://goo.gl/F5Snft

results.description:
Hey bitsters who are in town for World Maker Faire or who want to meet others in the community!

Join us for an evening of talks and networking at our new littleBits store. We are so excited to welcome our global community at our New York headquarters and talk with Bethany Koby of TWSU and Francis Bitonti about their personal journey as makers and how we can all invent the world we want to live in.


In addition we will be featuring demos from littleBits Community superstars, with inventions you have never seen before!


FEATURED PANEL

BETHANY KOBY


Bethany Koby is a mom, CEO, designer and educator interested in creating brands, businesses and experiences that help imaging a more positive and collaborative future. In 2012 she co-founded Technology Will Save Us.

FRANCIS BITONTI

Designer Francis Bitonti is ushering in a new manufacturing paradigm through his blend of computational design techniques and emerging manufacturing technologies.  Blurring the line between design and technology, Bitonti’s trademark process merges cutting edge digital design and manufacturing technologies, aimed to transform industrialized production systems.

We have limited spots and anticipate the event selling out fast.


RSVP now to guarantee yourself a spot, but only if you are 100% sure you can attend. We understand that things do come up and plans change, so if you are unable to make it, please cancel as soon as possible, so that others have a chance to attend. We can’t wait to see you there!
results.name: Maker Faire Meetup at the new littleBits Store in NYC

Curry Mac & Cheese with a Savory Herb Salad. 

Vegan & Gluten-Free Oatmeal Raisin & Gingerbread Cookies 

BYOB (Homemade Vanilla Chai Lattes with almond milk be provided for the cookies)

There will more than enough to go around for everyone, so come hungry!

Elemental & 13th Sign Astrology Readings

These will be introductory readings being given. Anyone who wants to continue with a 15min reading, please bring $15


This is all being done by Soumayah & Shidaun. Two wellness practitioners, astrologers, clairvoyant readers & aspiring vegan & gluten-free culinarians. (that's a real word people).


$10 PREPAY (Closed)

$15 AT THE DOOR (CASH)

Please let us know if you have allergies to anything so we can make sure everyone is happy. ;-)

results.description:
*We are honored to create this space of healing for your practice. Join us , Amanda, is a certified Kripalu Yoga Teacher who takes pride in making Yoga and Reiki accessible to as many people as possible. Her classes are a balanced, continuous flow of Reiki infused yogasana sequences that build strength and stabilize the body, while also encouraging peace and serenity in the mind. The smoothly sequenced Reiki infused classes stretch, tone and balance your body, calm your mind and uplift your spirit.*

*Reiki is part of the entire class, however specifically given to each person during the quiet beginning of the class (meditation and centering) and at the end of the class during Savasana (the final pose). Each person receives Reiki during the entire class. If you have a mat, you can bring it. If you do not have a mat, there will be some to share. No Reiki or Yoga experience is required to participate.*

If you already have a class package with Amanda, your classes can be used towards this class as well :)

Text or call (862)[masked] for more information (text is a faster response time). 


Email: [masked]

www.CliftonYogaNJ.com

results.description:
Speed Dating: Women Ages 21 to 34 - Men Ages 23 to 38
When: Saturday, September 26th 2015
7:00 PM - 9:00 PM (Check-in at 6:50)
Where: Pranna Lounge: 79 Madison Avenue - (at 28th St.)

Get Your Tickets At This Link: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/speed-dating-women-ages-21-to-34-men-ages-23-to-38-tickets-18747297672

PRICE: $34  (Must Pre-Pay Online. No Tickets Sold At Event Door)
(We recommend getting your tickets as far in advance as possible because once we fill up for a certain gender we will list event as sold out for that gender. Sign up now to secure your spot).

The RSVP list on this page is not an indication of actual event attendees. This event is being listed on over 10 different singles Meetup groups and also outside of Meetup. Most people attending are not from Meetup

EVENT DETAILS:
Speed dating is so much fun and a great way to meet quality, single professionals in the busy city of NYC. Most people know within a few minutes if they would like to see someone again. We may be biased but we definitely think this is a much better way to meet people than online dating or at a random bar.

You will go on between 8 and 15 mini dates lasting between 4 and 7 minutes each (we lengthen or shorten the date time according to how many people attend). Women stay seated and the men rotate from table to table until they meet each woman.

You will get a match card and at the end of each mini date you'll discreetly indicate whether or not you'd like to see the person again. At the end of the evening you will hand your match card in to the event host. If you both select each other, we will send you each others' email address the next day so you can set up a future date!

Get Your Tickets At This Link: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/speed-dating-women-ages-21-to-34-men-ages-23-to-38-tickets-18747297672

FAQ:

WHAT IS THE DRESS CODE?
Please no sneakers, t-shirts or gym attire.

CAN I PAY AT THE EVENT DOOR?
We do no accept payment at the event door. You must pre-pay online.

WHEN WILL I GET MY MATCHES EMAILED TO ME?
We will email you matches within 48 hours after the event.

IS THERE A REFUND POLICY?
If you need to cancel, please email us and we can transfer you to a future event. However we do not offer refunds if you cancel on the day of the event or don't show up.

WHO IS ATTENDING?
The RSVP list on this page is not an indication of actual event attendees. This event is being listed on over 10 different singles Meetup groups and also outside of Meetup. Most people attending are not from Meetup. You can feel free to RSVP page to let the group know you're attending but you still have to go to the above link to pay for the event.

Get Your Tickets At This Link: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/speed-dating-women-ages-21-to-34-men-ages-23-to-38-tickets-18747297672

 

Thank you!
results.name: Speed Dating: Women Ages 21 to 34 - Men Ages 23 to 38

results.description:
Please prepay here (menu below) www.thesinglegourmet.net/event/da-noi/
Da Noi- 25 Zagat Rated 214 East 49th Street (between 2nd/3rd- across from Pampano) Saturday, August 8th, 7pm optional drinks, 8pm dinner $79 4-course, gl wine, coffee, tax & tip A whopping Zagat rated 25 for “old world red sauce cooking like nonna’s ...where the crowd is right out of scene from the Godfather.” A fine-dining, family owned restaurant, (40 years in the business) with 5-star service, and exceptional food makes this a “can’t miss” dinner for a July weekend. A wildly successful hit in their first 3 locations in the Italian sections of Staten Island and NJ, and voted in Zagats top of the “Best of Staten Island” list, Da Noi opened up in Midtown to top rated reviews all across every review site. They soon became a hit amongst the suit and tie midtown crowd. Family owned and run like the good-ole Italian restaurants of the past, “Da Noi” means “from/of us” in Italian, putting the family mark/seal on all their recipes. First Course
  Insalata Arugula
  baby arugula salad tossed with dried cherries, sliced strawberries, julienned mangos, in a white wine vinegar & honey dressing with crumpled blueberry goat cheese on top
Second Course (Combination of)
  Rottolo Montonara
  homemade pasta rolled & filled with spinach, ricotta & wild mushrooms in a plum tomato reduction with a touch of cream, topped with parmesan
  Toetolloni Quattro Formaggio
  green tortelloni in a four cheese sauce
  Third Course (Choice of)
  Veal Martini
  veal encrusted with parmesan sautéed in lemon & white wine
Filet Of Sole Fiorentina
 sautéed with lemon & white wine over spinach
  Chicken Giambotta
boneless, sautéed with roasted peppers, potatoes, sausage & white wine
   
Fourth Course
Combination of home made desserts (sampling of all 3)
Tira Mizu, ricotta Italian Cheesecake and Zuccotto

Served with coffee or tea
  This includes ONE drink person
results.name: 4-course Dinner at Da Noi- 25 Zagat

results.description:
http://www.publiquartet.com/about-pqa/

PUBLIQ Access is designed to promote new works for the string quartet and highlight the voices of today’s innovative emerging composers at the formative point of their careers. PQA is genre-independent and supports under-represented music in the string quartet repertoire regardless of style; including jazz, world, improvised, non-notated, and electronic music. Each PQA cycle culminates in a high profile showcase concert in New York City featuring the chosen compositions. The 2015 showcase concert will be at the DiMenna Center on September 26th. Each concert features an open discussion between the audience and distinguished composers, performers, and academics. This year we are honored to have the magical Marcos Balter and rad Du Yun on the discussion panel!

The goal of PUBLIQ Access is to bring exposure of the chosen pieces to the widest possible reach through performances of the highest quality and audience engagement through talks, panels, and free concerts. Every PQ concert features work from their PUBLIQ Access program including all performances on tour.

This is a great opportunity to work closely with a professional string quartet with extensive new music, improvisation, and composition experience. Composers can submit a pre-existing string quartet (written within the last 2 years) or write a piece specifically for this submission. The number of pieces selected will be determined by the length of the final performance (approximately 60 minutes). All PUBLIQ Access concerts are free and open to the public. Tickets via Will Call at the concert through this link:

https://docs.google.com/forms/d/1ByO-PDSrtWcIJxqwCzPD6heinajvt4XM3ofYYLs4IMo/viewform
results.name: ChamberMusicNY presents PUBLIQ Access

results.description:
Friends,

Join us on Saturday, September 26 for our social mixer. Our event in August attracted a large crowd.

 This event is from 7-10pm followed by the afterparty @ Slate NYC (venues are less than 10 mins walking distance.

results.description:
Concert info


PUBLIQ Access is designed to promote new works for the string quartet and highlight the voices of today’s innovative emerging composers at the formative point of their careers. PQA is genre-independent and supports under-represented music in the string quartet repertoire regardless of style; including jazz, world, improvised, non-notated, and electronic music. Each PQA cycle culminates in a high profile showcase concert in New York City featuring the chosen compositions. The 2015 showcase concert will be at the DiMenna Center on September 26th. Each concert features an open discussion between the audience and distinguished composers, performers, and academics. This year we are honored to have the magical Marcos Balter and rad Du Yun on the discussion panel!


The goal of PUBLIQ Access is to bring exposure of the chosen pieces to the widest possible reach through performances of the highest quality and audience engagement through talks, panels, and free concerts. Every PQ concert features work from their PUBLIQ Access program including all performances on tour.

This is a great opportunity to work closely with a professional string quartet with extensive new music, improvisation, and composition experience. Composers can submit a pre-existing string quartet (written within the last 2 years) or write a piece specifically for this submission. The number of pieces selected will be determined by the length of the final performance (approximately 60 minutes). All PUBLIQ Access concerts are free and open to the public. Tickets via Will Call at the concert through this link:

https://docs.google.com/forms/d/1ByO-PDSrtWcIJxqwCzPD6heinajvt4XM3ofYYLs4IMo/viewform
results.name: ChamberMusicNY & PUBLIQuartet present PUBLIQ Access

results.description:
Speed Dating: Women Ages 21 to 34 - Men Ages 23 to 38
When: Saturday, September 26th 2015
7:00 PM - 9:00 PM (Check-in at 6:50)
Where: Pranna Lounge: 79 Madison Avenue - (at 28th St.)

Get Your Tickets At This Link: http://www.ClickMixers.com/speed-dating-in-nyc.html

PRICE: $34 (Must Pre-Pay Online. No Tickets Sold At Event Door)
(We recommend getting your tickets as far in advance as possible because once we fill up for a certain gender we will list event as sold out for that gender. Sign up now to secure your spot).

The RSVP list on this page is not an indication of actual event attendees. This event is being listed on over 10 different singles Meetup groups and also outside of Meetup. Most people attending are not from Meetup

EVENT DETAILS:
Speed dating is so much fun and a great way to meet quality, single professionals in the busy city of NYC. Most people know within a few minutes if they would like to see someone again. We may be biased but we definitely think this is a much better way to meet people than online dating or at a random bar.

You will go on between 8 and 15 mini dates lasting between 4 and 7 minutes each (we lengthen or shorten the date time according to how many people attend). Women stay seated and the men rotate from table to table until they meet each woman.

You will get a match card and at the end of each mini date you'll discreetly indicate whether or not you'd like to see the person again. At the end of the evening you will hand your match card in to the event host. If you both select each other, we will send you each others' email address the next day so you can set up a future date!

Get Your Tickets At This Link: http://www.ClickMixers.com/speed-dating-in-nyc.html

FAQ:

WHAT IS THE DRESS CODE?
Please no sneakers, t-shirts or gym attire.

CAN I PAY AT THE EVENT DOOR?
We do no accept payment at the event door. You must pre-pay online.

WHEN WILL I GET MY MATCHES EMAILED TO ME?
We will email you matches within 48 hours after the event.

IS THERE A REFUND POLICY?
If you need to cancel, please email us and we can transfer you to a future event. However we do not offer refunds if you cancel on the day of the event or don't show up.

WHO IS ATTENDING?
The RSVP list on this page is not an indication of actual event attendees. This event is being listed on over 10 different singles Meetup groups and also outside of Meetup. Most people attending are not from Meetup. You can feel free to RSVP page to let the group know you're attending but you still have to go to the above link to pay for the event.

Get Your Tickets At This Link: http://www.ClickMixers.com/speed-dating-in-nyc.html

group.name: I am Happy Project - New York, NY

results.description:
今週六我要在家裡辦一次中國風的派對。

那是什麼樣的派對呢？

中國音樂。

中國電視。

中國菜。

中國話！

你如果對這些方面感興趣的話，那歡迎你參加。這個派對主要的是要說中文。每個人需要帶一點東西來參加。比如：水果，食物，零食，之類。不要帶紙巾或杯子什麼的。我們有足夠的那些東西啦！

還有，我們可能會合一點點酒。如果你不喜歡喝酒，不用來。反正，只會一點點而已。

謝謝你看這個邀請！
results.how_to_find_us: 我確認你的報名之後，我給你發地址。

Speed dating is so much fun and a great way to meet quality, single professionals in the busy city of NYC. Most people know within a few minutes if they would like to see someone again. We may be biased but we definitely think this is a much better way to meet people than online dating or at a random bar.

You will go on between 8 and 15 mini dates lasting between 4 and 7 minutes each (we lengthen or shorten the date time according to how many people attend). Women stay seated and the men rotate from table to table until they meet each woman.

You will get a match card and at the end of each mini date you'll discreetly indicate whether or not you'd like to see the person again. At the end of the evening you will hand your match card in to the event host. If you both select each other, we will send you each others' email address the next day so you can set up a future date!

Get Your Tickets At This Link: http://www.ClickMixers.com/speed-dating-in-nyc.html

FAQ:

WHAT IS THE DRESS CODE?
Please no sneakers, t-shirts or gym attire.

CAN I PAY AT THE EVENT DOOR?
We do no accept payment at the event door. You must pre-pay online.

WHEN WILL I GET MY MATCHES EMAILED TO ME?
We will email you matches within 48 hours after the event.

IS THERE A REFUND POLICY?
If you need to cancel, please email us and we can transfer you to a future event. However we do not offer refunds if you cancel on the day of the event or don't show up.

WHO IS ATTENDING?
The RSVP list on this page is not an indication of actual event attendees. This event is being listed on over 10 different singles Meetup groups and also outside of Meetup. Most people attending are not from Meetup. You can feel free to RSVP page to let the group know you're attending but you still have to go to the above link to pay for the event.

Get Your Tickets At This Link: http://www.ClickMixers.com/speed-dating-in-nyc.html

results.description:
3 DAYS, 3 VENUES @ NEW YORK UNIVERSITY ON SEPTEMBER 26-28, 2015

NOW AFRICA: Playwrights Festival is a reading series, conceptualized by playwright Mfoniso Udofia and developed/produced with Chinyere Anyanwu, Ngozi Anyanwu, Erin Cherry and Bashir Solebo. Gwendolen Hardwick also serves as the Educational Theatre Specialist, Festival Consultant. This team will reintroduce New York City to the masters of African Dramatic Literature. These master playwrights include: Ama Ata Aidoo, Tawfiq al Hakim, Wole Soyinka and Ngugi wa Thiong'o. This festival will also introduce New York City to the incoming classes of contemporary African playwrights.

This inaugural event will be hosted by the Center for Art & Public Policy and the Institute of Performing Arts at NYU Tisch School of the Arts and Anna Deavere Smith’s Institute on the Arts and Civic Dialogue.

DAY 1 of the festival, Saturday, September 26, 2015 at 7pm, will be located located at 20 Cooper Square, 5th Floor, Room 503, New York, NY 10003.  This day will feature a performative reading of Binyavanga Wainaina’s incendiary and satirical piece, “How to Write About Africa.” Afterwards there will be facilitated discussion on the implication of Wainaina’s piece and the radical movements currently occurring within contemporary African dramatic arts.  A showcase of excerpts from African playwrights will close this day.

DAY 2 of the festival, Sunday, September 27 at 730pm will be located is located in the Back-box theatre of the Graduate Musical Theatre Writing Program on 715 Broadway, NY, NY [2nd floor].  This evening will include a reading of African playwright, Mfoniso Udofia’s, full length play, runboyrun and a talk back.  

DAY 3, the final day of the festival Monday, September 28, 2015 at 7pm,  will be located in the Reise Lounge at the Tisch School of the Arts on 721 Broadway, NY, NY. Excerpts of plays [precolonial-postcolonial] will be juxtaposed with their contemporary counterparts in order to assess/contemplate how African narratives are changing over time.

Tickets are FREE for all events.  Seating is limited. Please RSVP at: [masked]

If you would like to support NOW AFRICA: Playwrights Festival please consider donating through Fractured Atlas. All donations are tax deductible.

results.description:
If you've been excited to try D&D legend Monte Cook's Numenera but haven't found a group to play with, Game Master Liam Delaney will be running a fresh new Numenera campaign for those new or veteran to adventures in the Ninth World!

Numenera is an RPG set in the far future where the technologies of old have become indistinguishable from magic (http://www.numenera.com/). Build characters using a simple "fill-in-the-blank" sentence: "I am a _____ _____ who ______", and venture out into the new world for adventure or to uncover the secrets of the ancients. Fans of Planescape, Spelljammer, and any of the more outlandish D&D settings will love delving into Numenera!

Game will be hosted by but not affiliated with the Brooklyn Strategist; players will expected to pay a $10 cover for use of the playspace. Direct all questions to this meetup group. Thank you!
