results.description:
Before you RSVP,  please consider that this group (where events are purposefully small in size) is not like other Meetup groups where you can feel anonymous.  Simply not showing up (or cancelling at the last minute) does affect the host and other attendees.  I understand that things happen.  All I ask is that if you can no longer attend, or have a strong sense you will be held up at work or with family issues, that you give me Two Hours notice.  Anyone who simply does not show up or give me sufficient notice that they can no longer make the event (or else who doesn't provide a damn good explanation and profuse apology after the fact ....lol), will have to be removed from the group.  I don't do this to be a taskmaster or anything...it's just very disheartening for me to pay Meetup Organizer dues,  arrange events, provide very detailed information on events to the group, and then for me to arrive at the venue, only to find a bunch of no-shows.  All I ask is for common courtesy.  Thank you for your understanding!!  ;-)

Also, to help offset the fees that I must pay to Meetup.com each month as a Group Organizer, I'd like to kindly ask for a $3 donation from each member, whenever they attend one of our events.  Thank you!

Now for the fun part...

+++++++++++++

Please be sure to read all the info below, which should provide all the details you need.  I try to be sure and cover all potential questions that members may have, but if I missed anything, feel free to post a question.

+++++++++++++

About the Event

Let's celebrate all the great food and culture of Queens by attending the Queens Night Market in Jamaica!

"The Queens International Night Market is a large, family-friendly open-air night market in Queens, featuring independent vendors selling merchandise, art, and food and featuring small-scale cultural performances and entertainment, all celebrating the rich cultural diversity and heritage of NYC and Queens.

http://queensnightmarket.com/

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=WP0nLvFGlVo  (fast-forward a bit in the video, to see the actual Queens Market...)

I've never been to the Queens Night Market, but think we should be prepared that the food vendors may not be quite as er...'artisinal' as say Smorgasburg in Brooklyn. lol  But nonetheless, I'm sure there will be lots of good food.

++++++++++++++

Where will we meet?  How will we get there?

At 700p, meet at FRONT end of Jamaica bound M/R platform at Steinway station in Astoria.  From there we'll take the M/R to Roosevelt Ave/Jackson Hts., then switch to the F to Jamaica. (NOTE TO SELF: F to 169th which leaves you on Hillside Ave.  Walk on Hillside to 168th and turn Left on 168.  Market is about 4 blocks down on the right before you hit Jamaica Ave.)


++++++++++++++++

How will it work once we are there at the event?

I will have to see what the lay of the land is once there...how crowded it is, etc. Depending on how many of us there are, we may want to break up into  groups of 2-3 people, walk around for a bit, pick up some food, and then all agree to converge again with our food by the table seating, and at a certain time. 

I understand there is also usually live entertainment, so I have a question in on their website to get a sense of whether the entertainment runs for most of the night, or just during a certain timeframe. 

But net, net, I anticipate us in groups of 2-3 people, walking around at first, then we all meet up at a table to eat together, maybe we all watch some entertainment, then leave the event together.  Either way after we've eaten, I can poll the group to see how everyone is feeling, and of course if some folks decide they've had enough and want to leave, but others want to stay, that's fine...

+++++++++++++

Other details

Yes, there are port-o-potties onsite.

I recommend everyone have cash as I'm guessing there may not be an ATM onsite..
results.how_to_find_us: At 700p, meet at FRONT end of Jamaica bound M/R platform at Steinway station in Astoria
results.name: Queens Night Market (see Details before you RSVP)

results.description:
Join other single professionals for an early evening happy hour, topped off with about* 7-10 rounds of "mini-dates." You'll meet each member of the opposite sex for 5-7 minutes each (depending on the size of the event - EXPECT TO MEET 7 TO 12 MEMBERS OF THE OPPOSITE SEX*), turn in your dating card and then we'll send you the contact info of your mutual matches 48 hours later. On average, 80% of those who attend end up with at least one or two mutual matches.

Get the full details below.

* We run 3-5 Meetup Groups, plus maintain our own outside Dating Advice & Events Website. We advertise on Facebook, Twitter, Blogs, etc. Most registrations come through our outside events website, not Meetup. Therefore the number of RSVPs reflected here are NOT the total number of men or women registered.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

PAYMENT POLICY:
$27 - PAY IN ADVANCE ONLY - WE DO NOT ACCEPT PAYMENT AT DOOR

REGISTER AND PAY HERE: https://2015atwysspeeddatingnyc.eventbrite.com

(SEE MORE FAQ's BELOW)

ABSOLUTELY NO REFUNDS FOR LAST MINUTE/DAY OF CANCELLATIONS

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

FAST FACTS - PLEASE READ:

*We can not accept payment at the door for these events. All registrations must be done online via the Eventbrite link below before the event. No exceptions.

*RSVPing through meetup does not guarantee admission. You must pre-pay to secure your spot in the event.

*Business casual attire requested. No sneakers, t-shirts or active wear, no ripped jeans.

*We limit our events to 12 couples/24 people. (See reason below)

*You will have approximately 8-12 dates.*

*Matches are tabulated and emailed to attendees 48 hours after the event.

*Event lasts about 90 minutes give or take 10 minutes between check-in and all speeddating rounds. Speed rounds last 5 minutes each.

*You must register with a valid, correct email address.

*There are no refunds for cancellations, late arrivals or no-shows.

*You must arrive and check in within 20 minutes of the advertised start time.

OUR METHOD:

Online dating is great. But how many times have you chatted with someone just to have them fade or never make plans to meet? How many dates have you had that you thought went well and then ended up confused because you never heard from that person again?

The upside of online dating is that it provides us with so many options. The downside is that people start to believe that their options are endless, which leads them to move on quickly seeking that "perfect" match.

This is where speeddating comes in. To try and combat the "shopping cart" mentality of online dating, we limit the number of attendees to 10-12 per gender.  Fewer choices to distract us means that people are more likely to make a connection. Face to face conversations result in fewer flakes. That means fewer people get put on the back burner.


FAQ'S

The Organizer RSVPD with X amount of people. What does that mean?

That number represents the RSVPS (not registrations) that have come in through our other pages listed below. It is NOT the total number of people pre-paid. The typical number of people per event is 16-20.

What should I wear?

Business casual attire is perfect. No sneakers or athletic wear, please.

What if I want to give someone my contact info at the event?

Go for it! That's the whole point. Do whatever you are comfortable doing.

Can I see photos of other attendees?

Most people do not RSVP on meetup for privacy reasons. They only pre-pay and therefore do not share their photo.

Where are all the RSVPs?

About 50% of the registrations come through Eventbrite and our main events website. They are not Meetup members. Many people prefer not to post their Meetup profile or photo for privacy reasons. We often remove the event from the calendar once it has started so that people can't contact attendees without the attendee's expressed permission.

What's The Refund Policy?

Since we need to try and ensure a gender ratio as close to even as possible, our policy is that all registrations are final. We can not offer refunds or transfers to last minute cancellations. However, if you notify us at least 3 days in advance, we can give you a credit to another event.

Can I bring a friend for moral support?

You'd be surprised how many people arrive alone. We actually prefer that guests do not bring friends or "spectators." It makes the other attendees uncomfortable. Fun fact: The people who sign up and arrive alone tend to get more matches than those who attend with friends.

Will there be equal numbers of men or women?

That's the goal. We constantly monitor registrations and amp up promotion to try and ensure and equal gender ration. Sometimes there's 1 or 2 more men or women. Sometimes it's even numbers. This is heavily dependent on the age range and weather. We will NOT host an event if there isn't AT LEAST 7 of each gender registered, and we will NOT let there be an excessive (more than 3) amount of one gender versus the other.

*This is not a guaranteed number of dates.

See other RSVPS posted on our other groups. Please note that many people opt NOT to RSVP through Meetup for privacy reasons.
results.name: Speeddating Ages 27-39 - 2F/2M SPOTS LEFT

*Matches are tabulated and emailed to attendees 48 hours after the event.

*Event lasts about 90 minutes give or take 10 minutes between check-in and all speeddating rounds. Speed rounds last 5 minutes each.

*You must register with a valid, correct email address.

*There are no refunds for cancellations, late arrivals or no-shows.

*You must arrive and check in within 20 minutes of the advertised start time.

OUR METHOD:

Online dating is great. But how many times have you chatted with someone just to have them fade or never make plans to meet? How many dates have you had that you thought went well and then ended up confused because you never heard from that person again?

The upside of online dating is that it provides us with so many options. The downside is that people start to believe that their options are endless, which leads them to move on quickly seeking that "perfect" match.

This is where speeddating comes in. To try and combat the "shopping cart" mentality of online dating, we limit the number of attendees to 10-12 per gender.  Fewer choices to distract us means that people are more likely to make a connection. Face to face conversations result in fewer flakes. That means fewer people get put on the back burner.


FAQ'S

The Organizer RSVPD with X amount of people. What does that mean?

That number represents the RSVPS (not registrations) that have come in through our other pages listed below. It is NOT the total number of people pre-paid. The typical number of people per event is 16-20.

What should I wear?

Business casual attire is perfect. No sneakers or athletic wear, please.

What if I want to give someone my contact info at the event?

Go for it! That's the whole point. Do whatever you are comfortable doing.

Can I see photos of other attendees?

Most people do not RSVP on meetup for privacy reasons. They only pre-pay and therefore do not share their photo.

Where are all the RSVPs?

About 50% of the registrations come through Eventbrite and our main events website. They are not Meetup members. Many people prefer not to post their Meetup profile or photo for privacy reasons. We often remove the event from the calendar once it has started so that people can't contact attendees without the attendee's expressed permission.

What's The Refund Policy?

Since we need to try and ensure a gender ratio as close to even as possible, our policy is that all registrations are final. We can not offer refunds or transfers to last minute cancellations. However, if you notify us at least 3 days in advance, we can give you a credit to another event.

Can I bring a friend for moral support?

You'd be surprised how many people arrive alone. We actually prefer that guests do not bring friends or "spectators." It makes the other attendees uncomfortable. Fun fact: The people who sign up and arrive alone tend to get more matches than those who attend with friends.

Will there be equal numbers of men or women?

That's the goal. We constantly monitor registrations and amp up promotion to try and ensure and equal gender ration. Sometimes there's 1 or 2 more men or women. Sometimes it's even numbers. This is heavily dependent on the age range and weather. We will NOT host an event if there isn't AT LEAST 7 of each gender registered, and we will NOT let there be an excessive (more than 3) amount of one gender versus the other.

*This is not a guaranteed number of dates.

See other RSVPS posted on our other groups. Please note that many people opt NOT to RSVP through Meetup for privacy reasons.

group.name: I wanted to do that...Just not alone!!

results.description:
Speed Dating: Women Ages 21 to 34 - Men Ages 23 to 38


Get Your Tickets At This Link: http://www.ClickMixers.com/speed-dating-in-nyc.html

PRICE: $34  (Must Pre-Pay Online. No Tickets Sold At Event Door)
(We recommend getting your tickets as far in advance as possible because once we fill up for a certain gender we will list event as sold out for that gender. Sign up now to secure your spot).

The RSVP list on this page is not an indication of actual event attendees. This event is being listed on over 10 different singles Meetup groups and also outside of Meetup. Most people attending are not from Meetup

EVENT DETAILS:
Speed dating is so much fun and a great way to meet quality, single professionals in the busy city of NYC. Most people know within a few minutes if they would like to see someone again. We may be biased but we definitely think this is a much better way to meet people than online dating or at a random bar.

You will go on between 8 and 15 mini dates lasting between 4 and 7 minutes each (we lengthen or shorten the date time according to how many people attend). Women stay seated and the men rotate from table to table until they meet each woman.

You will get a match card and at the end of each mini date you'll discreetly indicate whether or not you'd like to see the person again. At the end of the evening you will hand your match card in to the event host. If you both select each other, we will send you each others' email address the next day so you can set up a future date!

Get Your Tickets At This Link: http://www.ClickMixers.com/speed-dating-in-nyc.html

FAQ:

WHAT IS THE DRESS CODE?
Please no sneakers, t-shirts or gym attire.

CAN I PAY AT THE EVENT DOOR?
We do no accept payment at the event door. You must pre-pay online.

WHEN WILL I GET MY MATCHES EMAILED TO ME?
We will email you matches within 48 hours after the event.

IS THERE A REFUND POLICY?
If you need to cancel, please email us and we can transfer you to a future event. However we do not offer refunds if you cancel on the day of the event or don't show up.

WHO IS ATTENDING?
The RSVP list on this page is not an indication of actual event attendees. This event is being listed on over 10 different singles Meetup groups and also outside of Meetup. Most people attending are not from Meetup. You can feel free to RSVP page to let the group know you're attending but you still have to go to the above link to pay for the event.

Get Your Tickets At This Link: http://www.ClickMixers.com/speed-dating-in-nyc.html

results.description:
The Dancing Path™ is excited to present-

Transformational Dances of Connection, Embodiment & Bliss

Facilitated by Trinity

Saturday, September 26th 7:30pm-9:30pm Mark Your Calendar!


New York Live Arts 219 W19th Street 3rd Floor (bet 7th & 8th Ave) NYC

Join us for a delicious evening of Transformational Dance, Connection and Healing Touch. This event has been specially designed to help you Restore, Renew, and bring Harmony to your heart and your body. The intention is to bring you to a greater place of feeling more embodied, balanced, grounded and connected to yourself and others in a deliciously fun and blissful way.

Transformational Dance w/Trinity

Trinity will guide you through a fun, transformational and improvisational dance experience. This lightly facilitated dance will take you into higher states of love, connection and playfulness. Dancers will be inspired by passionate music and powerful, creative, lightly guided, improvisational dance rituals. These dance rituals will empower you to expand your creativity and release your inhibitions- supporting you to dance wild, free and playful like a child. They will clear your energy and bring an experience of renewal to you and your connection with others. No dance experience is necessary.

Many participants, who have shared that they are normally intimidated by dance, shared how they were able to really let go and felt so much more uninhibited during Trinity’s transformational dance experiences.

Healing Touch (aka Reiki) w/Trinity

We will end with the evening with soft nurturing heart touch (aka reiki). This will ground everything we have experienced together. Trinity will teach simple Reiki to everyone and don’t worry there is no experience necessary. Reiki is a gentle hands-on-healing method that originated in Japan. During a Reiki session the practitioner lightly places their hands in a series of non-intrusive positions on or near the body. There is no massage or manipulation. The recipient remains fully clothed while the practitioner channels universal energy through the palms of their hands onto the receiver. This exchange of energy often causes the receiver to feel relaxed, blissful and centered.

Come dance, connect and be blissed with us!

No experience with dance or reiki is necessary!


Advance Registration is recommended!

$20 early bird (by Saturday, Sept 19th)

$25 advance (register by 11:30pm the night before event)

$30 day of (cash at door)


Register at-

http://transformational-dance.eventbrite.com

Testimonials from Trinity’s Events-

“Trinity leads this outrageously fun facilitated dance celebration with all of her heart, passion, power, and love. By the end, I always feel completely connected with myself and everyone in the room- a deep sense of community is created. It is a profound experience.” ~ Doug Larson

“I feel like this is the best time I've had in a while! I came in not knowing what to expect. I left feeling empowered, light, open, centered and free. A lot of things surfaced for me in a wonderful way. I now feel closer to my heart. Thank you!” ~ Melissa D.

About Trinity-

Transformational Dance Facilitator and Founder of The Dancing Path™

Trinity is the creator of the Dancing Path™ a celebratory transformational events organization that offers playful, creative, community building events, workshops and trainings all over NYC. She is passionate about bringing people together to celebrate life, express themselves fully and connect in fun and nurturing ways. One of Trinity’s main passions is to facilitate transformational dance. Her love and uninhibited passion for dance is infectious. Trinity has facilitated transformational dances at the Omega Institute, Princeton University, Jiva Mukti and many other wonderful places. In 2001 she studied Reiki and a few years later became a Reiki master. Shortly after Trinity studied at Institute for Integrative Nutrition (IIN) and got certified as a Holistic Health & Nutritional Counselor. During her studies at IIN she discovered Thai Massage and pursued training with Lotus Palm and in Thailand. Trinity is a 200 hour certified Yoga Instructor and has been teaching yoga for 15 years. She has also studied and been trained in Circus Yoga™, Hawaiian Lomi Lomi Massage, Deeksha aka the Oneness Blessing & Authentic Relating.

Let’s Grow this Community!

If you love these events and want to see more of them then I ask for your support in spreading the word. One way you can help is by inviting your friends to the events or inviting them to join the Mailing List.

Trinity’s Lists-

[masked]

www.meetup.com/thedancingpath/

www.facebook.com/thedancingpath/

I appreciate and thank you for all your love & support!

with Love & Gratitude,

Trinity

results.description:
Come join us as we dance around the fire one last time in Liz's magical backyard in Glen Rock NJ continuing our transformative journeys in SiStarhood!

Please RSVP YES for the address.
A separate group email will be sent to those that are intending to join in the festivities.

This, the 10th Moon of the year we are exploring the energy of the Wise Woman, "She Who Sees, Heals and Shows the Way." The way of the Wise Woman-Healer is the way of acceptance and allowance.

We will dance, share food and conversation about our loves and passions. 


Each woman who attends is a unique jewel and has unique gifts to offer, allow spirit to guide you. Bring what you like including your requests!

Each circle is a special experience, women leave feeling, energized, relaxed, heard, loved, seen, fulfilled and more connected to their soul and to each other.

The suggested donation is $20 to attend the event. Sliding scale available.

The wisdom of the circle is from the variety of the perspectives brought forth. This is a place where a woman can remove her masks and forget about 'fitting in'. Actually, we celebrate our BEingness in all of the glorious colors and shapes.

Looking forward to sharing time with each of you.

Holding each of you in loving arms,

Lisa & Liz

results.description:
ALL AGES
$10 @ The Door = 4 hours of jamming & practice time! 

The Open Jams at Funkadelic Studios are great for musicians who are interested in networking with other like-minded artists, from beginners to professionals in all genres. Attending our open jams allows you to collaborate with musicians, and it's a great way to find potential band members, or to test out and get feedback on new songs that you’re working on!

Since first opening up in 1993, we have become a resource for artists of varying styles and personalities. The atmosphere at Funk, is influenced by our friendly staff and the cool vibe of our city.

Our Open Jams are held every Saturday and its only $10 to attend which gets you four hours of jamming and practice time! So come get something started, network, create and collaborate!

results.description:
It's time again for one of our most popular Meetups! As seen on ABC News, a Nuts & Bolts party is a unique, slightly sexy & great way to meet upscale, outgoing & attractive singles!

Don't miss this Meetup and screw yourself out of the chance to find your right fit...You'd be nuts not to attend. No tools allowed :)

Drink Specials & Snacks:


• 2 For 1 Drinks (8:30-9:30pm)

• FREE Shot for all this month's birthdays

• FREE Snacks for everybody


Ice Breakers:

• You will either receive a nut or a bolt

• The object is to find the nut that fits the bolt

• Return matching hardware to bar & receive a FREE shot


Music & Giveaways:

• DJ on lower level spins best dance music of 2K & Today

• DJ on main level spins best party music of 80s & 90s

• FREE Prizes & Giveaways

Admission:

$10 first 10 tix w/ discount code "NUTS" at checkout 

Get tix here - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/nutsandbolts/dates/Sep-26-2015_at_0830PM

$15 online after that, $20 at the door w/ RSVP, $25 w/o   

Is this venue private for Meetup? 

Yes.  The entire venue will be 100% private for our members and their guests. 

Is this age or ethnic specific?

No.  This is not an age or ethnic specific event.  We get a good mix and a wide range.  

Can I come alone? 

Yes.  Most come on their own.  You can come alone or bring friends - either way you will have a great time. 

Why does your RSVP say +99 ?

20+ groups are co-organizing so the RSVP's shown here are only a small portion of the members attending.  We'll have 200+ in attendance as in past events.

results.description:
Tomorrow night, Allan and Maggie will tag-team the DJ responsibilities, spinning an incredibly eclectic, juicy and fun mix of music.  The Barefoot Boogie welcomes everyone who loves to move - we dance to a wide range of different textures, genres and eras, in a playful and safe community space.  

We are drug- and alcohol-free, and we dance barefoot (or in special inside-only dance shoes if you need to) in the main room.  We have a space for hanging out and conversation, outside of the dance space.

Some of us will also be meeting for dinner at 6 p.m. near the dance - if you're interested in joining, leave a comment or RSVP and we'll firm up the details for dinner.  Come into the dance any time from 8 p.m. (warmup music) or 8:30 p.m. (when the music starts to pick up the energy) and move however you feel, by yourself, or with friends.  

Suggested donation for entry is $10-15, but you can get $5 off for every 30 minutes you volunteer to help out.  First-timers also get a "come back next time free" card!

For more info, visit <a>www.barefootboogie.org,</a> or our Facebook page at https://www.facebook.com/groups/331831896556/.
results.how_to_find_us: Just come on in to the dance and let the music move you!  There will be a community circle at 10 p.m. for introductions.
results.name: Dance to eclectic invigorating spacious funky rocking hilarious music

It's time again for one of our most popular Meetups! As seen on ABC News, a Nuts & Bolts party is a unique, slightly sexy & great way to meet upscale, outgoing & attractive singles!

Don't miss this Meetup and screw yourself out of the chance to find your right fit...You'd be nuts not to attend. No tools allowed :) 

Drink Specials & Snacks: 

• 2 For 1 Drinks (8:30-9:30pm)

• FREE Shot for all this month's birthdays

• FREE Snacks for everybody

Ice Breakers:

• You will either receive a nut or a bolt

• The object is to find the nut that fits the bolt

• Return matching hardware to bar & receive a FREE shot

Music & Giveaways:

• DJ on lower level spins best dance music of 2K & Today 

• DJ on main level spins best party music of 80s & 90s

• FREE Prizes & Giveaways 

Admission:

$10 first 10 tix w/ discount code "NUTS" at checkout 

Get tix here - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/nutsandbolts/dates/Sep-26-2015_at_0830PM

$15 online after that, $20 at the door w/ RSVP, $25 w/o   

Is this venue private for Meetup? 

Yes.  The entire venue will be 100% private for our members and their guests. 

Is this age or ethnic specific?

No.  This is not an age or ethnic specific event.  We get a good mix and a wide range.  

Can I come alone? 

Yes.  Most come on their own.  You can come alone or bring friends - either way you will have a great time. 

Why does your RSVP say +99 ?

20+ groups are co-organizing so the RSVP's shown here are only a small portion of the members attending.  We'll have 200+ in attendance as in past events.
results.how_to_find_us: Party is private for members and their guests - optional name tags will be provided

results.description:
Buy your tickets online here

Although we have only been on meetup.com for a few short years. Piel Canela Dance Studio & Dance Company has been around since October of 2000. This Saturday we are celebrating our 15th Year anniversary and invite all of our meet up members to join us! We will start our party at 9:00pm. This is a red carpet "dress to impress" event. No jeans or sneakers please. THINK "PALLADIUM" AND THAT IS how you should dress. Wear RED or shades of red, or any kind of compliments of red. We have a great showcase, anniversary cake, and a special presentation for the night.

Performances by:

• Piel Canela Dance Company

• Alma de Piel Canela 

• Zafire Dance Company

• LFX Dancers

• Pura Vida Dance Company

• Rhtyhmology

• Nieves Latin Dance Studio

• Tiffany Benson's Allure Dance Company


• Myrna Caceres with Yvonne Marshall

and more to be announced!


Website

Facebook invite

results.description:
Friends,

Join us on September 19 for our Saturday Night Social Mixer @ Slate NYC. Our members always have a fun time at that venue.

We will meet at the bottom section of the venue from 10:15pm. Please note that at some point of the night we will make our way upstairs.

Get to meet many members from the group, as well as members from my other groups.

We will be situated at the right side of the bottom bar.

Admission is free for this event. Just mention Rory's List to the door person.

There will be mingling , drinking , dancing, and more that evening.

You are always welcome to invite your family, friends classmates and colleagues.

This is a multi Meetup group event.

Dress code is business casual.

We look forward in having a fun evening.

Contact us if you have further questions.

Cheers,

Rory

results.description:
Hello F1 Fans,

Only a few days after a grueling weekend in Singapore, Formula One heads north to the Land of the Rising Sun for round 14 of the 2015 season, the Japanese Grand Prix. Having the only figure-eight configuration on the calendar, the Suzuka circuit with its 18 diverse corners and 5.807 km in length has hosted some memorable races since its inaugural year in 1987.

STANDINGS: After an unfortunate weekend in Singapore, Lewis Hamilton now leads the Drivers' Championship by 41 points over his teammate Nico Rosberg. The current standings are: Hamilton in 1st with 252 points, Rosberg in 2nd with 211 points and Sebastian Vettel in close 3rd with 203 points. In the Constructor standings, Mercedes continues to dominate with 463 points, Ferrari sits in 2nd with 310 points and Williams in 3rd with 198 points.

TIRE ALLOCATION: Pirelli says, "Suzuka is one of the most demanding tracks of the year in terms of lateral energy. For this reason, the two hardest compounds in the range have been selected: P Zero Orange hard and P Zero White medium, to cope with the high speeds, high abrasion and fast corners."

DRS ZONES: One - pit straight

So can Lewis Hamilton and Mercedes return to their winning ways in Japan? Or can Sebastian Vettel and Ferrari pull off another impressive win and close the gap even more? If you're in the New York City area and looking for some great racing action with other F1 fans, be sure to join us for the Japanese Grand Prix to see who will take the checkered flag. Race will start at 1:00AM EDT with the pre-race starting at 12:30AM EDT. It's going to be another fantastic race.

We hope to see you all!
results.name: 2015 Japanese Grand Prix

results.description:
Learn the basics of outdoor rock climbing with professional guides! This is our most popular course and participants always come back for more! You must be 8 years of age or older to participate in this course. 

The day starts on the ground discussing basic climbing gear, movement on the rock/climbing techniques, balance and body positioning. The 2nd part of the day you'll be climbing on cliffs of various heights and rock types putting together what you learned. Then we move on to belaying, gear overview, safety, climbing knots and much more!

What's Cool About It
• Learn to belay with an introductory climbing clinic.
• Get comfortable scaling precipices with a climbing partner.
• Rock climbing in the great outdoors beats the gym any day.
• You'll channel your inner mountain man (or woman).

What You Get
• One group rock climbing clinic for one person.
• Use of gear and equipment are included in the deal.
• Clinic is an excellent team-building and social activity.
• Round trip van transport from midtown Manhattan

What to Bring
Lunch, bottled water, a small rucksack, sturdy shoes, a camera, hat, bug spray, tissues, and your sense of adventure.

Depart Date: September 27th Sunday. Please arrive 15 minutes earlier than departing time. We will depart sharp on time. (Event Time: 8:00 AM- 3:00 PM)

Depart 6:15 AM: [masked]th Ave, Flushing, NY 11354 (Outside Sheraton LaGuardia East Hotel) (Map)

Depart 6:45 AM: Northwest corner of 43rd St and 9th Ave New York, NY 10036 (Garden City Deli) (Map)

Return: Departs from Lake Marina 4:00 PM & get back NYC around 5:15 PM & Flushing 6:00 PM.

Destination: Allamuchy Mountain State Park Stanhope NJ Meet-up spot is at the kiosk by the dirt pull-off parking area along Waterloo Road (County Road 604) near Waterloo Village. Class begins promptly at 8:00 AM and ends at 3 PM.

Level: Beginners (Indoor rocking climbing experience helpful, but not required)

Cost: Early Birds $89 for first 8 spots or book 21 days in advance; afterward Regular $99

Buy Ticket Here: http://sep2015rockclimbing.eventbrite.com/ or you can Chase Quickpay me at [masked] to avoid transaction fee. (How to Use Chase Quickpay?) IF Quickpaying, please indicate your loation. YOUR SPOT IS NOT CONFIRMED UNTIL YOUR PAYMENT IS RECEIVED.

For More Info: http://northeastmountainguiding.com/

Pictures from Previous Trips:
2011: http://www.meetup.com/NYCAAA/photos/2303811/
2014: http://www.meetup.com/NYCAYS/photos/24534152/

By RSVP'ing "Yes", you and your guest(s) are accepting the terms tothe Waiver & Release of Liabilityset forth by NYC Active Young Singles.

results.description:
Calling all trailrunners.  Please join me for the Pfalz Point Trail Challenge at Mohonk Preserve.  

The Pfalz Point Trail Challenge is a 10-mile benefit run to raise money for Mohonk Preserve, a non-profit organization dedicated to protecting the beautiful Shawangunk Ridge. For 2015, proceeds from registration fees and sponsorships will be earmarked for restoration and maintenance of the carriage roads.  The network of more than 30 miles of carriage roads in Mohonk Preserve serves hundreds of thousands of visitors annually, including hosting races, such as Pfalz Point Trail Challenge.


In addition to signing up on the Blaze website, you need to register for the race.  Cost is $45.00.  The link is below.  

http://www.mohonkpreserve.org/pptp


If you are interested sign up ASAP.  According to the website it sold out last year.  I can take an additional 4 other people in my car.  If there are more additional guys interested, we can try to arrange for additional cars.  

Hope to see you there.  

Todd
results.name: Pfalz Point Trail Challenge 10 mile trail run

group.name: BLAZE >> Backpacking Gay Men of NYC

results.description:
301 Shore DrHighlands, NJ 07732

The Routes

All routes begin and end in Huddy Park in Highlands, NJ (301 Shore Drive). Note that this is not the Huddy Park in Toms River, NJ.

30 Miles – “This Little Light of Mine” Riders will roll through Monmouth County communities south and west of Highlands including Rumson, Oceanport, and Middletown.

55 Miles – “White Lightning” “This Little Light of Mine” plus an extra 25-mile southern loop around U.S. Weapons Station Earle through Farmingdale and Colts Neck.

75 Miles – “Blinded By the Light” “White Lightning” plus an extra 20-mile southeastern loop along the coastal communities of Spring Lake, Sea Girt, and Brielle. Goes near Asbury Park, but unfortunately does not include Bruce Springsteen.

100 Miles – “All of the Lights” “Blinded by the Light” plus an extra 25-mile loop west around the Turkey Swamp Wildlife Area near Freehold.

Along the RouteRest Areas Rest areas along the route offer cyclists a chance to rest, fill up their water bottles, and refuel for the road ahead with complimentary snacks and refreshments.

Toilets Toilets are located in Huddy Park and at every rest area.

Bike Repair Bike repair stations are located in Huddy Park (courtesy of Kranky’s Cycles) and at each rest area. Labor is free, but there is a charge for parts. Be sure to bring a spare tube with you.

Marshals Volunteer marshals will be riding with you, and stationed along the route to provide roadside assistance.

results.description:
Winner stays, guys!

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3XviR7esUvo

And just in case anyone needs a refresher, some guidance from Coach Ted Lasso.

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6KeG_i8CWE8

No refunds or credits will be offered. Please be 100% sure that you can attend before you RSVP.

Please have a fun, positive, and supportive attitude. Pass the ball to your teammates and have a good time. NO rough playing, slide tackling, or screaming at others will be tolerated. You'll be removed from the game immediately.

No cleats are allowed. Let's do our part to preserve the field. Turf or running shoes are recommended.

Always bring a *dark and white* t-shirt

Be on time.

Teams are broken out ahead of each game based on skill level. Beginner, intermediate, and advanced players are all encouraged to join.

We play THREE, 25-30 minute games with a brief break between each game.

How to get to Queens West Sportsfield.

Queens West Sportsfield is located at:

5th Street between 47th Avenue & 46th Road, Long Island City


From Grand Central it's 3 minutes/1 stop on 7 Train. Take 7 train to Vernon Jackson.

From Queensboro it's 3 minutes/3 stops on 7 Train. Take 7 train to Vernon Jackson.
results.name: Sunday soccer  - (Advanced players only)

results.description:
THE GAME

Informal Meet Up. 8 vs 8. 2 subs per team. No Permit. Be warned - there may or may not be a permitted event at the location which could cancel our game.

Bring a white and black t-shirt, and good attitude.

This game is ideally for intermediate to advanced players, not for beginners.

RSVP GUIDELINES. IMPORTANT:

- If you RSVP and don't show, you'll be benched from this group for the next two weeks. - If you can't make it, Un RSVP, to give others a chance to play.

- If you didn't RSVP or are on the Waitlist, you're at the bottom of the line.

PLAY GUIDELINES

- No slide tackles.

- Respect your teammates and opponents.

- If you fight, you will be banned from the group, permanently.

- If you dribble more than you pass - you annoy everybody and will be banned from the group.

POSITIONS:

Being a pick up game, there are no permanent positions. If you've been playing forward for half the game and someone who's been playing the back line wants to play up front, give up your position and play some defense. When your team lose the ball, don't just stand and watch. Please support your teammates by get back on your side and play some defense.

Thanks.

**INJURIES & DISCLAIMER**:

Group Organizer(s) and Group Organization Assumes NO Risk Or individual Liability For Personal Injuries Incurred By Members/Players On The Field Or During Any Of Our Activities: Pick Up Games, Or Other Events. By Agreeing To Play, You Are In Receipt Of This Information, And Thereby Warrant That You Are In Good Health And Assume Personal Responsibility For ALL Physical And Accidental Risks Involved With Playing In Our Group, Including But Not Limited to Falls, Injuries, Contact With Other Players, and Field Conditions.

results.description:
12 miles on trail in New Rochelle. (There are also 5.6 mile and 10 mile options). The Brooklyn Trail Runners join the lovely and gracious NewRo Runners for their preview run of the Paine to Pain trail half marathon. The actual race takes place Oct, 4th. This is a well-put-together trail half marathon complete with Thomas Paine and cheerleaders. The finish line is in a high school stadium. We encourage everyone to register. If you do, please list Brooklyn Trail Runners as your team.

Trail Details: The trail head is approximately 1.5 miles from the station. There is a water stop and bathroom at mile 7. This a mild trail run. As always, we encourage all speeds to join, no matter how fast or slow. This is about running trails and having fun! If you can’t run 12 miles and can only run 5.6, no worries! 

Where: Meet at the New Rochelle Metro North Train Station

When: 7:11 am at the train station. The run starts promptly at 8:00 am.

Via public transit: Take the 6:36 am

Metro North (New Haven Line)

train from Grand Central to New Rochelle. Travel time 35 minutes. We can split cabs from the train station to the trail head. Or, if you want to up your mileage and run 15 miles total, run back and forth from the station. Return trains are 9:34, 10:14, 11:14, and 12:14 am.

If you are driving: Put 24 Station Plaza North, New Rochelle, NY 10801 in your GPS.

Bag Drop/Etc: NewRo Runners will have cars parked at the trail head that we can leave our bags in.
results.how_to_find_us: We'll be standing outside wearing BTR t-shirts and looking like trail runners.
results.name: Weekend Trail Run! #2

results.description:
RSVP required


What equipment is required?

A mask, snorkel, fins and a weight belt suitable for SCUBA* and dive boots. A wetsuit is optional and recommended. We have special pricing for our students. Let us know when you would like to come in to be fitted for your student equipment package. Most important is that you will get the "Right Gear, the Right Fit at the Right Price" *Note: Snorkeling equipment is not always suitable for SCUBA activities.

Please arrive on time, late arrivals are subject to rescheduling and fees.

If you have any questions please email or call the shop

New Students, If this is your first pool session, you must:
1. Complete the required academics before the pool session;

Online Students must complete Chapters 1 -6CD Rom students must complete Sections 1-5

2. Bring a bathing suit and a towel. There are lockers in the changing room so bring a lock if you like.

3. Drink plenty of water before class

4. Don't forget to print out and bring your skills checklist.

5. Print out a copy of the Hand Signals to review and bring with you.

6. If you have not yet completed a "Student Folder" at the store. 
</a>Please print out, complete and bring the following three forms to the pool;

<a href="http://www.1877scubausa.com/forms/sdi_forms_03_general_liability_release.pdf">SDI General Liability Waiver Fill in ALL the blanks the  "Instructors": F. Ventura & C.K. Scharf, the "Facility: 1-877-SCUBA-USA",  the  Agency is" SDI" and Others": (fill in at pool), then, Sign and date at bottom

SDI Medical Info Waiver "Instructor": F. Ventura,  "Facility: 1-877-SCUBA-USA ,"City of" Paramus "state of" N.J.

Student Information Form</a>

If you have answered YES to any of the medical question; Please print out and have your MD complete the following <a href="http://www.1877scubausa.com/forms/SDI_Physician_Sign_Off_2013.pdf">Physician Sign-Off Form

Why it's a good idea for Divers to own their own SCUBA gear?

RSVP Now

Please RSVP for all pool sessions. RSVPs are required so that we have sufficient staffing for each session. Students who do not RSVP may not get on the roster.No shows are subject to a $29 rescheduling fee.

results.description:
NYRR Five-Borough Series showcases our renewed commitment to the individuals and communities in each borough. More than just five races, the Five-Borough Series—the United Airlines NYC Half, the Airbnb Brooklyn Half, the Queens 10K, the Bronx 10-Mile, and the Staten Island Half—is a celebration of what makes each borough unique, inspiring, and an amazing place to get out and get moving!
The 2015 Bronx 10-Mile is part of NYRR's Five-Borough Series: Run New York. Five Boroughs. One City.
results.name: NYRR Bronx 10 miler

results.description:
Whether you are visiting our beautiful city, coming from a lesson, or just have the day off...come on out and hit with us! We are a group of tennis enthusiast of 2.5 to 4.0 levels that have the fundamental parts of the game down and like to hit against different styles of play.


WHY PLAY HERE?

Well, first of all it is a nice serene location (i.e. no basketball courts, grandstands, or any other type of distraction). Secondly, consider the cost options to play else elsewhere in-and-around the city...


1) unless you have endless tennis competitors on your roll-a-dex, you'll need a web-based database/system to find people. Most of these tennis databases/systems charge in different ways. Fact, Meetup charges me a premium every month because of the member pool size and this has to be  prepaid just to keep the group alive.

2) if you play anywhere in NYC, you will need a permit which will currently cost you $15 for a single day (or $200 for a yearly). To be more specific, these two options really only entitle you to one hour of singles play (vs. 2 hours here), meaning your partner will also need a permit.

3) new balls are provided at the beginning of each day. Typical extra-duty balls run about $3 per can off-the-shelf, so if you are an avid player...you'll save time and money running around picking-up tennis balls.

4) if someone were to break a string, or you just want to try a different racquet for an evaluation (i.e. lighter weight, bigger head, tighter strings, etc), racquets are available at no addition cost.

5) seasonally "clean" courts. Throughout the year tennis courts pile up with blowing leaves, pollen, acorns, etc. I get here early every session to ensure the courts are clean. I do this with a battery-powered blower and if any body knows anything about batteries...its that they don't last! Each time I have to replace one (which only does one court), it cost me nearly $100 for each.

6) portions of fee here actually go repairing the courts and/or nets. Case-and-point the cement required to fill cracks which was recently done by myself.

7) there are port-a-potty's and 2 drinking fountains available for all to use

8) no dress code required like some places...but proper edict is appreciated


9) based on the talent that signup, I may ask people to move around to establish a competitive session for all those involved


Hopefully this addresses all those questions like: is it free or why does it cost.

WAYS TO RSVP...

Within Meetup, just click RSVP for the time slot that works best with your schedule and be resposible to attend. You can prepay (eliminating the need to remember to carry cash) a number of ways:

Reserve via PayPal ([masked]) vs. cash and select friends (not service) to avoid additional PayPal fees

OR

1. Create an account at MindBodyOnline scheduling software:

https://clients.mindbodyonline.com/classic/home?studioid=152916

2. Decide which package you want to purchase:

1 session = $25; Use Promo Code = T15TS1 

3 sessions @ $20 = $60; Use Promo Code = T15TS3 

6 sessions @ $17 = $102; Use Promo Code = T15TS6 

10 sessions @ $15 = $150; Use Promo Code = T15TS10

3. Go to the Online Store and before Checking Out; APPLY the Promo code of your choice to receive discounted pricing.  

4. Go to the Day and Time of your choice to RSVP your attendance WEATHER

Weather is always an unpredictable thing but remember, just because a forecast says 30% chance of showers...that also means 70% chance of no showers. Also with the 30% it may be in your area, but not where the courts are. Lastly, if it does sprinkle...we have the necessary equipment to dry them.

http://www.accuweather.com/en/us/new-york-ny/10032/hourly-weather-forecast/3727_pc

DIRECTIONS

We are directly south of the George Washington Bridge right on the Hudson River. Best ways to get there are A train, M4 or M98 bus, biking along the river or driving and parking on Riverside Drive behind the Presbyterian hospital (being the less favorite).

http://www.google.com/maps/@40.8494798,-73.9430776,16z?hl=en

(walking via 181 street subway stop)

1. Take A Train to 181st Street Station (sit in the back of the train).

2. Walk West on 181st Street which turns into Plaza Lafayette.

3. Make a Right, on Riverside Drive to the light green Pedestrian Crossover Bridge.

4. Cross the pedestrian bridge and follow the ramp down proceeding toward the GW Bridge which zigzags (crossing over the railroad tracks), and down the hill.

5. Arrive at the courts on your left.

Please plan an additional 15 minutes for weekend subway schedule delays and note its takes an additional 15 minutes to walk from 181st Street Station to the courts, so please arrive before scheduled slot so everyone can start on time.

<a href="http://www.accuweather.com/en/us/new-york-ny/10032/hourly-weather-forecast/3727_pc"></a>

results.description:
Come join us for outdoor tennis at Washington Park in Union City, which is off of the 9th Street light rail station. Bring your sweats, your racquet, plenty of water and balls and we'll see you there! As this event is not designed to match up folks, courts are assigned on first-come first-served basis. So get in early and grab a court.

You can find each other in the waiting area and/or looking on the courts. It would help if you make a mental note of the profile picture of those attending.


Although we won't enforce attendance, it would be polite to attend if you commit because others are looking to find others to hit with.

Cross your fingers that it won't rain as inclement weather cancels the meetup.

If you have any questions, feel free to email the organizer.
results.how_to_find_us: Be sure to check the site for those who have signed up. We're usually easy to spot.

results.description:
UPDATE JULY 7: This hike was originally scheduled for September 20.

Brisk walkers only. Will walk most of the Marathon route, starting at 94th St. and 4th Ave., Brooklyn and ending outside of Tavern on the Green in Central Park, Manhattan, including 4 boroughs and 4 bridges. 

Total distance is not quite 24 miles but there are countless drop-off points. There may also be an optional “off-marathon” extension of the walk. Bring water and lunch (or will stop to buy). Bad weather cancel.

MEET: 8:30 AM at Fort Hamilton Memorial Triangle, bounded by 4th Ave., 5th Ave. and 94th St. in Brooklyn. Take R train to 95th St. terminal which is at 4th Ave

LEADER: Steve Gofner [masked] [masked]


Contact hike leader directly if you have questions about the hike.

Free for paid annual Shorewalkers members, $3 for non-members, visit www.shorewalkers.org to join.

Details:

1 game (7 v 7) : Two halves of 30 minutes each with a break in between

-Please bring a fun and chill attitude. Absolutely no rough playing, slide-tackling or berating others; You’ll be asked to leave.

-Turf, AG cleats, or sneakers - no wet ground monster spikes.

-$4.00 goes for maintaining the website, equipment, and organization.

Rules:

This is a chill game so please bring a chill attitude; no meatheads or a$$holes. Organizers have the final say (i.e. if a ball is out of bounds we call it). 
It’s a small pitch so no corners kicks; just throwins.

Directions:

How to get to Brooklyn Bridge Park PIER 2 Sports Field:

To get past the BQE, you must enter Brooklyn Bridge Park on foot either fromm the south (at Joralemon St. & Furman St.) or the north (at Old Fulton St. & Furman St.)  Pier 2 is roughly halfway between these two entrances.  We play on the artificial grass field at the far end of the pier, behind the basketball courts & roller rink.

Google these coordinates:[masked], [masked]

Brooklyn Bridge Park is accessible by several subway lines (A/C, 2/3, 4/5, F, R) and bus routes (B25, B63)

Cancellation:

We'll play rain or shine.  We'll only cancel if there are fewer than 10 people going, or if there's lightning in the area.

results.description:
Flag Football Game at Cunningham Park (196th St and Union Turnpike) in Queens. Come out and join us!

We have cones and flags so all you need is cleats if that is what you prefer. GAMES WILL ALWAYS BE PLAYED REGARDLESS OF THE WEATHER CONDITIONS i.e. rain, snow, cold, mud, ice, storm, hurricane, etc...we never cancel games due to weather...games are fun and competitive, all skill levels are welcome, please contact me if you have any questions.

NOTE: PLEASE RSVP "YES" ONLY IF YOU ARE GOING TO SHOW UP TO THE GAME.  YOU CAN CHANGE YOUR RSVP IF SOMETHING COMES UP (OR IF YOU DON'T WANT TO PLAY IF IT'S TOO COLD/IT'S RAINING/IT'S SNOWING) AND YOU CAN'T MAKE IT.  NO-SHOWS WILL BE REMOVE FROM THE GROUP.  IT IS IMPORTANT TO HAVE AN ACCURATE HEAD COUNT SO WE KNOW HOW MANY PEOPLE ARE REALLY COMING.

ere are some of the new changes we have made and a reminder of some of the guidelines we already have:

1) You can not add  guests to your RSVP.  Anyone is free to come and play IF AND ONLY IF you have a profile in meetup and have joined our group.  It's 100% FREE to join and it only takes about 2 minutes to sign up and RSVP.  There are also FREE mobile apps for iPhones and Android phones so you can RSVP easily on the go.  If any of your friends has been playing and wants to continue to play, ask them to go to http://www.meetup.com/Cunningham-Park-Football/ and sign up and RSVP individually.  YOU CAN NOT PLAY if you're not signed up and RSVPd.

2) The first 20 people that RSVP for the game, will play a 9-on-9 game with 1 sub.  Everyone on the waiting list will pick players and play against the winner of the game.  Games will be to 2 scores.  If a team gets 2 scores, with the score 2-1, the other team gets one (1) more possession to try to score and tie the game.  If the game is tied again, the game is now to 3 points and the same rule applies, once one of the teams gets score #3, the other team gets just one (1) more possession to try to tie the game.  If 20 or less players show up to the game, game can be played to whatever score everyone agrees to.

3) If you're one of the first 20 to RSVP, but you're late, the next person on the waiting list that's present on the field will take your place and play in the first game.

4) On a safety, ball stays at the goal line and the next down will be played.  For example: If a 2nd down play is ran and a safety occurs, the ball stays at the goal line and the 3rd down will be played.

5) On an OBVIOUS "Defensive Pass interference", the ball will stay at the line of scrimmage but you reset your plays and start at 1st down again.  For example: If a 3rd down play is ran and a DPI occurs, the ball stays at the line of scrimmage and a 1st down will be played, then 2nd, then 3rd...etc.

6) On an OBVIOUS "Offensive Pass interference", the ball stays at the line of scrimmage and the offensive time will lose a down.  For example: If a 2nd down play is ran and an OPI occurs, the offensive team will now be on a 4th down situation from the line of scrimmage.

7) As you might have noticed we have had very few injuries (knock on wood) throughout the years.  This is why we wanted to remind you of the following:

-Stiff arming, flag guarding and hand slapping are NOT ALLOWED.

-Blocks from the back are NOT allowed ad they're obviously dangerous and can cause injuries.

-VERY IMPORTANT: If you are the offensive player and have the ball in your hands, you MUST avoid contact and CAN NOT under any circumstances lower your shoulders and try to initiate contact with an defensive player.  This is flag football, if you're looking for a different type of game there are plenty of other places and leagues to play flag or full-contact football.

8) Donations:  I pay the monthly fee for hosting these meetups and never charge anyone.  All we asked for you is to drop at least $1 in the container we have set up for this, all the money is used for equipment, flags, cones, etc.  You can click on "Group Tools > Money" and see where all the money is going.  If we buy anything with that money we record the transaction and upload a picture of the receipt of whatever equipment we bought.  Next thing we want to get are end zone weighted pylons and we want to buy orange rope so we can mark the field faster and more accurately to avoid any arguments about where the first down is or what not.

IMPORTANT: WE ARE ALL ADULTS AND OBVIOUSLY CAN'T FORCE ANYONE TO DO ANYTHING.  WE NEED EVERYONE'S COOPERATION TO FOLLOW THESE SIMPLE GUIDELINES TO KEEP THE GAME FUN AND COMPETITIVE.  IF FOR ANY REASON YOU DISAGREE OR BELIEVE THAT THESE GUIDELINES DO NOT FIT YOUR STYLE OF PLAY OR WHAT YOU'RE LOOKING FOR ON A PICK-UP GAME, YOU'RE WELCOME TO PLAY WITH A DIFFERENT MEETUP GROUP OR IN ANY OTHER PICK-UP GAME...NO HARD FEELINGS.

If you have any suggestions, questions or concerns, please feel free to reach me at[masked] or [masked]

Regards,

Carlos

results.description:
Distance: 15 miles Walk the Queens waterfront from Flushing to Bayside. Walk through Flushing, College Point, Malba, Whitestone, Fort Totten, and Bayside. Moderate pace. Some drop-off points.

Meet: Main Street station, # 7 train at 9: 00 a.m., northeast corner (By AT&T store).

Important: Bring water and lunch. There is no place to obtain food or water where we will be having lunch.

Leader: Bill Wrublewski [masked] [masked]


Contact hike leader directly if you have questions about the hike.

Free for paid annual Shorewalkers members, $3 for non-members, visit www.shorewalkers.org to join. If you are not a paid Shorewalkers member, please pay the hike leader at the beginning of the hike.

results.description:
The year's most dapper motorcycling event is coming up on Sunday, September 27th! 

On Sunday September 27th 2015, more than 30,000 smartly-dressed gentlefolk in over 400 cities will straddle the saddles of their café racers, bobbers, scramblers and other marvelous custom motorcycles to raise awareness and help fund the cure for prostate cancer. In grand style, dapper gents and elegant ladies shall ride their steeds, spreading merriment and joy throughout their communities while raising awareness for a pressing men’s health issue.

New York is a powerful backdrop for an already-astounding spectacle, and this year’s ride promises to be bigger, better, and more dapper than ever before. With a new course being set that will highlight some of the city’s most beloved landmarks–from the bustling square of the South Street Seaport to the stunning plaza of Lincoln Center, from the meeting place of the world in Times Square to the cobbled streets of the Meatpacking District–the 2015 Distinguished Gentleman’s Ride will be the epitome of photogenic and philanthropic. In addition to raising funds for research endeavors here in the United States, our dapper riders also seek to polish the image of motorcyclists everywhere. The ride is slow, safe, and above all, civilized, in true gentlemanly (and ladylike) fashion. The course is being redesigned for this year, so make sure you register to get updates. Register at www.gentlemansride.com and start your fundraising!

results.description:
Excellent turnout and games last week. We will be playing at the softball field, as noted on the map.

As I mentioned last week, please bring your membership dues. New members do not have to pay until their 3rd time. If you want to paypal me, send it to [masked]. Please make sure the funds are from your bank account and not from a credit card!

Questions or problems then give me a call at[masked] but I usually won't be answering as I'll be setting up the field or playing...

***************

 
Attendance will be strictly enforced. No-shows will be marked and posted on the subsequent meetup. First time offenders will be given the benefit of doubt, second time offenders will be warned (consider your name in this email and the number of times you no-showed as warning) and those who miss a third time will be banned, permanently! Those that show up without RSVP to circumvent this will be warned as well. We need to know how many people will show up in order to decide if we have enough people for a game that week.

All new members are allowed to play for free the first three games. If you decide to continue with us then please remit the membership fee. Our season starts on 9/1 and the $10 is good for all games for the year

MEMBERS ONLY: Check GROUP PAGES for call in numbers which will also be emailed to you the day before and the morning of the MeetUp.

Live call-in meet-up. 

Intinerary:

9:00 Call in everone say hello

9:05 I will lead group in 5 minute centering excercise to get our minds free and clear and ready to write.

9:15 Intention setting for the writing session

9:20-9:50 leave call--writing session

9:50 come back to the call-share on writing experiences

9:56 Set intention for writing commitment for the week out loud

10:00 Call ends--post your intention on private facebook page (details on how to join private facebook page will be shared on the call)

I have a FREE WORKBOOK you can download on developing a writing practice that works at:

http://www.clearcreativecoaching.com/are-you-avoiding-your-dream/

If you are calling from a country other than the US, Uk or Ireland--shoot me an email at [masked] and I will send you the appropriate numbers. Thanks!

results.description:
Duration: ~ 12 mile

Difficulty: moderate to strenuous

Meeting point:  parking lot at the R-D trailhead:

https://www.google.co.uk/maps/dir/41.2815928,-73.9623494/41.2813306,-73.9625864/@41.2806287,-73.9691204,864m/data=!3m1!1e3?hl=en

There is a  train from GC, arriving at Peekskill  at  8:48 AM.   If you need a ride from the station,  drop a comment bellow, someone can usually offer a ride.

Please bring appropriate clothing and footwear, lots of water,  and  map  (Northern Harriman)

++

NOTE: You are responsible for bringing appropriate gear, supplies, clothing, first aid, and lights. You should review topographic maps and trail features carefully; understanding topography of any hike is key to your knowing where you are, where you're going, and how to get back. See suggestions for GEAR on the "About" page for additional gear ideas.

You agree when you sign up for this group or any of the events that you have read and understand the below.

If you join us for a hike (or any other event), please understand that you are responsible for your own preparedness and well-being and will hold no one else liable in case of injury or mishap. You agree not to hold the Organizer, Assistant Organizers, or any other members responsible for any injuries, mishaps, or any other situation that may happen at a planned event. You are responsible to research the event, know the area, and bring the proper gear.

Your attendance on a hike signifies that you have read and accept the terms of this liability waiver. Full waiver can be found on the ABOUT page.

*** Game subject to full roster of about 16 players.
results.name: Sunday Morning - Second Match

results.description:
Aside from our League play we offer Open Play 6 days a week. 1 hour and 45 minute sessions only $10 Saturday and Sunday runs.

Format: 3 teams of 5 per court. Score by 1’s. Games to 7. Winner stays but must sit after 2 games. No refs. Call your own. Our moderator will help things along. All players must bring a white and a dark shirt (not grey). This is a friendly run. Anyone with the wrong attitude will not be allowed back. Age: 21+

The A/B & B/C breakdown is purely a self rating device to try and split things up in an enjoyable manner. Think of it as if you were going to the park to play. If you are average or above go to the A court. If you are average or below go to B.  It is not exact. There is always going to be some crossover.  


***Please note- RSVP'g on Meetup will not reserve your spot. Please go to our website to sign up.*** A credit card payment is required to reserve your space. Just click the session that interests you.


http://www.nyurban.com/basketball/open_play_bb.html

We will send you a confirmation email. Show up at the Gym with I.D. We will have you on our list but please bring your receipt. No payment at the door.
results.name: Basketball Open Play- Sunday Morning-  Brandeis 9:30 AM

results.description:
THE GAME: Informal Meet Up 7vs7 or 8vs8 (depending on location)


Please bring GOOD ATTITUDE. This game is ideally for INTERMEDIATE to ADVANCED players, NOT for BEGINNERS.


There are not scheduled games at this time and location for the Fall 15',however, we have no permit. If the field is taken,we might move to Baruch Playground (nearby) or any of the East River Parks/fields. In case we can't play, fee's will be fully refunded.


RSVP GUIDELINES: IMPORTANT:  You must be on the RSVP list to play. If you are not. If you RSVP and don't show, you'll be removed from the group for 4 weeks.

PLAY GUIDELINES:

• We usually play for at least 1h.30min. with a short water break half time in. Please don't come if you can't play at least 90 minutes

• We play with 6 feet wide pop-up goals


• No slide tackles. Turf shoes are suggested.

• Respect your teammates and opponents. 

• If you dribble more than you pass - you annoy everybody and will be banned from the group.

•  Refunds are ONLY issued if you change your RSVP more than 24-hrs in advance


• Fees pay for organizer time, meet-up fees and gear

RECOMMENDED GEAR - Turf shoes recommended. No shinguards necessary, we try to keep it competitive but friendly.

POSITIONS: Being a pick up game, there are no permanent positions. If you've been playing forward for half the game and someone who's been playing the back line wants to play up front, give up your position and play some defense. When your team lose the ball, don't just stand and watch. Please support your teammates by get back on your side and play some defense. Thanks.

ABOUT THE FIELD - We always play on Turf fields

**INJURIES & DISCLAIMER**: Group Organizer(s) and Group Organization Assumes NO Risk Or individual Liability For Personal Injuries Incurred By Members/Players On The Field Or During Any Of Our Activities: Pick Up Games, Or Other Events. By Agreeing To Play, You Are In Receipt Of This Information, And Thereby Warrant That You Are In Good Health And Assume Personal Responsibility For ALL Physical And Accidental Risks Involved With Playing In Our Group, Including But Not Limited to Falls, Injuries, Contact With Other Players, and Field Conditions.

results.description:
Who's ready for something fun & different? A Pub Crawl for Juice... Hangovers Never Felt So GOOD! 

What is a Juice Crawl? 

It's a fun, social and healthy living event similar to a traditional pub crawl except we workout and travel to juice bars. 

Hang with fellow juice lovers, yogis, runners, health conscious individuals etc... Anyone is welcome! Experience a hangover that leaves you feeling energized and healthy. 

1 TICKET COVERS IT ALL: 
Sample 20 + different types of juices. 
Free Yoga Class. 
Total value = over $100

*Tickets for our group are just $35 until Sept 12th. $50 after or save 10% when you bring a friend

*Must purchase ticket in advance at this link to attend - http://www.brownpapertickets.com/event/lou/2156264

The Line Up: 

Vinyasa Yoga by Laughing Lotus BK (workout) 
House of Juice (pre-game) 
Tiny Empire 
Juice Press 
Juicery Kitchen 
Botica Co., juice on tap! 

*Approximate Timeline (may vary): 
9:30am check in 
10:00am yoga 
11:00am pregame 
11:30 crawl begins 
we should end before 2pm 

*If for any reason you are running late or cannot find us, call organizer (Anna)[masked] 

By Subway: 2 min walk from Marcy Ave. J,M,Z Train 0.7 mile from Metropolitan Ave G Train 0.8 mile from Bedford Ave L Train

Check out video to learn more: 

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=spOnIBhb7jc

GET TICKETS HERE - http://www.brownpapertickets.com/event/lou/2156264

</a>

Hi everyone,

Randall's Island is a player's heaven. it has gazillions of fields and open space. Make sure to check what field we will use on the map below. 

CARPOOL: Also, if you are driving, please carpool with other players. The meeting spot in Manhattan is 124th street and 2nd avenue 30 minutes before kickoff time.

BIKING: You can also bike there using the footbridge on 103rd street and FDR drive or you can use the RFK Bridge Walkway

A link to better view this map is here: <a href="http://files.meetup.com/526560/Randalls%20Island%20Fields%20Map.pdf">RANDALL'S ISLAND MAP

Please be at the field 15 minutes earlier so you can get set up, and bring a white and a red t-shirt. We will play for 1.5 hous and you can use cleats since it's a grass field. 


Thank you,

Paul

Details Below:

------------------------------------------------------

Game style and Rules:

1. HAVE FUN!!! It's SOCCER

2. We'll play (2) 45-minute games.

3. We will divide into teams based on everyone's experience and skills.

4. No ball hogging.

5. Please use cleats or turf shoes. Cleats are recommended since it's grass.

6. The games are very laid back; rough play, tackles or sliding are not allowed and will not be tolerated.

7. We'll play with corner kicks and ground kick-ins and big goals-we rotate being goalie.

8. If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Field Location:Click here for: Field Location Map.To see an aerial view of the field on Bing Maps: Aerial Map

DirectionsYou can get to Randall's Island by car, bus, walking or biking. Here is the link to the directions: Getting to Randall's Island

The best ways to get there are:


-Taking the A,C,D, 4,5 or 6 train to 125th st stop and walking or biking east over the RFK Bridge.

-Also, taking the M35 bus from the NW corner of 125th Street and Lexington Ave.

-Also biking across the Walk way located on 103rd street and FDR Drive.

If you have any questions about getting there please e-mail or all us at[masked]

Time: The game will start at the scheduled time sharp. Please be there 15 minutes earlier so we can get set up.

Late arrivals: If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Fee:Please pay the fee through paypal. Part of the proceeds go to NYC SOCCER KIDS (we already donated new soccer balls). It also goes to pay for the site admistration, meet-up fees, cones, soccer balls, and the new goals.

Please bring:A white t-shirt and a red t-shirt to differentiate players of each team. The filed is grassso please bring cleats, sneakers or all terrain shoes.

Cancellations/Refunds: If you won't be able to make it to the game, please change your RSVP to "NO" 48 hours before kickoff time to receive a credit for the next game. This is done to give other members a chance to take your spot. Thank you!

Waiting List: If all the spots are taken, please get on the waiting list. If a spot opens up and you are on the waiting list, you will be sent an automated e-mail letting you know that a spot has just openned :).

Weather Policy: Games will be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe such as snow, sleet or thunderstorms. If the game is cancelled I will send out an e-mail the morning of the game. Please check your e-mail. If you are unsure, or can't get to your e-mail, you can also text me or call me at[masked]-5725.

See you on the pitch!

Paul

results.description:
Did you forget to sing? Perhaps after Third Grade, when the peer pressure set in. Perhaps someone picked out the "Gifted and Talented" - and it wasn't you. Or maybe the Nuns made you sing "God Bless America" and someone laughed. Or you were one of the "Blue Birds" - you moved your mouth but didn't make any sound. Or did you sing beautifully in that Elementary School play? Was it the Middle School chorus, where the boys were thrown out and it ended up a Girls Club that made a sound in three parts, so beautiful nothing to this day has extinguished that feeling? Perhaps you were one of the guys who made harmony in the reverb of the Boys Room, or in the audience at the concert, or the sports stadium, or in the shower?

Or maybe you played an instrument that kept your mouth busy, and you never did get the chance to sing? Was it the race of competition for excellence in something, something else, that left you no time?

Was is the implicit warning, between the lines of the praises of privilege, that you should not express yourself? Did you forget that feeling of camaraderie and being a part of something bigger than yourself? Did you forget that amazement you felt at yourself being able to memorize a large piece and give it your all - weeks and months of practice that lead to a performance, or several, that made you feel powerful, hopeful, inspired and you had drawn upon that experience to guide your life? You had that moment, lifted by the magic of the "ordered progression though time and space," that made life so rich, so romantic, so filled with spirit.

And then did you forget?

Forget that feeling, that high, that experience of joy and sadness, playing the part, being a messenger, a vessel. You forgot that there are scientific studies praising the participation in music and art, the health benefits, the raised white blood cell count, the relaxation response, the breathing, the healing power of sound, or just the old saying, "singing is good for you."

Now you have another chance.

Don't miss it.
results.name: Did You Forget to Sing?

results.description:
I love me some football. Yes, the fake American kind, not the “Futbol” the rest of the world clamors for. I used to play but the old bones and joints are having none of that these days. I think I’ve found a suitable replacement with none of the risk of putting me in traction for 3 months. Let’s play a bit of Ultimate Frisbee.

If you don’t know, now you know…

Ultimate Frisbee is a game structured similar to football minus the danger of bodily injury. You have two teams, a playing field and two end zones; the goal being to advance the frisbee down the field by throwing it to your teammates and catching it in the end zone to score points. That’s it. So utterly simple my five-year old nephew could play. Ok, there are a few more rules to the game but not many. Check ‘em out here
ULTIMATE FRISBEE GAMEPLAY AND RULES.

A $3.00 organization fee will be collected at this event, your host is in the running for hardest working person on meetup.

The important stuff...

• This is a co-ed game so ladies don't be shy to sign up.
And it doesn't matter if you have no athletic ability; you just have to be willing to have a little fun.

• Dress for physical activity! You'll be running A LOT so wear your sneaks, shorts and a t-shirt.

• Bring BOTH a black and white t-shirt. This is how we differentiate teams.

• Rain or similar un-favorable weather cancels the meetup.

• Check the meetup site before leaving for last minute
updates as well as my mobile phone number.

• No guests allowed to play. You can bring a friend to spectate though if you need to hear the roar of the crowd.

• Please DO NOT RSVP if you do not seriously
plan to attend as space is limited. No flakes allowed! If you RSVP and I notice that you have a number of no shows or have a history of last minute cancellations, you will be removed.

results.description:
The heart of our work at New York Zen Center for Contemplative Care is based on the practice of meditation, contemplation, and Zen precepts. To care for the world, we care for ourselves. In caring for ourselves, we care for the whole world.

Meditation has been clinically proven to benefit one’s health and well-being. This often is the initial motivation to begin practice. The promise of a continuous meditation practice is freedom from suffering caused by the many layers of conditioning we foster, in our attempt to maintain a fixed sense of self. The practice of meditation allows us to experience the ease and joy of being: we are fresh and new in each moment.

Meditation is a practice that we do everyday; we gather together as community in support of one another. Our community is made up of Jewish, Catholic, Episcopal, Tibetan and Zen Buddhists and those who don’t identify with any particular tradition.

All are welcome, from those curious about meditation to those who have been meditating for decades. Chairs and cushions are available.
results.name: Let's meet up for Zazen and a Dharma talk!

THERE IS A WAITING LIST FOR THIS EVENT. PLEASE ADJUST YOUR RSVP IF YOUR PLANS HAVE CHANGED SO WE CAN ALLOW OTHERS TO ATTEND. IF THIS IS YOUR THIRD TIME TRYING OUT TSR WE ASK YOU TO PLEASE JOIN OUR CLUB FOR $15 A YEAR MEMBERSHIP WHICH WILL ALLOW YOU TO ATTEND OUR FULL SCHEDULE 6 DAYS A WEEK AND NO NEED TO REGISTER FOR MOST EVENTS. DETAILS AT  http://tsr.nynjtc.org/                                                                MEET Event leader: Bill LaChance,[masked] at 10 AM at the UPPER PARKING LOT opposite entrance to Camp Tamarack. Plan to arrive by 9:45 AM. We will hike the Millstone Trail/Matapan Rock Trail. This loop hike passes interesting and historic millstones, goes by two scenic lakes and climbs to a panoramic viewpoint. 5.5 miles at a moderate pace. Please watch this site on the morning of September 27 for any last minute changes/cancellations. Hiking boots required. Bring water and a snack.
DIRECTIONS:
RAMAPO MOUNTAIN STATE FOREST, Oakland, NJ
I-287 North to Exit 57 (Skyline Drive). Turn left at light onto Skyline Drive.
Upper Lot: Coordinates: N41° 02.85', W74° 15.09' go an additional 1.14 miles on Skyline Drive to lot at top of hill on left.
ALTERNATIVE: Follow Weis Ecology Center directions, but stay on Ringwood Ave., CR 511 past Westbrook Rd. Turn right onto Skyline Drive. The parking areas will be on the right at the top of the hill.

The address to key into GPS for Sunday's hike is 265 Skyline Drive in Oakland NJ. It is the second parking area on the left as you head north on Skyline Dr from 287. The parking is tight and you may need to park along Skyline Drive. You may want to carpool if you can. I am coming from Chatham if anyone wants to ride up with me. I did the hike last Sunday and it is 5.5 miles and should take about 2 1/2 hours depending on our rest breaks, It is not terribly strenuous compared to other hikes I have been on but there are several ups and downs so it will be a good workout. There is also a steep decline near the end that can be avoided by walking the last quarter mile down Skyline Drive. The pace will be moderate so everyone can keep up.See you on Sunday.

results.description:
This Meetup is announced for 10am, but you can also come at 2pm.

Come riding on the beautiful trail system that spans Old Westbury-Brookville-Muttontown. All skill levels are welcome.  It's close and easy to get to from anywhere in the NYC Metro area, by car or by public transportation.

We ride in English tack, in small groups only.  Our horses are excellent: forgiving of beginners, but willing to show skilled riders a good time. If you have the skills, we'll walk-trot-canter, maybe even take a small jump.  Instruction is offered, as needed/desired.  We'll be in the saddle for at least 1 1/4 hours, probably closer to 1 3/4 hours; cost is $100 per person.  

Come discover one of the best riding opportunities in the NY Metro Area.  Don't be confined to the ring -- ride for miles through woods and fields!


We're riding every week.  If you want to come along, email me directly: [masked]

Janet

Your Meetup Organizer
