results.description:
Free. Manhattan. Sunday, September 27th @ 1:00PM

Gotham Yacht Club is looking for fun sailors and non-sailors to join us this weekend for the first trip of fall and likely the last trip of the season!

We take trips around the Manhattan area in a 50-foot Beneteau. We usually sail the Hudson--the Statue of Liberty to the George Washington Bridge--but also go to Martha's Vineyard, the Hamptons and the Jersey Shore.

We like to fill the boat up with about 20-30 people. No sailing experience is required, but preference is given to experienced sailors since the trips can’t happen without them.  As space is limited on the boat, simply RSVP’ing “Yes” to an event does not guarantee a spot on the boat.  If a spot is available, you will be contacted directly with event details.

Sailors can take their first trip to get acquainted and enjoy the party.  From then on, sailors can choose to (1) work the morning shift and help out with the launch or (2) work the evening shift and help out with the return.  Generally, sailors spend less than a third of the trip working and can take the rest of the time to relax and socialize.

The current crew is made up of young, educated Manhattan professionals. We are looking to meet new people who will enjoy the atmosphere and company of everyone on the boat. 

If you and/or your friends are interested, please copy, paste, and fill out the questionnaire below in an email and send to [masked]. Please include your current email address so that we can contact you directly.  Since boat trips fill up in advance and we receive many applicants, we may not get back to you immediately.  

We look forward to seeing you on the water!

EVERY APPLICANT (REVELERS, SUNBATHERS, ETC.)

Q) Please provide a link to your page on Facebook or other social networking site. Please attach a picture if you don’t have a page on a social networking site.

Q) How old are you?

Q) Where did you attend school?

Q) Will you please tell us a little bit about yourself?

FOR SAILOR APPLICANTS

Q) How many days, lifetime, have you crewed on, but not captained, a sailboat?

Q) How many days, lifetime, have you captained a sailboat?

Q) How many days, lifetime, have you crewed on but not captained, a non-sailboat?

Q) How many days, lifetime, have you captained, a non-sailboat?

Q) Will you tell us a little bit about your sailing experience?


Please copy and paste all questions and answers and send in an email to [masked].

Thank you!


FAQ


Q: Do you have to pay to attend a boat party?


A: No, all boat parties are absolutely free.  You may want to bring food and drinks, which are on a potluck basis.


Q: The specific location is not listed.  Where do we meet for the boat party?


A: Unfortunately, we cannot fit everyone who RSVPs to a MeetUp event onto the boat.  There are some crew members and attendees who are not part of the MeetUp group, so there may be less space than it appears.  In order to avoid miscommunication and needing to leave people on the dock, specific details (including meeting location) are sent to members individually.  Our club's assistant generally does not work after business hours on Friday, so if you have not have received an individual email by then, it's unlikely that you will be able to attend that week’s boat party.


Q: How often are the boat parties?


A: Boat parties are generally every weekend, either on a Saturday or Sunday. They generally last all afternoon into the early evening. 


Q: Do I have to fill out the questionnaire?


A: Yes! Please fill out the questionnaire as thoroughly as possible.  If you are uncomfortable posting any of the information on your profile, please email your responses to [masked].  Without a complete application, you will not be considered to receive an invitation.  The trips last several hours, so we will have 20-30 people in a confined space for an extended period of time. Therefore, we need to have an idea of who we are inviting on the boat and ensure that we have a proper crew.  Please fill out the questionnaire if you are interested in sailing with Gotham Yacht Club.

This neighborhood is heavily Democratic but we want to let them know about The People's Candidate running in the primary. People love to do their grocery shopping on Sunday, so we're going to have a table parked near the entrance of the store or the park across the street. Look for the placards/table or someone wearing a DSA tee-shirt!

"These are wonderful, unique workshops. You will be amazed at how much healing and joy you receive during a class. Join us! If this is your first class, please join us as our gift to you. You can find more info at LifeChangingHealingCenter.com." Love, Sondra

"It was truly the most powerful healing I have ever been blessed to be a part of." - attendee

If you are looking for a change for the better, or just want an extra boost on your spiritual journey, please join us in these enlightening workshops. You won't be surprised by what you learn in these workshops, you will be TRANSFORMED! In these transformational workshops, you will be brought through a process which will bring you more happiness and love than you can imagine right now. You will enter a powerful healing vortex that will support you and help you release what you no longer need to carry. Through spiritual teachings, channeled meditations and inspirational music, you will enjoy powerful personal journeys while challenging old belief systems that may have kept you stuck in limiting and unhealthy patterns. Take the first step. We are here.

"This Sunday session was like food to the soul. You sat back, enjoyed the good music and spirit took over. What a wonderful way to enjoy a Sunday afternoon, relaxing around like-minded energetic people under the direction of a truly inspirational teacher, Sondra. Thank you for your time, guidance and direction."


"Your class helped me release so much pent up stuff that I didn't even realize was there, I feel like I took this huge baggage off of my back, thank you thank you thank you!"

"I am so honored and feel so blessed you are offering this workshop, it is unlike any other being offered on the planet right now...."

"My life will never be the same."

"The work that we're doing in your classes is just so incredibly powerful. Thank you so much. I love you so much."

"I am still amazed by the magnificence of the evening yesterday. With love and deep appreciation to you."

"Thank you for a wonderful healing yesterday. Sondra, you are a wonderful example of love and it transfers onto all the people you come in contact with. Love,love,love. "

"It was an honor and a privilege to attend your workshop. I wanted to attend your workshop because I know you have such a beautiful and strong connection to God and it is felt by everyone. Thank you."

results.description:
Where: Fort Washington Park - Tennis Court #9
 When: 11:00 am - 1:00 pm (1st Hour is Lesson, 2nd Hour is Practice and Play with other students)
Level: Beginners and Advanced Beginners are All Welcome
Max Players: 10 


How to RSVP for the next Tennis Lesson:

1. Create an account at MindBodyOnline scheduling software:

https://clients.mindbodyonline.com/classic/home?studioid=152916

2. Decide which package you want to purchase:

1 class = $35 Promo code = T15GR1

3 classes = $99 Promo code = T15GR3

6 classes = $179 Promo code = T15GR6

10 classes  = $269 Promo code = T15GR10

3. Go to the Online Store and before Checking Out; APPLY the Promo code of your choice to receive discounted pricing.  

4. Go to the Day and Time of your choice to RSVP your attendance


What's included? 
- Tennis Pro
- Learn something new 
- Meet fun people 
- Get some exercise 
- 1 hour lesson from a Tennis Pro and 1 hour of social hitting
- Racquet available if necessary


Attendance

Unable to attend or need to change the day?  If you change your RSVP on the theMindBodyOnline account with more than 48 hours of notice, you will have that class credited to use in the future with with no problem.  If you try to cancel within 48 hours on yourMindBodyOnline account, you will be charged for the class as a late cancellation or No-Show. I understand things can come up, just be respectful to the class and other students to change your RSVP on the MindBodyOnline account to allow others to join in on that time slot.

WATCH THE VIDEO BELOW AND SEE THE F-U-N !!!

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=m86vJgPvsxo

ARE YOU READY FOR SOME TENNIS?!?!?


The main reason people don't play tennis in NYC is because: 

It is Too Costly (lessons and permit)

It is Difficult to obtain court space

It is too Hard to find someone to play with

People don't have a Racquet to play with

The good news is you found this site and the #1 resource for anyone interested in tennis in NYC.  At Tennis World, You will be able to:

Find Affordable Lessons

Have an available court

Plenty of People to Meet & Play With (Very Social Fun Group)

There is always extra racquets on hand to use at no cost

It doesn't matter if you have never played or a little rusty, this class is for you because everyone is a little rusty :-)

You'll learn the basics to stop hitting that tennis ball over the fence or chasing it on the other courts. You will learn great tips to start enjoying the game immediately.

Throughout these sessions, you will learn/practice: Ground strokes, serving, volleys, overheads, lobs, footwork and strategies. Each session will focus on different aspects and will provide ample time to practice too! 

In addition to improving your game, you will also get to MEET LOTS OF NEW PEOPLE and have an AWESOME TIME MAKING NEW TENNIS FRIENDS AND HITTING THE BALL. The sessions are both very social and technique oriented.

This event has sold out quickly in the past, so please make sure you RSVP quickly.

What to wear: You'll be running, jumping and moving around.  Make sure to wear sneakers & an outfit that will be appropriate for the weather and exercise. 

What to bring: We recommend water, towel and possibly a snack bar.  If you have a racquet, bring it down, otherwise one can be provided for you at no cost.

Want a Private or Semi-Private Lesson?

A package of Private lessons cost between $55-$65 and Semi-Private lessons (2 people in a class) cost $86.  Create an account at:

https://clients.mindbodyonline.com/classic/home?studioid=152916

Book your appointment online and Call or Text <a>[masked]</a> to confirm.

Weather and Refunds (Rain out?) 

In the event of the class being cancelled due to rain, you will not receive a refund, rather a credit that you will be able to apply for any future class during the week or weekend.  You can also contact: <a>[masked]</a>, to confirm before leaving your apartment to be on the safe side regarding weather and cancellations. 

Remember just because a forecast says 30% chance of showers, that also means 70% chance of no showers. Also with the 30% it may be in your area but not where the courts are.  Lastly, if it does rain, how much rain is estimated, mostly it is passing showers and tennis can resume soon thereafter.

Check out the weather report on the link below:

http://www.accuweather.com/en/us/new-york-ny/10032/hourly-weather-forecast/3727_pc

Questions? 
- Please refrain from using the comment/conversation fields below. 

TEXT: <a>[masked]</a> for a quicker response. 

- Your instructor can be reached at <a>[masked]</a>, if you're running late/lost 
- Yes, bathrooms and fountains are close by the courts

DIRECTIONS: Fort Washington Park Tennis Courts

Via 181 Street Subway Stop

1. Take A Train to 181st Street Station. Sit in the back of the train.

2. Walk West on 181st Street which turns into Plaza Lafayette.

3. Make a Right, Walk 1 minute on Riverside Drive to the Light Green Pedestrian Bridge

4. Make a Left to walk across the bridge.

5. Take the Ramp down from the bridge, Follow the path which will zigzag slightly.

6. Follow the path under the GW Bridge.

7. Just South of the GW Bridge, arrive at Court #9 for your lesson with Tennis World.

Plan an additional 15 minutes for weekend subway schedule times

It will take about 15 minutes to walk from 181st Street Station to Court #9. Plan to arrive about 15 minutes before scheduled class to start on time.

To see all possible directions of the various locations on how to arrive, visit the link below:

http://www.tennisworldnyc.com/where-to-play/

Climate Crisis and Community: Mobilizing for a Safe Future
A climate teach-in for everyone!

Sunday, September 27th, 2015, 1:30 - 6:30 PM
Goddard Riverside Community Center, 593 Columbus Avenue Part of 350.org's "Power Through Paris" Global Day of Action

Register on Eventbrite: http://climate-community.eventbrite.com

Free and open to the public. Donations welcome at the door. Refreshments served.

350NYC invites you to a day of videos, workshops, speakers, and art action-planning, to cap off this important week when Pope Francis will be speaking to the U.S. Congress and the United Nations about climate, poverty and the future of the planet. We come together to learn what we can do to get OFF fossil fuels and ON to clean renewable energy NOW!

Play your part in growing the Climate Movement. Join us to demonstrate your resolve to restore environmental sanity to the world in the lead up to the Global Climate Treaty Negotiations in Paris in December. Learn what you can do to make a difference. ** UPDATED WORKSHOPS (I will be speaking about community level responses to climate change at 4:15 - Dan)

Art is an Organizing Strategy: using art for impact the Oct. 14th and beyond. Presenters: Rachel Schragis and Crystal, People’s Climate Arts Carbon Bombs – the Global Movement to Keep It in the Ground! Presenter: Pat Almonrode, 350NYC and Secretary of the Broadway Democrats Pipelines, Oil trains, Barges and Tankers - Local Threats and Activism Presenter: Jeremy Cherson, Riverkeeper Climate Change: Focus on Food & Water Presenters: Katherine Schwarz & and Diane Lane-Hymans, WE ACT for Environmental Justice Climate and Biodiversity: where do they meet? Presenter: Nadav Gazit, Research & Production Assistant, Center for Biodiversity and Conservation (CBC), American Museum of Natural History. Presenters: Rachel Schragis and Crystal Clarity, People’s Climate Arts Interfaith Action on Climate Presenters: Catherine Skopic, Rep to the UN for the Anglican Communities Office at the UN; Shut Down Indian Point Now and, Robert Kolodny, NY Buddhist Climate Action Network. Sustainable Solutions & Community Action Presenters: Dan Miner, Beyond Oil NYC & Lyna Hinkel, 350NYC The Road Through Paris: Action Planning Presenters: Marilyn Vasta, 350NYC & PCMNY and Brigid Flaherty, ALIGN Fossil Fuel Divestment-Reinvestment Presenters: Lisa Di Caprio, 350NYC & Sierra Club and Olivia Rich, NYU Divest 100% Renewables in NYC by 2030 Presenters: Elizabeth (Betta) Broad, Program Manager, Energy & Climate, Catskill Mountain Keeper, and Donnel Baird, CEO BlocPower.org

Wind ON, Port Ambrose OFF – Now’s the time to choose renewables for New York. Presenter: Patrick Robbins, Sane Energy Project **

SUNDAY BRUNCH series of our group writing sessions.  

Meeting at Playwright. This will be recurring..  

We will be in the middle of the matinee showtimes so we should just miss the crowds.  Brunch at Playwright INCLUDES a brunch drink so yea!!!!  


Bring charged laptops and/or  pen/pad combos.  


Aiming for rooftop seating (weather permitting). And as always, Look for our sign. 


Check the page day of for updates on where we  are sitting and how to find us. 
(As always group rules - we arrive, order, chat for a few then we write in timed intervals of 1 hour with no conversations, take a short break, then start up the timer again.   We are not a group for sharing and critiquing each other's work, this group just focuses on getting writing done.  However, sharing with each other is Never discouraged, but our sessions are not for group reading and discussing. Just so you are aware of what to expect.)
Hope to see you there.

results.description:
Our poll winner (buy a whopping one vote!) is Moving Mars by Greg Bear.

"Moving Mars is a story of human courage and love set within the greater saga of a planetary liberation movement. Mars is a colonial world, governed by corporate interests on Earth. The citizens of Mars are hardworking, but held back by their lack of access to the best education, and the desire of the Earthly powers to keep the best new inventions for themselves. The young Martians -- the second and third generations born on Mars -- have little loyalty to Earth, and a strong belief that their planet can be independent. The revolution begins slowly, but will grow in power over decades of political struggle until it becomes irresistible.

Told through the eyes of an extraordinary character, Casseia Majumdar, a daughter of one of Mars' oldest, most conservative Binding Multiples, Moving Mars is Greg Bear's brilliant conception of the human colonization of the red planet, with lovingly painted details and a grand historical sweep, embellishing an audacious scientific speculation."

LOCATION
We will be meeting at the Citigroup Atrium.

There is an entrance at 53rd and Lexington Avenue off of the 53rd and Lex subway stop. You have to go down the steps; the subway station will be on your right and the Atrium will be straight in front of you. The doors are labelled.   

There is a Barnes and Noble (with a Starbucks inside) located on the next level up at 54th and 3rd. If you enter through the B&N, you will need to go through B&N (up a few steps from the entrance), past the NOOK display to the glass doors and down the escalator to the Atrium.

There is free wi-fi in the Citigroup Atrium. There are also free public restrooms. Please let me know if you have any questions about the location.

It's probably more fun if you read/finish the book.  But if you don’t, you are still welcome to come. But there will be spoilers!

WHERE TO BUY
The book is available in many formats, including Kindle (for only $1.99!) and paperback at Amazon and a Nook and paperback at Barnes & Noble.


IMPORTANT RSVP POLICY
If you RSVP and find you cannot make it, please change your RSVP so that we are not waiting for you. Please change it no less than two hours before the scheduled meeting time. If you RSVP and do not show, you will have to pay $10 when you attend your next event. This is to prevent those on the waiting list from missing out on an event.   

The RSVP policy is the same as for the general meetup. Please see the entire policy here:  http://www.meetup.com/NYSciFi-Fantasy/pages/Membership_Policy/

results.description:
Join this special free LIVE online event from across the world.

With meditation and visualisation, this powerful 30 minute broadcast features beautiful sounds and music to uplift, energise and inspire.

Experience the benefit of the enhanced collective energy of meditating with other people, whilst being in the comfort of your own home or office.

Each meditation includes an introduction, followed by a time in which to meditate in whatever way is easy and natural to you.

You are then guided through a visualisation enabling you to focus on living your ideal life.

 

Participating Live:

The broadcast begins promptly at 2.00pm and finishes at 2.30pm.

***Please click to join Meditation 101 Live at the scheduled broadcast time ***

Please note that the meditation and visualisation are pre-recorded to ensure sound quality however participation with other people from across the world is live.

Meditation 101 Live works best with the following internet browsers: Internet Explorer, Chrome, Safari and Opera.

If you need any technical help connecting to Meditation 101 Live please click here.

Testimonials:

"That was absolutely amazing! I don't think I have ever fully let go and quieted my mind like that before. I feel so inspired. By the end of the session I was filled with so much love - love for myself, for others, and love coming from Source. Unconditional, pure love. Thank you." C.L.

"Instead of the 'knowledge gained', I find it appropriate to give a 5 star to 'raising my vibrations' during the meditation.... the energy of the group was Amazing and ZINGING! Thanks... " - S

"Thank you Tracy for a wonderful start to the day. Amazing calmness capturing everyone's energy on the class. Look forward to attending the next on-line class. Thank you." - B.J

results.description:
Title: Daevabad
Word Count: 165,000
Genre: Fantasy

This is a one-time-only meeting to critique the entire novel. Readers should be prepared to read the entire novel prior to the meeting and be prepared to discuss the book based on some questions provided at the end of the manuscript for consideration. Also, any written comments you would like to make as you read would be greatly appreciated!

When you RSVP, Shan will send you the entire manuscript.


Here is a teaser: 

In nineteenth century Cairo, Nahri is just trying to make a living. Between conning Ottoman bashas and pretending to be a faith healer, she has little time or patience for the supposed magical world. But when she accidentally summons a drunken djinn slave with an over fondness for arrows, she gets dragged into a world she barely understands; to a city whose delicate political system her very blood threatens to upset.

Daevabad has seen it all; the ancient stones of the magical city bore mute witness to the rise of the mighty Nahids and their bloody downfall at the hands of the djinn. And yet as Nahri journeys to Daevabad unaware, violence is already threatening to overtake the city when a popular extremist leader is executed for treason. His death leaves his silent benefactor, a young djinn prince, torn between loyalty to his family and loyalty to a faith which calls out for justice – even at the point of a sword.

Inspired by the myths of the Arabic and Persian speaking world, as much as the headlines currently roiling it, Daevabad is an epic fantasy that shows often not even magic can soften the iron grip of history and politics.

Shan prepared some questions as a guide, but would also appreciate any notes in the text itself.
results.name: Daevabad Beta Reading Meeting

results.description:
Come join the

Ma’at Ritual

For Wealth, Love, and Truth!

Ma’at, daughter of Ra, is the Egyptian/Kemetic patron Goddess of Truth, Justice, and Righteousness. But equally important, she symbolizes wealth, abundance, relationships, and consistency. Her 42 Negative Confessions were the true inspiration for the Bible’s Ten Commandments. But unlike the Western world, which applies a one-size-fits-all law across the board, the Goddess works directly with her mate, Tehuti, the God of Wisdom, to know when and how to apply the law correctly.

Ma’at embodies all the principles we should strive to live by. She is often depicted in the Judgment Scene at the Weighing of the Heart. When someone’s heart weighed less than Ma’at’s feather, it was an indication that the individual had lived a righteous life. Hence, we must learn to be light-hearted and not take anything to heart, as the expression goes.

Ma’at’s ruling planet is Jupiter, symbolizing expansiveness, wealth, and abundance. Her power gave the universe the very foundations of law and order on which it operates today. Maat is the supreme deity of relationships and love. She teaches us to love and seek nothing in return. Ma’at tells us that everything in life has a form-and-function relationship, and therefore, we are all connected.

Much has been written and discussed about Ma’at. But little has been disclosed about how her ancient power can help you in your life today. When you join Master Qesankh Maa Kheperu for this extraordinary ritual, he will reveal not only how to work and communicate with the deity, but also the specific techniques for bringing your desires to fruition. Pick one area where you are in need, and come to the ritual ready to get the need fulfilled. Everyone attending will receive an amazing free gift that has been magically charged by Master Qesankh Maa Kheperu.

Ritual Agenda

·  Opening to the Deity Sebek

·  Talk on the principles of Ma’at

·  Offering to Ma’at

·  Oracle objective reading

·  Meditation to Maat

·  Performing invocation


·  Closing ceremony

Donations are welcomed, but not required. Please try to wear Ma’at’s color, which is blue. You may also wear white.

Sunday, September 27, 2:00 pm

CRS 123 4th Avenue, 3rd Floor, NY, NY

results.description:
PLEASE READ THE INFORMATION BELOW CAREFULLY, ESPECIALLY THE BOLD TYPE.

If you are registered for this walk and can't attend, please change your RSVP online from "YES" to "NO." There is no need to post why you can't make the event. Thank you.

THERE WILL BE A STREET FAIR ON ATLANTIC AVENUE UP TO 4TH AVENUE, WHICH IS ABOUT ONE AND A HALF BLOCKS AWAY FROM THE MEETING PLACE. SO WHEN YOU ARE EXITING THE ATLANTIC AVENUE SUBWAY STATION, FOLLOW THE SIGNS THAT LEAD YOU TO THE FRONT ENTRANCE OF THE BARCLAY CENTER ARENA BECAUSE IT WILL BE LESS CROWDED. THE MEETING PLACE IS THEN DIRECTLY ACROSS THE STREET FROM THE FRONT ENTRANCE OF THE BARCLAY CENTER ARENA. 

This is a sociable walk along a very scenic route filled with interesting places. Although I will comment on some things (Gilded Age mansions, Satmar lifestyles, etc.) along the way, this is not one of my walking tours.

This walk is about 4 miles and moderate paced (not slow paced). If you think that you will be lagging behind, then this type of walk is not good for you.

Description: We'll walk from Fort Greene to South Williamsburg, Brooklyn. First, we'll walk through the neighborhoods of Fort Greene (tree-shaded streets lined with an assortment of beautiful Victorian-era townhouses) and Clinton Hill (once a fashionable suburb for the wealthy Gilded Age families.) In Clinton Hill, we'll walk past a street lined with free-standing Gilded Age mansions, which is a rarity in New York City.

If it is open, we'll then briefly stop at Pratt Institute to look at the Pratt Institute's magnificent Sculpture Garden Park, the largest in New York City.

Afterwards, we'll go to South Williamsburg, which is the center of activities for the reclusive large Satmar sect known for their social isolation from most forms of secular culture. In South Williamsburg, we'll then walk up Lee Avenue (lined with Satmar businesses/stores and baby carriages). The Satmars will be preparing for the joyous Sukkot holiday (also known as the Festival of Booths), which begins at sunset on Sunday, September 27th. Thousands of Sukkah huts will be sprouting all over the neighborhood on rooftops, and balconies, in front of yards, streets, and so on. These Sukkah huts will be in various shapes, sizes, and colors and is where the Satmars will have their meals for the next eight days.

Just north of South Williamsburg is the Hipster section of Williamsburg. (The Satmars call the Hipsters the Artisten—the Yiddish name they use for the bewildering newcomers.) 

Below are Pratt Institute's Sculpture Garden Park, which has about 50 sculptures displayed each year.

Below are the Satmars shopping on Lee Avenue in South Williamsburg, Brooklyn. This was during the Meetup's Fort Greene to Williamsburg walk on September 22, 2014. (Photo JB)

Below are some Sukkah huts.

Cost: The cost of this event is $2 per person, which is paid at the start of the This is for the organizer's Meetup preparation costs and fees.

Meeting Time: The meeting time is (after lunch) at 2:00 PM.

Meeting Place: The meeting place is outside of the side entrance to the Atlantic Terminal Mall in Brooklyn, NY. This side entrance is on the right side of the Mall, which has the spacious plaza with the metal benches. This side entrance is next to the Guitar Center Store. This side entrance is also right across the street from the front entrance to the Barclay Center Arena. 

Before the walk, restrooms are available in the Target Department Store in the Atlantic Terminal Mall. These restrooms are located upstairs near the cashiers.

(For some reason, when you click on the address of the meeting location on the google map, you might get a map pointing to the wrong location. This is a computer glitch, so just ignore it. Please read carefully the instructions in the above "Meeting Place" paragraph and see the photo below for the exact location of the meeting place.)

Below is the side entrance of the Atlantic Terminal Mall. The Guitar Center Store is to the right of this side entrance. We are meeting in front of this side entrance.

Transportation Options: Take the D, N, Q, R, 2, 3, or 4 subway train to Atlantic Avenue. The Atlantic Avenue/Pacific Street station has many subway platforms, stairways, and tunnels, so allow extra time to get to the meeting place. The Atlantic Terminal Mall is above the subway trains and LIRR.

Finishing Time: This walk will finish about 5:00 PM or so in South Williamsburg, Brooklyn.

Finishing Place: At the end of the walk, we'll be at the M or J subway lines on Marcy Avenue and Broadway.

Rainy weather cancels the walk. Therefore, if it is raining, or the forecast is for rainy conditions, I will post a cancellation notice Sunday morning. If I don't post a cancellation notice, I plan to be at the meeting place. If I do post a cancellation notice, I will also post a cancellation notice in the Discussion Board.

If you are registered for this walk and can't attend, please change your RSVP online from "YES" to "NO." There is no need to post why you can't make the event. Thank you again.

Below is an old photo of the Gilded Age mansion at No. 241 Clinton Avenue in Clinton Hill, Brooklyn. This was built for Standard Oil businessman Charles Pratt's son Charles Millard Pratt. Today it is the residence of the Roman Catholic Bishop of Brooklyn. (Photo Office for Metropolitan History [Unidentified Photographer, circa 1900])

Below is an old photo of another Gilded Age mansion at 229 Clinton Avenue In Clinton Hill. This was built for Standard Oil Businessman Charles Pratt’s son Frederic and Frederic’s wife, Caroline Ladd Pratt. Today it is the home to the President of Pratt Institute. (Photo Brooklyn Museum [Unidentified Photographer circa 1905] )
results.name: Fort Greene to South Williamsburg Walk (Sept. 27)

results.description:
Please join us for September 2015's discussion of James Hannaham's, "Delicious Foods". I'll be eagerly anticipating an awesome conversation!

Looking forward to seeing you there,

Christina ***Book Synopsis ***
Darlene, once an exemplary wife and a loving mother to her young son, Eddie, finds herself devastated by the unforeseen death of her husband. Unable to cope with her grief, she turns to drugs, and quickly forms an addiction. One day she disappears without a trace. 

Unbeknownst to eleven-year-old Eddie, now left behind in a panic-stricken search for her, Darlene has been lured away with false promises of a good job and a rosy life. A shady company named Delicious Foods shuttles her to a remote farm, where she is held captive, performing hard labor in the fields to pay off the supposed debt for her food, lodging, and the constant stream of drugs the farm provides to her and the other unfortunates imprisoned there. 

In Delicious Foods, James Hannaham tells the gripping story of three unforgettable characters: a mother, her son, and the drug that threatens to destroy them. Through Darlene's haunted struggle to reunite with Eddie, through the efforts of both to triumph over those who would enslave them, and through the irreverent and mischievous voice of the drug that narrates Darlene's travails, Hannaham's daring and shape-shifting prose infuses this harrowing experience with grace and humor. 

The desperate circumstances that test the unshakeable bond between this mother and son unfold into myth, and Hannaham's treatment of their ordeal spills over with compassion. Along the way we experience a tale at once contemporary and historical that wrestles with timeless questions of love and freedom, forgiveness and redemption, tenacity and the will to survive.
results.name: "Delicious Foods" by James Hannaham *Special Author Appearance

results.description:
Our colleagues at St. Francis Xavier Gay Catholics Group made us aware of this upcoming talk by Sister Jeannine Gramick - The Co-Founder of New Ways Ministries (http://www.newwaysministry.org/) this coming Sunday - September 23.  Short Reception to follow the talk.

All are welcome and this is a Free-Will Contribution Event. For more specific information on the event, you can also contact <a>[masked] Background</a> information on Sister Jeannine Gramick from the www.newwaysministry.org site is below:

Sr. Jeannine Gramick, SL

Jeannine Gramick, a Roman Catholic nun, was born in 1942 and educated in Catholic grade and high schools in Philadelphia. She moved to Baltimore in 1960 to join the School Sisters of Notre Dame.  She taught mathematics in high school in the 1960’s and was an Associate Professor of Mathematics at the College of Notre Dame of Maryland in the early 1970’s.

While engaged in study for her doctoral degree at the University of Pennsylvania, Sister Gramick became friends with a gay man and began a church ministry to lesbian and gay people. She organized religious services for people with a homosexual identity who had left the Catholic Church because of prejudice against them. Gradually the people she met came to understand that God loves all persons, regardless of one’s sexual orientation, and that the Catholic Church began to welcome them with compassion and love. She has conducted spiritual retreats and pilgrimages to holy places and shrines for lesbian and gay people, their parents, families, and friends.

Sister Gramick helped to begin three organizations for Catholic lesbian and gay people. In addition, she co-founded New Ways Ministry, a Catholic social justice center working for the reconciliation of lesbian/gay people and the church.

Sister Gramick has traveled throughout the English-speaking world to address groups about sexual identity. She advances the judgment of the American Psychiatric Association that a homosexual identity is not a sickness but an alternative sexual orientation. Consequently, she promotes dialogue, discussion, and education to eradicate myths and stereotypes about lesbian and gay people. She advocates the acceptance of gay and lesbian people as full and equal members of religious, civil, and social groups. She believes that only if all people are treated with dignity and respect will there be peace and harmony in the world.

Sister Gramick has written and edited numerous articles and books. Her books include Homosexuality and the Catholic Church, Homosexuality in the Priesthood and Religious Life, The Vatican and Homosexuality, Building Bridges: Gay and Lesbian Reality and the Catholic Church, and Voices of Hope: A Collection of Positive Catholic Writings on Lesbian/Gay Issues. Building Bridges was translated into Italian and published as Anime Gay: Gli omosessuali e la Chiesa cattolica.

For more than 30 years, Sister Gramick has worked for justice and peace for sexual minorities. For approximately 20 years, her religious community, the School Sisters of Notre Dame, assigned her to this church ministry. Because of opposition to her work and consequent political considerations in her church, in 2001 she transferred to the Sisters of Loretto, another community of Catholic nuns. The Sisters of Loretto support her in her ministry of education and advocacy on behalf of lesbian and gay people.

Sister Gramick is the subject of a documentary film, entitled In Good Conscience: Sister Jeannine Gramick's Journey of Faith, by the Peabody and Emmy award-winning director, Barbara Rick.

Many groups have recognized her work in this pioneer ministry. Some of these groups include the National Coalition of American Nuns, the Loretto Community, the Paulist Community, Call to Action; Dignity USA, the University of Notre Dame and Saint Mary’s College, Pridefest America, Parents and Friends of Lesbians and Gays, and the American Psychological Association. She received the 2005 Peace Prize from the Santa Claus Foundation in Turkey for her work with sexual minorities. She was named a 2006 Laureate of the International Mother Teresa Awards for her role as a human rights activist.

Sister Gramick holds a Ph.D. in Mathematics Education from the University of Pennsylvania and an M.S. in Mathematics from the University of Notre Dame. She served on the national boards of the National Assembly of Women Religious, the Religious Network of Equality for Women, the Lambda Legal Defense and Education Fund, and the Women's Ordination Conference. She is currently an Executive Co-Director of the National Coalition of American Nuns. She is strongly committed to justice and peace for humanity.              

You can contact Sr. Gramick at gramick(at)juno(dot)com.
results.name: TALK: "Church & LGBTQ Catholic Community" by Sister Jeannine Gramick

results.description:
Photograph Manhattan from the top of 30 Rockefeller Plaza. Its a great time to photograph the plaza and 5th Ave before hand and catch the sunset and full moonrise from The Top of The Rock. Come on out, practice what you've learned. Learn something new. Share in the photographic community.

The fee includes a class on full moon photography with handouts and timed admission (we can go up when we want) and no waiting at the box office.

Who's in?

(Tripods are not allowed but I have several solutions)

(Co-Leader- Francisco)

• PLEASE ARRIVE EARLY TO START ON TIME !! Game starts when we have at least 10 players.

Rules explained at the game.

Be Positive - Constructive criticism after the game is way better than you yelling at me and complaining during the game.


Be Safe - Want to kick someone really hard? go take jiujitsu. We like our shins.

Be 2! - Teamwork. It takes 2 to complete every pass.

Be Generous! - Not just your money (though it helps). We want clapping and good cheers.

The proceeds go to our charity network: http://ps2g.org/charities

All RSVPs are final. No credits or refunds. (It's all for charity anyway)

• Minimum 10 RSVPs needed for any game. Games may be canceled if this number is not reached 1 hour before Game Time (not meetup time).

If the game is canceled, request a refund by filling out this form.

If you can't afford the meetup fees, please visit our website to learn how to become a game leader. Game Leaders play for free. http://ps2g.org/gameleaders

PS2G raises money for charities that use soccer for social good restoring dignity where it's been lost through the game of soccer. We share the impact of this movement through multiple channels and promote generosity on the field through safe and supportive play.

results.description:
Join us for an afternoon of Japanese & English language exchange! We will be meeting this Sunday, February 1, from 3-5PM--45 minutes of each language, and then free exchange during the last half hour.

This week's discussion will be about waking up early.

For learners of English, please read this article before coming on Sunday:
Sleep Scientist Says Starting Work At 10 A.M. Is What Nature Intended

And for learners of Japanese, please read the translated version:
睡眠学者が「朝10時から仕事始めるべきです」と語る理由


And please check out our Memrise online flashcard deck for remembering the difficult words in these articles. Check out the link below!
Why So Early?! Ameripon 9/27/15

***Not sure what Memrise is or how to sign up? Then click here.***</a>

We would like to have 10 Japanese learners and 10 English learners attend this event, so please check the RSVP list before signing up. If you see that your section is already full, please send me an e-mail at [masked] and I will put you on waitlist in the event that a spot becomes free.

And please take our <a href="http://goo.gl/forms/cSUUUJMxY0">survey if you haven't already. We want to know what interests you and what Ameripon can do to better your English/Japanese learning experience.

Looking forward to chatting/しゃべる'ing with all of you this Sunday. お楽しみ！

-Kevin（ケビン）
Organizer, Ameripon
results.name: Ameripon Japanese & English Conversation Exchange

results.description:
Introducing our new Meetup! No need to prep for this one. Just bring up to 1,500 words of writing—a flash piece or an excerpt from a longer piece you are working on or the outline of an idea that you need help with. People are encouraged to bring work generated through Writing Room exercises.

The format works like this:

Each writer gets a total of up to 30 minutes, which begins when they read their piece aloud or give a pitch of their idea in five minutes or less. We will be able to do 4 or 5 pieces/ideas per meeting. Names will be drawn at random. (Anyone whose work is not chosen will get priority at the next meeting.) You don’t need to bring work to attend and no advance preparation is required.

Please feel free to bring drinks or snacks. Arielle has power strips to plug in and space to write at both a table and on couches and chairs. Also, there are two cats, in case anyone has allergies.

See you there!

results.description:
We will have a bit of a hiatus this summer return together at the end of August. Our next Common Ground meetup will be Sunday, May 30, at 3:00 pm. We already began using a new book to help us focus our discussions: Einstein's God: Conversations about Science and the Human Spirit.  It has already engendered some interesting and spirited conversation. As promised, we will provide a chapter by chapter synopsis for each of our meetings.

For those who like Twitter, we also have a Common Ground twitter feed we began with our humanist and religious friends in the United Kingdom in 2013. You are welcome to join the conversation, share and discover how others see this dialogue.

We will share more specifics too of our dialogue conference at Rutgers University this fall with the American Humanist Association, and the convening of the World Parliament of Religions in Salt Lake City afterward.

Happy Summer, Carl

results.description:
**This meetup will be catered to men**

Hey guys,

Dealing with rejection can be painful when it comes to approaching strangers.....but also quite liberating.  
The worst part is you constantly reject yourself in your own mind which sets up the expectation of failure.

The truth is, where does rejection stem from? Rejection is all ego-based thinking but it's a part of the game. However, the way we all deal with it is based on our interpretation.

We are going to go over a few concepts on how to interpret rejection in order to liberate yourself:
1 - Giving VS.Taking

2 - Light Rejection vs. Hard Rejection

3.  Turn Rejection into Opportunity 

Note: 
Place will be Cap21:
18 E. 18th St (Cap21) above Union Sq, New York, NY
Room 604

Cheers,

Manny

results.name: Dealing with the Fear Of Rejection

Hope to see you there,
Greg

venue.name: Hamilton Park

results.description:
RARE -SUPER HARVEST BLOOD MOON - SEPTEMBER 27TH, 2015

We are about to witness a rare celestial event on September 27th, when we will get an opportunity to see a "Total Lunar Eclipse" that will give a copper color to the moon thus earning it the designation of a "Blood Moon". Besides which, the moon will be closest to Earth earning it the distinction of, "Super Moon". Finally, because of the time of the month/year that this event occurs it has the unique distinction of being referred to as a "SUPER HARVEST BLOOD MOON". (How cool is that?)

To make things even more interesting for photographers, sunset will occur at 6:48 p.m. on the 27th and moon rise will occur at 6:36 p.m. That means that conditions for photographing this event should be perfect. The moon will break the plane of the city about 5 minutes after actual moon rise and should appear very large in the afterglow of the sun. The lunar eclipse begins at 8:12 and gets interesting at 9:07, reaching total at 10:11 p.m.

Sue Schwer, Malcom Kahn and Martin Joffe will host a workshop/photo shoot of this event.

All participants should arrive at the junction of Eldorado Place and Hudson Place in Weehauken, NJ by 4:00 p.m.

For those of you who are not familiar with this location, we'll be photographing from Hamilton Park located high up on the Weehauken Cliffs. The location is across the river from mid-Manhattan (42nd Street). The location also had pilings in in the foreground making for an ideal scene.

Malcolm will then present an on location workshop on how to best photograph this rare celestial event with a backdrop of the Manhattan skyline. We will have time to practice our techniques while catching the glowing sun's reflections on the city before sunset and moonrise occurs. (As avid photographers, your tour leaders are also excited about this unique event and will be shooting the moon rise alongside the class.)

Because of the timing and duration of the historical event, AIP will provide an assortment of deli wraps as well soft drinks. (It won't be fancy but we won't go hungry.)

We will also be hosting a second visit to Weehauken on Monday the 28th since the moon will rise at 7:16 p.m. during Nautical Light and give us a beautiful deep blue sky over the city. 

The return visit on the 28th will not offer a workshop but will host a simple photo shoot complete with an assortment of deli wraps and soft drinks.

Anyone interested in the second photo shoot on the 28th will need to resister separately for that event.

Recommended equipment:

- A camera (duh), a sturdy tripod (with pano capabilities if you intend to stitch pictures together), lenses (wide angle to telephoto; e.g., 16-35, 24-70,[masked], or primes in this range; tel extenders are also useful), a small flashlight or headlamp, a small folding chair or camping stool (we will be there for a long time), a small umbrella (the wind can be strong in this location and an umbrella can be useful to prevent camera shake during long exposure shots).
results.name: Super-Harvest Blood Moon To Shine on Sept. 27th, 2015

All participants should arrive at the junction of Eldorado Place and Hudson Place in Weehauken, NJ by 4:00 p.m.

For those of you who are not familiar with this location, we'll be photographing from Hamilton Park located high up on the Weehauken Cliffs. The location is across the river from mid-Manhattan (42nd Street). The location also had pilings in in the foreground making for an ideal scene.

Malcolm will then present an on location workshop on how to best photograph this rare celestial event with a backdrop of the Manhattan skyline. We will have time to practice our techniques while catching the glowing sun's reflections on the city before sunset and moonrise occurs. (As avid photographers, your tour leaders are also excited about this unique event and will be shooting the moon rise alongside the class.)

Because of the timing and duration of the historical event, AIP will provide an assortment of deli wraps as well soft drinks. (It won't be fancy but we won't go hungry.)

We will also be hosting a second visit to Weehauken on Monday the 28th since the moon will rise at 7:16 p.m. during Nautical Light and give us a beautiful deep blue sky over the city. 

The return visit on the 28th will not offer a workshop but will host a simple photo shoot complete with an assortment of deli wraps and soft drinks.

Anyone interested in the second photo shoot on the 28th will need to resister separately for that event.

Recommended equipment:


- A camera (duh), a cable release, a sturdy tripod (with pano capabilities if you intend to stitch pictures together), lenses (wide angle to telephoto; e.g., 16-35, 24-70,[masked], or primes in this range; tel extenders are also useful), a small flashlight or headlamp, a small folding chair or camping stool (we will be there for a long time), a small umbrella (the wind can be strong in this location and an umbrella can be useful to prevent camera shake during long exposure shots).

Over all you can receive a <a>serve</a> and get it to the setter, reliably serve  and hot the ball over the net.  

Here is a <a>video</a> of the level of <a>play</a> we <a>expect</a> at the bare minimum .

results.description:
Welcome to the inaugural North Jersey Poly Potluck!
Poly Friendly people gathering together to share food and community in Northern New Jersey.

"Relationships thrive when they are supported in a community that holds them sacred." Lisa, Event Host
What to expect: Poly friendly gathering for all ages, genders and relationship descriptions.
This is a relaxed, casual event for experienced Poly's, newbies, curious, sexuality positive and open minded people. And anyone who enjoys community, transparent communication and intimacy.

This is come as you are space. Share what is true for you now; relate with each other, ourselves and grow a community, cultivate relationship skills and to have some light hearted fun!

The formal discussion circle starts with a topic and is open to questions and concerns after the topic discussion. For the first gathering it seems to make sense to discuss "What is Polyamory? :: How Do You Do It?"

For the potluck, bring your favorite dish or dessert, enough for yourself and to share with 6 people. Include ingredients written on index cards for people with food allergies. This is an alcohol free event. Soft drinks will be provided by the host.

The event is Poly Family Friendly, kids are welcome and must be supervised by the adults who bring them. Teens and children are "at choice" to sit with the adults in the discussion group as long as they agree to the rules of the circle. Anyone of any age who becomes disruptive or disrespects boundaries will be asked to leave the discussion circle. Contact Lisa at [masked] for information.

This Poly Family Friendly event will be held at a private home in Bergen County (NJ). (About 20 minutes drive from the George Washington Bridge) Exact address will be emailed to people who RSVP with their contact information or via Meetup.com.
Include the number of Adults and Ages of Children in the RSVP.

Order of Events::

4:30 to 5:30 PM:: Informal Introductions; Eat and Socialize
5:30 to 6:30 PM:: Facilitated Discussion: Sept. "What is Polyamory?"

6:30 to 7:00 PM:: More Informal Socializing

7:00 to 7:30 PM:: Clean up and Good-Byes 'Til Next Time

Contact Lisa at [masked] for information.

Who are the Event Hosts?

Lisa Sandhusen

Lisa Sandhusen is a Conscious Parenting Peer Educator, Post Partum Doula, Peaceful Birth Advocate, Poly Activist, Transformational Coach, Sexuality and Relationship Educator and Bellydancer. She brings her 15 years of experience as a Parent of two active children who have put her through the paces of 'parenting differently'.
Her warm and casual presentation style is comfortable and puts everyone at instant ease. Her natural and intuitive leadership inspires truly meaningful conversations that enable people to explore the depth of their emotions in a light and playful atmosphere.
Contact Lisa for Conscious Conception Coaching, Post Partum Doula Services and/or Personal Coaching at [masked] or call[masked] (mobile)
results.name: North Jersey Poly Potluck

Click the link below to purchase a ticket to this event:


https://www.eventbrite.com/e/nyac-experience-after-hours-tour-the-dyckman-farmhouse-museum-tickets-18681498866


Join New York Adventure Club on September 27 for an after-hours tour of the Dyckman Farmhouse, a Dutch Colonial style farmhouse built in 1784 that is the last remaining one of its kind in Manhattan. 

 
Our visit to the Dyckman Farmhouse Museum will take us through the historic rooms and garden to uncover the history behind the Dyckman family, and hear the story of rural Northern Manhattan, a landscape and a lifestyle that disappeared in the transformation from farming community to urban neighborhood. 

 
Afterwards, we'll grab a bite to eat at a local eatery!
results.name: NYAC Experience: After-Hours Tour @ The Dyckman Farmhouse Museum

results.description:
Wall Street Historic Tour is unusual walking path that brings you to some of the most important historical points in the history of America as lived in New York City. You will see the early settlement excavation which began in 1624 under the city’s original name- New Amsterdam. You will learn about the lifestyle and rules of the Dutch settlers. You will see Liberty Hall and visit George Washington’s personal pew in church, his favorite tavern, and visit Wall Street where across from the stock exchange, he was sworn in as the first president of the United States. Nearby, visit he first park in New York City and see the shrine of Ann Ellizabeth Seton,the first American Born Catholic canonized by a Romanian Pope. This tour includes such sightseeing as:

City Hall

Brooklyn Bridge

St. Paul Chapel

Trinity Church

Federal Hall and Charging Bull

Bowling Green Park

Elizabeth Seton Shrine

Frances Tavern

and more

Ticket is $10, buy here: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/wall-street-historic-tour-tickets-18325451920
results.how_to_find_us: In front of TD Bank 258 Broadway New York, NY, New York, NY

results.description:
Join us as we continue our THRONES Countdown to Season 6!

We start with all of Season 1 and go straight through to the end of Season 5. Guess what? By the time we finish all five seasons together it will be time for Season 6!!! Yay! We can socialize  from 5 to 5:30, then we begin the show at 5:30 promptly. A short intermission for reactions, then the second show. We have to clear out by 8PM.


This week we have:


Episode 3 "Lord Snow"

Episode 4 "Cripples, Bastards and Broken Things"


All are welcome. If you have never watched Game of Thrones before and want to see what all the fuss is about, come on in and be enlightened. If you are a full fledged Maester trying to survive the Long Night between seasons come join us and watch the marvelous series again while vicariously enjoying the newbies reactions to the Game of Thrones.


This is a NEWBIE friendly event so our usual rules do not apply. Please no spoilers about the show or books in this newbie friendly environment (including this comment section). Anything already watched by the group as part of the Countdown is fair game to discuss by all, but no discussing the resolutions of things in the presence of our newbies. (Maesters will have their own anything goes events and time after the show). Newbies are of course welcome to theorize and forecast, but those of us who actually know "shall not pass" the information!

You can BYOF (bring your own food) and BYOB (bring your own beer). There is a 7/11 on 33rd and Madison, a Smashburger on 33rd and 5th, and a Chipotle on 31st and Park (and other eats nearby too). And of course there's some free drinks as well.

results.description:
PICK-UP CO-ED SOCCER GAMES @ CHELSEA PARK  

                                     Check our Facebook page:

          facebook.com/ManhattanInternationalCoedSoccer


                                NO CLEATS OR STUDS ALLOWED

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cR_TuiCA8RM

GAME DESCRIPTION:

Our games are for all levels and people that prefer to play a non-competitive game of soccer, break a sweat while exercising running up and down the field with the ball and all this happening in a very laid-back and non-judgmental environment. Please, arrive 10 minutes before the game so we can get the teams set up.

Game Format:

We'll play three simultaneous games of 8 on 8, with small goals. There will be 6 teams on the field and we will play THREE games, 30 minutes/game. Every 30 minutes we will have a short break and teams will switch to play against different team. Please check our meetup message board on Friday night or before 12.00 pm on Saturday to see what team you are on. This will save us a lot of time on the field.

RULES OF THE GAME:

First and most important rule of the game is to have fun and enjoy the time on the field! Rough play and offensive language will absolutely not be tolerated!!! In plain words, no slide tackling, no pushing and no telling off.

No power shots allowed. No power shots means; you can shoot the ball but not as hard as you can. This doesn't mean that you can not take the shot at all. Kicking the ball or taking the shot on the goal, is of course allowed.

***If you don't sign up for the game, do not show up.***

If you are late for the game, you must wait until the game in progress is over to join your team.

Those that don't comply with these rules, will kindly be asked to leave the field so others can enjoy the game and maybe a two game ban.

Any other questions regarding the rules of the game or anything else, should be directed to the organizer directly or to the assistant organizer/s!!!

Location:

CHELSEA PARK.

Between 27th and 28th street and 10th Avenue.

Take A, C or E to 23rd St and 8th Ave and walk to 10th Ave and 27th St or any subway line to 34th St and Penn Station and walk for about 8 minutes to 28th St and 10th Ave.

What to bring with you:

A pair of sneakers, indoor or turf shoes, shin guards (recommended) and lots of water. There is a water fountain next to the park if you need extra water.

Fee:

You will be asked to pay $9.25 when you RSVP. This $9.25 is used to pay for, facilities permits, meetup fees, Amazon fees, goals, cones, soccer balls etc.

Refunds & Weather Policy:

Refunds will be issued if the RSVP is changed by Wednesday before 12.00PM or if the game is cancelled. The game can be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe like heavy rain, snow or thunder.

After the game we'll go to Molly Wee for a pint or two:

                             Molly Wee Restaurant

                                       402 8th Ave, 

                                 New York, NY 10001

                                    (212)[masked]

                            PLEASE CHECK THEIR MENU!

                                      themollywee.com

PARTICIPATING IN MANHATTAN-INTERNATIONAL-COED-SOCCER ACTIVITIES AGREEMENT:

I certify that I have no known medical or other conditions that could interfere with my participation in Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer activities. I also understand and accept that the practice of soccer, both indoor and outdoor, involves certain risks of physical injury. Therefore, I, individually, hereby release and discharge, Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer Organizer and Assistant Organizers from any and all claims, actions, damages, losses, liabilities, costs and expenses of any kind whatsoever, including but not limited to any claims of negligence, arising out of, resulting from, by reason of, or in connection with my participation in any of Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer programs or activities. Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer Organizer and its Assistant Organizers reserve the right to take and utilize photographs, video, or any type of recording of participating person while engaged in our or associated activities. I consent to Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer use the photograph, video, or recording of me, for advertising, promotional, or related purposes, and waive all rights to compensation and other rights which may arise as a result.

results.description:
PUNTO Space presents:

Nettles Artists Collective's Salon Series​ presents East 3rd Productions' Tennessee Williams Project reading ofThe Rose Tattoo​ 

Nettles Artists Collective and East 3rd Productions have joined creative forces to bring The Tennessee Williams Project to the general public. The Tennessee Williams Project aims to engage citizens with the writer's work through free readings which are followed by an engaging and democratic post-reading discussion exploring the relevance of Williams' work in contemporary society. 

The collaboration will kick off with a reading of The Rose Tattoo as part of the Nettles Artists Collective's Salon Series. The Salon Series exist in the spirit of 17th century French salon gatherings which aim to inspire, provoke and, most of all, engage through conversation. *PUNTO Space is the Nettles Artists Collective's current residence.

**This event is free but space is limited. We thank you in advance for keeping your RSVP with us current.

In the sacred space of your own creation where every member of your Temple will move to their natural resonance of Sound Moving in Meditation.
Often times when many hear the word meditation they believe they must be still. They immediately say "I can't". However, Evan and Luz are aware the mind can be still while the body is moving. Meditation is a state of being.
Give yourself permission to let go of all mental and physical limitations.

This month we'll be going to Hummus Kitchen, a fine Middle Eastern restaurant in Murray Hill.  Kebabs can be had for $19, a hummus dish for much less.  A menu is here.

A $5 *DEPOSIT* is required to RSVP, which will be *REFUNDED* *IN* *CASH* 10 minutes after the event starts.  No-shows and latecomers forfeit their deposit.  You will receive an electronic refund if you change your RSVP to "No" more than 24 hours before the event.

-------------------------------------------------------------------

The title of this article claims that political correctness "doesn't actually exist".  But reading the article, the author is agreeing that it does exist, as a body of ideas that conservatives don't like listening to, so they apply the term "PC" to dismiss and ignore them.  By this logic, she claims that the politically correct are not the censors, the ones labelling them as politically correct are the censors.

I think she misses something.  The politically correct are not satisfied to dismiss and ignore the non-PC ideas they loathe, they want anyone who expresses them punished until they shut up.  While the anti-PC may dismiss and ignore their pleas for "sensitivity" and "inclusion", the anti-PC movement doesn't go so far as to punish those they disagree with.

-------------------------------------------------------------------

I subscribe to, and read, several news magazines regularly, but I get a lot of my news from my Facebook friends.  My favorite activity on Facebook is the political discussions I have with people.

This TED Talk outlines an unfortunate thing about Facebook.  If you have a Facebook friend whose posts you don't "like" very often, the social media site will eventually start showing you less of that friend.  This will leave you in an echo chamber, hearing only from like-minded voices expressing opinions similar to your own.

The solution to this is to seek out Facebook friends you disagree with, and comment on their posts if you're not willing to "like" them.

-------------------------------------------------------------------

It's the wild west on the Internet, with companies frequently getting hacked by criminals, and they're hopping mad, and often want to retaliate.  Unfortunately, while the criminals are not constrained by ethics or legality, the corporations have legions of lawyers telling them "You can't do this, you can't do that.".

Harvest Full Moon & Lunar Eclipse Healing Sanctuary

The Harvest Moon is the full moon that occurs in synch with the fall equinox. It is the time of the peak of the harvest where farmers can work late into the night by the light of this powerful and bright moon. Let us join together to honor the beauty of this moon, harvesting our individual divine gifts, receiving guidance, healing, and support from spirit, and illuminating our hearts.

Energy portals are opened during full moons where profound truth is revealed with synchronicity and grace.

The intense energy of this particular full moon is amplified by the full lunar eclipse- the color of the moon described as the "blood" moon. We will flow with this beautiful energy and align ourselves more deeply with the divine.

• Opening Ceremony

• Community LOVE & more!

Sarah Eve is a culinary shaman, making magic in the kitchen and healing from the heart. She is a certified Usui Reiki master and practicing shaman with a deep love of the healing arts. Sarah Eve began her shamanic studies with Izhak Beery and followed with the late Ipupiara, a Makunaiman of the Ure-e-wau-wau Amazonian tribe. She has completed workshops with Tom Cowan and the 13 Indigenous Grandmothers. The path of healing also led her to work closely with the Santo Daime community, John of God, and crystal energy work in Brazil. Other international trips including Mexico and Central America, Europe, Israel, and Southeast Asia, she encountered sacred spiritual practices and healers in which she is blessed to share and teach. She completed her 200 & 500 hour yoga training with Sri Dharma Mittra. Integrating her experience also as a vegan chef, she uses food as another medicinal tool in achieving whole body health. She assists in creating a safe space in which you can heal you. www.sarahevecardell.com

Amandev is a certified teacher of The Yoga of Awareness in New York City and abroad. Amandev completed a KRI Kundalini Yoga teacher training in NYC with Sat Jivan Kaur and Singh in 2011, is a member of the International Kundalini Yoga Teachers Association, and continued his education to become a Sat Nam Rasayan healer, the art of “deep relaxation in the divine name” with Guru Dev Singh at Mount Shasta through the Center for Contemplative Awareness in Rome, Italy in 2012. Amandev is also a certified Mudra teacher via Sabrina Mesko PHD. He additionally works closely with crystal energy and is a gifted healer, musician, and visual artist, channeling source energy in all that he creates. The name Amandev, translating to “angel of peace that acts as a lion of god”, was received in 2011 by Nirinjan Kaur, Yogi Bhajan’s chief of staff. Amandev emanates his name and a high integrity for truth in all aspects of his life, inspiring and motivating others to connect with their inner joy in harmony with the divine. His goal is to raise global consciousness through love, respect, and abundance. www.ourinfiniteminds.com

results.description:
Breakfast with Buddha - Roland Merullo
When his sister tricks him into taking her guru on a trip to their childhood home, Otto Ringling, a confirmed skeptic, is not amused. Six days on the road with an enigmatic holy man who answers every question with a riddle is not what he planned. But in an effort to westernize his passenger - and amuse himself- he decides to show the monk some "American fun" along the way. From a chocolate factory in Hershey to a bowling alley in South Bend, from a Cubs game at Wrigley Field to his family farm near Bismarck, Otto is given the remarkable opportunity to see his world - and more important, his life - through someone else's eyes.

NY Scifi & Fantasy Presents:

Travel along side Miles Monroe in "Sleeper" as he awakes from a cryogenic hibernation 200 years in the future to find that the America he once knew is now a totalitarian dictatorship. Will he accept the hero's journey?


How will Gary and Wyatt, the two awkward high school geeks of "Weird Science" handle their Frankenstein-esque creation of a beautiful, intelligent woman that proves to be more powerful than they could ever imagine? Will this be their coming of age or a tragic farce?

"Tuning the mind, body, and soul"-Gaynor

The sound and silence meditation group meets every Sunday. The meditation begins with 30 min. of  toning*, 30 minutes of silent meditation, In the last 10 min. there is time for a brief discussion, questions, or sharing.


According to Gaynor (1999, p. [masked]), "Sounds enters the healing equation from several different directions: It may alter cellular functions through energetic effects; it may entrain biological systems to function more homeostatically; it may becalm the mind and therefore the body; or it may have emotional effects, which influence neurotransmitters and neuropeptides, which in turn help regulate the immune system-the healer within. Music is organized sound that has potent emotional effects and stimulates memories, associations, and highly developed  psychological states with clear impact on our healing systems."

 Toning* in your own voice is a very powerful tool for self-healing, relaxation, personal growth, opening creativity, and helping to balance life experiences.Toning is the elongation of a note or tone using breath and voice to assist you to get still enough to meditate.
It is great.....
• If you have a difficult time getting still enough to meditate;
• If you desire higher states of consciousness;
• If your communication energy center seems blocked;
• If you breathe too shallowly;
• If you need immediate grief or stress relief;
• If you're depressed;
• If you need more confidence or zest;
• If you have trouble listening, focusing or being in the moment

We look forward to seeing you at the next scheduled meet-up!Please e-mail me at [masked] if you have any questions or concerns.

results.description:
Full Harvest Moon, Super Moon and Lunar Eclipse for this date

Traditionally, full Moon nearest the autumnal equinox is called the Harvest Moon. During this month, the Moon helps the harvest by providing more light at the right time than other full Moons do. Learn why in our article, "Shine On, Harvest Moon."

September's Supermoon is ALSO the nearest Supermoon of the entire year. When this happens, there are some physical effects, such as elevated tides.

Further, the year's BEST lunar eclipse for North America unfolds on the 27th! Totality begins at 10:11 P.M. (ET) and ends at 11:24 P.M. (ET). See our Eclipse page for more information.

I am going to be doing a Native American full moon ceremony at my house if anyone wants to come. I will have a fire outside if the weather is OK if not we will meet in the basement to participate write the date on a piece of paper and a few things you want to bring into your life in the coming cycle and then a few things that you would like to release that no longer serve you, meditate on these intentions and bring them with you. There cost is $10 for each person
If you have a drum or rattle or anything please feel free to bring it as we will join our energies in a short chant and dance to bring down the moon energy for us. I now have my own full sized native American hand drum so I do like to use it for a bit! Also if you feel so inclined please bring a log for the fire, weather permitting we do this outside around my fire pit.

Hope you can make it.... if not feel free to join in spirit!

With Love and in the Light, Cassie


The Full Moon Fire Ceremony is an ancient one passed down from Incan times to the people living in the Andes.  It is a time for healing, reflection, and gratitude; a time to be able to come to the Fire with your innermost prayers.  Since the Full Moon is such a powerful time in between waxing and waning, it is a time where you can let go of what no longer serves you and you can pray for what you feel would make you more whole and would like to bring into your life.  We pray, release and bring in while knowing that this is what we want. We understand and are open to the reality that it is in the Creator's timing that things happen - not on ours.  Yet, we must meet half way - this is where free will enters and why we chose to stand by the Sacred Fire and pray.  You bring an offering to the Fire that is made from nature that is burnable: a stick, flower, pine cone, etc. Spend some time with the item, and with your intention put into the offering what ever you want to release, heal, or bring into your life.  As we stand by the Fire chanting, drumming, and rattling we are brought closer to the Universal Light Source, or who the Andean people call Wiracocha.

results.name: Full Moon Ceremony

results.description:
Full Harvest Moon, Super Moon and Lunar Eclipse for this date

Traditionally, full Moon nearest the autumnal equinox is called the Harvest Moon. During this month, the Moon helps the harvest by providing more light at the right time than other full Moons do. Learn why in our article, "Shine On, Harvest Moon."

September's Supermoon is ALSO the nearest Supermoon of the entire year. When this happens, there are some physical effects, such as elevated tides.

Further, the year's BEST lunar eclipse for North America unfolds on the 27th! Totality begins at 10:11 P.M. (ET) and ends at 11:24 P.M. (ET). See our Eclipse page for more information.

I am going to be doing a Native American full moon ceremony at my house if anyone wants to come. I will have a fire outside if the weather is OK if not we will meet in the basement to participate write the date on a piece of paper and a few things you want to bring into your life in the coming cycle and then a few things that you would like to release that no longer serve you, meditate on these intentions and bring them with you. There cost is $10 for each person
If you have a drum or rattle or anything please feel free to bring it as we will join our energies in a short chant and dance to bring down the moon energy for us. I now have my own full sized native American hand drum so I do like to use it for a bit! Also if you feel so inclined please bring a log for the fire, weather permitting we do this outside around my fire pit.

Hope you can make it.... if not feel free to join in spirit!

With Love and in the Light, Cassie

This evening is Competitive Play (Intermediate/Advance). Perfect for those who want to step-up their game. 

Having less experienced players in the more intense Sunday night setting is both unsafe and unfair to the other attendees. But all are welcome to attend Friday nights. (Use your own judgement of skill level before signing up for Sunday) 

Players are expected to be able to handle free pass, pass accurately, and most important "BUMP SET SPIKE" with every effort not to just return the ball on the other side. Regular volleyball rules will be more closely enforced

Only players on the ACTIVE list will be allowed to play (No Exceptions).  If you must cancel, allow your spot to be given to someone on the wait list. 


RULES:

-Carrying will be called

-Doubles will be called if too obvious

- NO REDOS on ANY ceiling obstacles

-No top Net touches (Bottom Net is okay)

results.description:
I want to thank everyone who came out for this, What a great show and an amazing meetup. we had so many people we couldnt accomodate all but its was a great show and i hope everyone met each other. Were gonna continue doing this as long as the club lets us. I met some of the most fun and amazing people, the comics were a full top Comedy Central line up too. For those of you who havent been to this, This is a special Meetup, we finally got a deal with Stand Up New York the hottest club in New York City to let us in free of charge and see comics like Amy Shumer, Godfrey, Kevin Brennan and top names, this is NOT an amateur show like alot of the meetups. I just ask that everyone who Rsvp's really do their best to show up AND MAKE IT ON TIME. as you know I dont charge for this meetup so come out see the hottest comedy show and maybe even make some new friends. this sundays line up includes the below.

Ari Shaffir, Gregory K. Nick Griffin, Greer Barnes, Godfrey, Christian Finnegan, Jon Laster, Damien Lemon and pretty much any comic you see on Comedy Central these days drops by and shows up on the lineup who knows who might drop by usually its Amy Shumer or Judah Friedlander.

I will be at the front end of the bar by the iphone charger as usual to meet with everyone and give you tickets for free admission and have everyone sit together so we can all share laughs. Try to be early the show starts at 8 and everyone sits at same table but i do this earlier so all of you can meet your fellow meetup members.

This is a 2 show ticket, so if you show up for the 8 you can stay for the ten also which has a different but also comedy central lineup. Or if you would like to come for the 10 you can just say meetup at the door and they will point you to me.

results.description:
We've planned this now as a weekly meetup, so that everyone in the group can get together even if the moderator can't be there.

If Darren can't make it to introduce everyone (he can't this week), could someone please take it upon themselves to 1) stake out the big table a little early, 2) Lead a go-around-the-horn o? introductions at 8pm, and 3) Time the 60 minutes of writing time and let everyone know when it's 9 pm.

As always,

Please RSVP only if you can make it, and update as soon as possible if your plans change. We have had far too many no-shows.

You will see progress in your writing project by spending the minimum of a single hour per week on it. This is your practice/focus time, so I hope to see you there.

Join other writers for an hour of focused writing!

7-8 pm - Show up early, stake out a spot and either socialize or get a jump on writing.
8:00 - Start. Introductions, and we'll share what we're working on
8:05 - Get down to business. An hour of silence and solid writing!
9:05- Brief follow up. People are encouraged to share experiences & ideas, network or take off as they like. Feel free to keep writing if you've got the momentum going! Be aware Argo closes at 10pm.
If you're spending too much time THINKING about writing, come and join us for a session of focused writing. It may just be "pipe-cleaning" for now, but you'll feel better showing up at the page. No one will see what you've written or give you unsolicited advice.

WHERE: Argo Tea Cafe, Columbus Circle Subway Station. 1792 Broadway.

SOME TIPS:

Argo has plenty of outlets - we will be on the back, large table.
Seats are hard to come by, and I can only save so many, so please, come on time! If you come late, we might have already started.
The music and occasionally nonmember conversation can be loud, so bring headphones too.
WiFi is available with purchase.
It's a little chilly, so if you get cold bring a sweater.
And it goes without saying that buying a cup of joe or a snack from Argo for being nice enough to host us will bring you good writing karma.
If you aren't sure you can make it, please don't RSVP! Come on time or even a little early, as it can be difficult to save seats.
results.name: NYC Shut Up & Write Meetup! - Columbus Circle

results.description:
https://d3mjyf8rb023qs.cloudfront.net/api/file/kyJNmEzSQqCvtQ2F2XPB

Tickets: https://goo.gl/dlh9mo

The Poetry Brothel is a unique and immersive poetry event that takes poetry outside classrooms and lecture halls and places it in the lush interiors of a bordello. Based in concept on the fin-de-siecle bordellos in New Orleans and Paris, many of which functioned as safe havens for fledgling, avant-garde artists, The Poetry Brothel’s “Madame” presents a rotating cast of poets as “whores,” each operating within a carefully constructed character, who impart their work in public readings, spontaneous eruptions of poetry, and most distinctly, as purveyors of private, one-on-one poetry readings in back rooms. For a small fee, all of the “poetry whores” are available for these sequestered readings at any time during the event.
results.name: Poetry Brothel

It is believed this moon signifies the end of days. Seriously look it up LOL. No Kool-aid will be served on this excursion!

Here is the view at Eagle Rock using my SX50 @12MM

Weather forecasts continue to flip-flop. Currently, we will have partly-cloudy conditions on Sunday evening- no rain. The percentage and type of cloud coverage at the time of the event is unclear. Given the rarity of this occurrence, I will not cancel in the hopes we get something good. So to recap the last e-mail, we will meet here:[masked], [masked] a little north of the 9/11 memorial, street address is 1 Crest Drive West Orange NJ.
