results.description:
Dear Members,

We will be co-hosting the annual Mid-Autumn Mooncake Festival with two other Meetup groups.

Here are the details copied from the original organizer...

 

The Annual Mooncake Festival is coming up soon!  We are going to host A MEGA CELEBRATION at the BEST ROOF TOP IN CHINATOWN!  It's called City View Lounge on the top floor of Wyndham Hotel in Chinatown:  https://foursquare.com/v/city-view-rooftop-lounge/52744e0111d20efbd46bee82    It has a great view overlooking third ave!   ON THAT NIGHT, THE MOON WILL BE THE BIGGEST AND ROUNDEST OF THE WHOLE YEAR, that's why it's call Mid-autumn Festival, AKA, Mooncake festival!  


 FREE MOONCAKES will be given out at the party (Each person can have 4 pieces of different flavors!The typical mooncake flavors are Egg Yolk,  Taro, nuts (walnuts, mixed nuts, etc.), fruits (prunes, pineapples, melons, lychees, etc.) and vegetables (sweet potatoes, etc.).

Everyone will also get ONE FREE DRINK on us if you arrive before 8 o'clock!  ( soft drinks, beers, or cocktails)

It is $18 if you RSVP early on our meetup site by Sept.28th (CASH ONLY, you still pay at the event) and $25 if you show up at the door without RSVP. 

The Mooncake Party will start at 6:30 p.m., and will end around 9:30 p.m, so come and mingle, taste moon-cakes, practice Mandarin and admire the moon together!  The lounge doesn't serve food, but feel free to bring your own food (No outside drinks allowed though)!

The City View Lounge is on the 19th floor of Wyndham Hotel, so just take the elevator up the top floor and you will see us.  It's 2 minutes walk from Grand Street B,D train station and 5 minutes walk from Canal Street for the N,Q,R,J,Z,4,5,6 trains.
results.name: Mooncake Festival at a NEW Roof Top Garden!!!  (100+ people are expected!)

results.description:
Join Be Social Change for Success DNA - Know What You Do Best & When You Do It Best w/ The Opportunity Lab's Mark Monchek & Jaki Bradley. 

At its core, Success DNA is knowing what you do best, and when you do it best. The most successful organizations and individuals know their success DNA and stick to it- allowing them to replicate successful project time and time again. Success DNA is built on the unique characteristics of an individual or organization, and is the driving force behind a successful business.

 * Doors open at 6:15, class starts at 6:30 sharp *

===========================================

This is a paid class. Be sure to purchase your ticket here: 

</a>

<a href="http://bit.ly/SuccessDNASep28">http://bit.ly/SuccessDNASep28

===========================================

WHAT YOU'LL LEARN

During the class, participants will use a time-tested series of exercises and discussions to analyze past successes (and a few failures) and identify patterns that will eventually form their Success DNA. You will walk away knowing what they do best, and what circumstances bring out your best work.  

WHO THIS CLASS IS FOR

• People want to make a positive difference in the world  

• People who want to work more efficiently

• Social entrepreneurs and nonprofit leaders
 

INSTRUCTOR BIOS

</a>After 25 years of growing entrepreneurial businesses and nonprofits, Mark Monchek’s (<a href="http://twitter.com/markmonchek">@MarkMoncheck) mission is to help entrepreneurs build profitable and meaningful businesses in ways that make the world a better place. As president of The Opportunity Lab, Mark leverages his expertise in executive coaching and consulting to create programs that spark innovation, growth, and acceleration in the social enterprise space. His innovative approach has benefited companies such as Apple, General Electric, The New York Times, The Wharton School of Business, the Harvard Business School Club, Cornell University, YPO, and NBC. He is a passionate storyteller and facilitator of meaningful dialog, and his goal for this workshop is to change participants’ belief about what is possible for their future.

You can learn about Mark’s current work here and find out more about his background here. 

Jaki Bradley is the Marketing and Operations Associate at The Opportunity Lab and a graduate of UNC- Chapel Hill where she studied Multimedia Journalism and Theatre. She has previously worked with the Policy and Econmic Research Council, the Signature Thearte, and a a freelance graphic & web designer. When she is not work pursuing her marketing passions, Jaki directs plays and musicals around New York City.

SPACE PARTNER


The Centre for Social Innovation (@csiSL) is a home for nonprofits and social entrepreneurs in New York City. They’re building a movement of passionate people committed to a better world. Learn more at http://nyc.socialinnovation.org/ 
 

Refund Policy: Refunds can be issued in full up to 48 hours prior to the start of the class by contacting Be Social Change.
results.name: BSC Class: Success DNA - Know What You Do Best & When You Do It Best

results.description:
Aside from our League play we offer Open Play 6 days a week. 1 hour and 45 minute sessions only $10 midweek.

Format: 3 teams of 5 per court. Score by 1’s. Games to 7. Winner stays but must sit after 2 games. No refs. Call your own. Our moderator will help things along. All players must bring a white and a dark shirt (not grey). This is a friendly run. Anyone with the wrong attitude will not be allowed back. Age: 21+

***Please note- RSVP'g on Meetup will not reserve your spot. Please go to our website to sign up.*** A credit card payment is required to reserve your space. Just click the session that interests you.

http://www.nyurban.com/basketball/open_play_bb.html

We will send you a confirmation email. Show up at the Gym with I.D. We will have you on our list but please bring your receipt. No payment at the door.
results.name: Basketball Open Play - Chelsea  A-B Level

results.description:
These Psychic Development and Spirit contact classes are created for people who are passionate committed and sincere about developing their Intuition, Psychic abilities and contact with Spirit.

If you have always believed you are psychic, or have seen and felt Spirit during your life, or you feel compelled to explore this part of yourself- you will love this class. Please bring an open Spirit, curiosity, enthusiasm and a belief in the possibility of many Univeses, star systems and Spirit beings and ancestors..

In this class you will Experience:

. Meditation 

. Developing Your Clairvoyance, Clairsentience, , Clairaudience, Clairscent, and Clairgustance.

. Work with Spirit Guides, Gate Keepers, Spirit Teams as well as ancestors and loved ones in Spirit.

. Explore Your Dreams for their deep , ancient and powerful symbols that connect you to the Spirit universe.

. Psychometry: Reading the energy imprints of objects as a way of focusing Psychic impressions and Mediumship.

. Photograph Readings: Tuning into the life experiences of people in photos beyond physical sight,  3D emotion, impressions to connect at a deeper level.

. Psychic and Mediumship Readings for other members of the class.

Developing your Intuition accelerates your success  in all areas of your life. Some people may choose to become professional Psychics and Mediums. Others will use their gifts to enhance business, career,relationships and learning about their life path and the universe we all live in

This is created for your development and for people share a passion for this work. Psychic and Mediumship Circles are most dynamic and powerful when people come on a continuous basis. 5 sequential weeks are a required starting point to see your development take off!!!!

After the 5 Week class, you can continue on, or take a break and come back..
results.name: Explore Seen. Unseen Contact Spirits

results.description:
This month, let's do something a little different. Rather than picking topics under broad themes such as history, techology, ethics, etc., Paul has suggested we discuss that human bond called Friendship. Here are some specific topics (as usual, we'll vote for one at the meetup):

1. Excluding a spouse or family member, when and how did you meet your closest friend(s)?

2. How did any recent friendships get started and then develop over time?

3. How does your current social life differ from what it was in your twenties?

4. What types of things go wrong when an attempt to start a friendship later in life doesn’t work out?

5. Is it more difficult to make friends later in life? Why?

As usual, looking forward to a great discussion!

Note: $4 contribution is now necessary to cover Meetup charges
results.how_to_find_us: We'll have our own table upstairs, as usual
results.name: Let's talk about Friendship

meta.description: Searches for recent and upcoming public events hosted by Meetup groups. Its search window  is the past one month through the next three months, and is subject to change. Open Events is optimized to search for current events by location, category, topic, or text, and only lists Meetups that have **3 or more RSVPs**. The number or results returned with each request is not guaranteed to be the same as the page size due to secondary filtering. If you're looking for a particular event or events within a particular group, use the standard [Events](/meetup_api/docs/2/events/) method.
meta.title: Meetup Open Events v2
